Reviews.Title: “Book through iprefer to get an upgrade and free wireless”
Reviews.Author: gsh_1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stay. in February 2012. The price/value is actually pretty good for New York, as is the location (if you want to be close to the Times Square tourist madness). But I've stayed at a couple of nicer hotels in NY, therefore I just can't give more than 3 points. But it is close to four. The best tip I can give you: Book through the iprefer loyalty programme (iprefer.com). Then you are entitled to a room upgrade if available and free wireless. Problem is that the receptionist had no idea about this, so I had to stay in a standard room the first night, which was probably the tiniest room I have ever seen. I couldn't even open my suitcase properly. The next morning at least they upgraded me with no discussion. The Wireless is actually free anyways on a 1-hour connection cycle, but convenient to have it free for the whole stay so you don't have to log in again all the time. Windows seem to be rare, even my upgrade room only had a tiny one. All in all: For that price certainly one of the best deals you can get in NY. But if you want to stay in a really nice hotel, it may be worth investing that 50-100 bucks more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: SandyRoscommon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at stay hotel for 5 nights in Feb 2012 with my husband. This is a great hotel in the best location possible. 20 seconds will have you in the heart of Times Square. Had a king sized room which was just a perfect size as rooms in New York tend to be on the small side. Hotel staff were friendly & polite & they organised our transfer to the airport when we were departing. Very clean modern hotel, will certainly return to this hotel next time Im in New York which I hope wont be too far away.

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: KaylaRC
Reviews.Content: Last summer, we had the pleasure of staying for a week at Stay. while visiting NYC. We had a great experience and would not hesitate to return again. The location doesn't get any better, being in the middle of Times Square. Walking distance to so many restaurants and just steps away from the bus stop for the touring buses. Very funky decor. The rooms are smallish, but this is not unusual for Manhattan hotels. We felt happy and safe the whole week.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: poprocks77
Reviews.Content: Upscale feeling hotel. reminded me of a European hotel due to small elevators and small room size. We were on 7th floor, so it was very quiet. Overall you cannot beat the price for its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location!”
Reviews.Author: Mike7313
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic trip to NYC! The hotel could not be in a better location & the staff were really friendly. The Queen Room that we had was fairly small with not much storage but did the job & was very clean! All in all we had a great stay. We would definately return here & would recommend to friends / family. The facilities such as the business centre with free internet access was a bonus! One of the only negatives is that there are only two lifts meaning you can be waiting a while. We used the stairs but this obviously isn't always possible with cases etc.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for too tiny room and beds”
Reviews.Author: empiroParis
Reviews.Content: The confirmation for the reservation was saying spacious room: A LIE. Room are small that you can hardly move but the worst is the bed which is good for one person but not more. Special offers are probably fake with misleading pictures of rooms and discounts that attract you. The price will still be too much for what it is. Times square is not the best area to stay in NY anyway so do not make this mistake. It is true it is clean and lobby is trendy but what s the most important thing in an hotel is the bed.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie S
Reviews.Content: Great hotel....amazing location (quite literally 20 seconds off Times Square) meaning you can walk everywhere, but the subway is nearby if you'd prefer. Hotel was clean and very modern. Free use of internet and printing which is great as we booked online for many of the sites and printed our tickets meaning no queuing! Staff were all friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but you spend so little time in your room that it really doesnâ€™t matter. My husband was slightly frustrated as there was no wardrobe or suitcase stand so you did literally get out of bed and almost step on your suitcase! We had no issue with noise except for the first night as it was a Saturday night and the Aspern bar at the hotel was very busy. Other nights we heard nothing! We got a very good deal on our room ($400 for three nights) and for this we were extremely pleased with the hotel, location and staff - we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: trevisa86
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect!!! Literally on Times Squares doorstep!!!! The staff were friendly enough and the concierge Walter was great. He was so helpful. The lobby was very unusual, very modern and contemporary. The room was small but it was fine for us. The only problem with this hotel is the noise. The walls are so thin you can hear everything. The doors slamming, people talking at 4:00am and the cleaning staff shouting to each other from 7am. Not really good for sleeping! We were lucky we were on the 4th floor as the music from the bar is loud enough and when we were walking up the stairs to our room the music only started to die out on the 3rd floor. I would recommend this hotel for the location but if you like your sleep I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It is a good thing it isn't called sleep”
Reviews.Author: 28MKB
Reviews.Content: This started out as a nice hotel. The room was small be clean. The lobby was stylish. The staff were friendly. Then I went to sleep. But by 12:30 I was fully awake again. The music from the bar downstairs was so loud that not only could I hear every word to every song perfectly, but the base was such that the bed vibrated. It was even so loud that I could not hear the TV. I was warned it might be noisy upon my arrival, not that the room would be unusable. When I spoke to the manager they said that the best they could do was change rooms, but that the bar chose to run its business that way and there was nothing they could do about it. The party goes on until 3 in the morning. Bloody miserable and not at all what I had in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and very sentral place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Bmpaulsen
Reviews.Content: Very nice to stay to Time Square. We walked a lot to the different places. Do you want to take a sightseeing buss there is just around the corner. Lot of breakfast-places 1-2 minutes away if you don't eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Upsetting Experience”
Reviews.Author: ehillard
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to write a bad review due to all the reviews from fellow travelers on TripAdvisor. But, I do want to leave my experience with this Hotel. First, I've lived in NYC and I visit 4 times a year. I found this hotel online as a special offer they were having on a weekend in February. It was my birthday so I decided to purchase. The Good Experience: Nice lobby, very hip and close to theatre district, trains & Rockefeller Center. The Bad Experience: small rooms (demand a larger room, don't let them tell you this is Times Square and they don't have any larger rooms, they have larger rooms- you have to get into your NYC attitude unfortunately here.) lowsy customer service, room service (just needed ice for a drink, I was celebrating) and food left in hallway the entire weekend. I do not spend any time in my hotel room except for shower and sleep. The city is the best experience of any city in the world. There are many hotels in the city with good value and wonderful customer service. Stay away from "Stay" in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “All you could want in a Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: LizPontardulais
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 night break at The Stay Hotel. This hotel is literally 50 yards from Times Square. Clean and comfortable, really comfy beds. Towels and beds changed daily. Staff are most helpful, would definitely stay here again, no compalints at all. Don't waste money on bigger and more expensive hotels, everything you want is at this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, right on Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Louandjono
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were expecting the rooms may be quite small, but ours was very generous in size! Great amount of space, nice clean room and AMAZING location. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Met my high expectations!”
Reviews.Author: kbeck45
Reviews.Content: Let me first say, I did a lot of looking before I finally booked our hotel for our NY trip, as every hotel had its share of positive and negative reviews. So with that said, I booked this hotel for several reasons. First of which is due to the fact the hotel actually takes time to read and respond to reviewers like myself, showing they actually care. Secondly, I wanted a hotel with character, not a major hotel chain catering to business types. And most importantly, location! I think the hotel delivers on all three. My wife and I were in town celebrating our 5th anniversary, our flight got in very early on Thursday morning and our room was not ready (understandable), but the hotel does provide luggage storage, and it was an easy process to check it in while we went out for the day. When we came back later in the day to check-in to our room, we were pleasantly surprised by a nice bottle of sparkling wine compliments of the hotel to celebrate our anniversary. We stayed in room 902, which was a King room, and while other posters complain about the â€œtinyâ€� rooms, I thought the room size was very appropriate for a couple. Fact is, you sleep in the room, and maybe come back for a quick restâ€¦so this was a very low priority for us to begin with. Bed was very comfortable, room was clean, bathroom was clean, and the room has a safe. Even though we had a street facing room, and with the proximity to Times Square, we did not feel noise was a factor, and slept great each night. As for the elevators that several have posted about, though they are a tad slower than what you might be used to, I would not say our wait for an elevator was ever longer than 3 to 4 minutes if you actually timed it by your watch. So please, do not make a decision about this hotel based on the elevator!! As for the common areas, the lobby is very colorful and they have beautiful, what appear to be blown glass chandeliers. The sitting area is very chic, and the Aspen Social Club has quite the Rockies feel in the middle of NYC, very cool bar/restaurant. On Saturday night, it seemed to be a pretty popular hangout too for those wanting a party or hip bar scene. Finally, letâ€™s talk about location. If you are doing the major NYC heavy hitters, i.e. museums, theatre, Times Square, shopping, this is absolutely the place. Times Square is literally 3 restaurant fronts over from 7th Ave which is the backbone of Times Square. My wife and I also went to Wicked, which was only a few blocks away, went to MoMA (again walking distance), Central Park, Radio City, Rockafeller, 5th Ave shopping, etcâ€¦all a comfortable walking distance. For trips down to the World Trade and Greenwich Village, etc. the Subway lines are all right within 1 or 2 blocks. Great selling point is the 2 Irish pubs across the street and right next door to the hotel! Location wise, you really canâ€™t beat this. Overall, I am very pleased with our choice, and combined with the price we paid per night, the location, and accommodations, I think this is a great value. Great job, Stay. I would definitely recommend, and will be sure to "stay" again the next time we are in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “hotels stay”
Reviews.Author: Darrell T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a decent hotel for the price compare to the others of the same price in the area which I have stayed at before. There was plenty of space in the room the full size fridge and sink and cabinet was a very nice thing to have. The staff was very pleasant to deal with. Overall a very pleasant stay. If your wanting to stay on a low budget this is the hotel I would recommend. I priced lots of hotels before I chose this one and was glad I chose this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: john d
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 night had a few doubts about the hotel after reading a few reviews on here after we had already booked but they were soon gone after we checked in the staff were very helpful as it was my first time in the big apple and wasnt to sure about getting around , the room we were given was on the 3rd floor facing the street wasnt the biggest room but it was very clean and bed was very comfortable and the noise from the street wasn't to much of an issue we were in new york after all so wasn't going to be very peaceful , the location is brilliant step out of the front door and times square is right there so its great for getting about to sightsee on foot . all in all i would highly recommend this hotel would definately stay here again good price for the location and good room the only issue we had really was that my girlfriend left her hand bag in a cab with our phones in so had to use the rooms phone the cancel the credit card and the bill we received was around $250 for 20mins of phone calls which was a big shock upon checking out so if you do stay here don't use the phone but other than that i couldn't speak highly enough of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice location with nice but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: K L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at STAY for 3 nights. The location is ideal and right next to Times square. It is a nice boutique hotel. The hotel has a nice lobby with a bar/club at night. Only complaints was the size of the room and the even smaller bathroom. Price was quite competitive and with its location and hence many things to do/see....only 20mins to central park and right in centre of theatre land... The hotel is worth trying out but be warned rooms are on the small side... I had assumed everything was done in excess... everything except size of the hotel rooms...TBH probably say hotel would be about 3.5, but if had larger rooms then easily a 4...

Reviews.Title: “Simply GREAT Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: laurent066
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights and everything was simply great at the Stay. Hotel! I don't use to put comments on trip advisor to be honest but this time I really wanted to share my experience with others travelers. The staff was very friendly at check-in and during all my stay. Reception team, concierge team, they were all very friendly and always ready to help or give suggestions (e.g: the best way to go to JFK airport or directions in the city). The luggage storage on the last day was very useful as well! The hotel as a GREAT location, it's 20 meters from Times Square, you cannot find better location in NYC! My room (on the 9th floor) was very nice, very clean every day, very quiet and with a great view on Times Square (M&M's building)! It was really not a problem to sleep every night! Before my trip, I read many comments about the Stay like "tiny elevators, slow elevators, tiny rooms,..." so I was naturally a little bid afraid about what I would find...but I can tell you that I travel a lot for leisure or for my job and I can tell you that okay the two elevators are not huge but really not smaller than the average in other hotels, they are not super fast but really not slower than the average in other hotels...they are just normal elevators !! When I stayed, the hotel was almost fully booked and I never had to wait more than 30sec to get into the elevator, and I was on the 9th floor. The rooms are not huge but really really not tiny neither, they are really normal size for a hotel in the heart of NYC just beside Times Square! The room was very clean and with a very nice design decoration, very comfortable bed and clean bathroom with a lot of amenities renewed every day. The safe in the closet was useful to put passports, flight tickets,... There is early everything you need. I really recommend this hotel to everyone, if you are traveling for business or leisure. Finally, I would like to especially thank Mrs Anna from the reception team, she really provide us with a great assistance, smile and quality of service. She is the kind of hotel staff you are looking for when you are traveling at the other side of the world and who can make your stay successful and feel good as a guest of the hotel. Because of staff like this and for all the good points of the hotel written above, I really recommend this hotel if you are looking for a nice room, great location and great staff for a very reasonable price in the heart of NYC ! I hope to come back to NYC asap and I will surely chose the Stay. hotel once again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but house keepers need lots of training or find another job!”
Reviews.Author: Almadevalija
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice at this hotel for business reasons. As I was traveling alone, location was important. It's just a few steps from Times Square so there is no way of getting bored or feeling lonely and shops are open until 1 or 2 AM. Rooms are tiny and I could perfectly hear all the conversations other guests had in the corridor and not only in the room next to mine but in any room located in the same floor. Terrible acoustic isolation (none). So I was awaken at 4am/5am twice when other guests were back. Rooms doesn't have some little details that could make them be a little bit more up to date such as Ipod docks. Even if the people at the front desk and the guys that welcome you were really nice, I cannot say the same about the house keeping service not only they were extremely noisy (I could hear them around 7AM). And on top of that the day I had to check out one of the women knocked on my door at least three times every half and hour (note that it was two hours before check out time). Third time, I had to ask her if she had any problem and instead of answering she stood there staring at me showing her discomfort. I thought about complaining but had my taxi waiting to go to the airport. If you happen to stay there, make sure you are not close to the elevators, that by the way, take years to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but good riddance”
Reviews.Author: Boardin911
Reviews.Content: We are currently finishing our final day stay here, upon arrival my debit card was billed twice (issue has still gone unresolved) and no attempts to make amends or compensations were made for the considerable error. Rooms are very tiny, nice but poorly done. House keeping is VERY noisy from very early morning.... Doors slamming and broken Spanish. Good location but good riddance

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: The rooms could be a little bit bigger, but all in all nice, the location is amazing, you are around all the action, time square is cool, and there's so many good places to eat and shop near by. I would recommend it. Price wise, I found awesome deals using hotsengine.com, it compared every site and hotel imaginable, i didn't need to shop around, found this and booked!

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Randy F
Reviews.Content: After long hours of searching for the right hotel in NYC considering the location, price and of course service. I must say that Stay. Hotel is one of the best. The hotel is right in the center of New York's Broadway Shows and Time Square. Its a few steps away to the nearest Subway, restaurants and shopping! The Lobby was tastefully done and lighted in a chic way. The rooms were beautifully done and clean. Over-all the experience during the week stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Small, stylish and excellently located”
Reviews.Author: JK F
Reviews.Content: You will be living out of your suitcase (rooms are very small)... BUT... everything else at this property is great. Location is AWESOME!!! 15 steps to your right when you rep out of the hotel and BAM!!! you're in New York baby!!! Right in the middle of everything with access to restaurants, pubs, theaters and the Tickets booth for musicals right there on the corner! The rooms are small as I said, very small. But they are very CLEAN (very important) zero bedbugs (I checked). Fresh towels, toiletries, etc. are provided daily by the excellent housekeeping staff. Now let's go to the club level, it's called the Aspen Social Club. There was a specific gentleman there who was the DJ/club manager or something like that. I made a request for a song and he was rude and just blew me off... Dude, just say you can't or say no, don't be jerk and play the role. That said, there are three ladies were over-the-top nice: Monica, Gigi & Stephanie (bartenders/servers) They were very nice and talkative-- the only upside to this "social club". Of course if this spot doesn't pump you up- no worry! Just walk around the corner and there are a whole bunch of other pubs and places to hang. The front desk and bell staff are average, they do their jobs. The concierge is very helpful when called upon. I stayed 6 nights and the rate I paid was between $110-130 p/night, which is very good considering the location. When you check out, the bellman will offer calling a car to take you to the airport or if you want to take the yellow cab: THE CAR COSTS ABOUT $25 MORE!! and $7 if you pay with credit/debit card. Bad job bellman-- should've told me about this. For the airport-hotel, hotel-airport trips---go yellow cab. All else, use the subways/buses and use the yellow cab if you're running late for a venue. The location is truly AWESOME. In summary, I would definitely stay at Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay again and again...loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: BethyM77
Reviews.Content: Being my first time to the city I did not know what to expect. After arriving and we made our way thru the streets to the hotel. Wonderful location. Right off of Time Square. About half a block. The hotel is simple on the outside but WOW inside. From the warm lighting to the fish tanks we felt welcomed. Prompt service to check in. We arrived around 3pm. Room on the 5th floor. Small elevators - but really its New York. Very stylish room. not much in dresser space but a closet for hanging items. The bathroom was perfect. Simple and lovely. The maid service everyday was great. The bed was wonderful. So comfortable. A bose radio in the room and flat screen tv was great. Loved the Aspen club inside it. So trendy and hip.Will defently stay again with them. Great value for the location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Neon-lit oddity in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: Esther H
Reviews.Content: If you want a central location a few steps away from buzzing Times Square, this could be the hotel for you. Just make sure it is a short stay as the rooms are minuscule (how they've crammed a hotel room and bathroom suite in such a tiny place beats me!) and there are just 4 coat hangers instead of wardrobe space! I was attending a Conference at the Javits Centre and it was possible to walk there rather than take the ubiquitous yellow cab. The hotel is a symphony of white - white walls, white leather chairs with blue neon lighting breaking up the tedium. An enormous fish tank hits you in the face on arrival. Food was Mexican and OK. The staff, particularly the concierge, were brilliant and managed to get me an airport taxi at short notice and on a rainy day when parts of Times Square were closed off as the Obamas were visiting the theatre.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rebeccahug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in Times Square..it's about a 5 second walk to the red steps! Me & my husband stayed for 4 nights for a 30th birthday celebration & we couldn't have picked a better hotel! All the staff were lovely. We told the hotel in advance (on facebook) about our celebration & we were upgraded to a king room which was on the 9th floor (902). It was lovely & spacious with a separate closet & big bathroom! We could hear the music & the street below (but it was a small price to pay for the fab location) and we had read the reviews in advance and packed ear plugs! They worked a treat! We loved it, the lobby is just beautiful. The staff did not impose but very lovely when you asked them anything! I honestly couldn't recommend this hotel more! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: BigBumpaGirl
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, tiny rooms but clean. . .

Reviews.Title: “For hipsters and/or short stays only”
Reviews.Author: LisaO22
Reviews.Content: Fortunately, I was only staying for the weekend. Otherwise I might have gone stir crazy. My room was so tiny -- and it had no closet. The good thing, though, was that I wasn't on the 2nd floor where I was warned that the rooms were noisy because of the "Social Event" happening in the club on the 1st floor later that evening. The design of this boutique hotel really is cool, so the younger crowd will find it very attractive. The location is also great -- close to everything in Times Square -- and believe it or not, being on the 8th floor I did not have a lot of street noise and was pleasantly surprised at how quiet my room was. The drawback of being on the 8th floor, however, was trying to get the elevator in a timely fashion. There are only two very small, very slow-moving elevators for the entire hotel. I saw many exasperated guests during my short stay. Not sure why I had to wait 25 minutes for a bowl of yogurt/granola during breakfast service in their restaurant when I was one of two guests. After that experience I decided not to take my chances for lunch or dinner. Still with all of this, I'm giving my experience an "average" rating, rather than "poor" because my room was spotless (including the bathroom) and my bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen85
Reviews.Content: My friend and spend 6 nights during new yearâ€™s eve/day. The location is excellent, just a couple of steps away from the heart of Times Square. Being that this was my third time visiting NYC, i was not expecting a very large room, as most rooms in the city are fairly small. Given the mixed reviews that can be seen here on tripadvisor about this hotel, I was kind of hesitant in booking, but it had really good rates for the time of the year. Upon arriving from the airport, about 7:30am we attempt to check in and the young lady at the reception desk (FATIMA) informs that there is a room available on the fourth floor or we can wait "until later on" for a higher up floor. Since we had just gotten off a 5 1/2 hour red eye flight we decided to take it. As others have mentioned, the elevators are small and slow. It only holds about 2 people with 2 suitcases. So we get into the room which faces the street and it is freezing! The window did not shut properly and you can feel the draft coming in. The room was however clean and well kept. We tried to turn on the heat and it was not working. After noticing that you can also hear all the street noise, we decided to call down stairs and go with the room on a higher floor. I call the reception desk and the receptionist informs me that it is fine, but she does not know when the room will be available because she doesn't know what time housekeeping will get there to clean the next available room. I said that was fine, as we didn't have a problem waiting. She tells me to go ahead and take our luggage down stairs for storage. Before heading down, my friend and I decided to change into some warmer shoes, since we would be without a room for quite some time. As we were changing our shoes, the phone in the room rings and it was Fatima, asking if we were still going down. I said "yes, we are just changing our shoes." She then begins to talk to me with in an irritated tone, saying that if the room is used they cannot change it. She stated that housekeeping informed her that there were still people in the room. Again, I told her we were on our way down, then she completely cut me off and responded, "well you said you were.....ugh...just....ugh" and hung up! I could not believe how rude she was being. We go down stairs so our luggage can be stored and I asked how if she knew more or less when the rooms would be ready and she said, "I don't know, it could be 1, 2, well check in is at 3, so 3 would be best. I can't give you an exact time." I said 'Ok" and we went on our way. We return at 2:45pm and at this point there are people checking in at the desk and also sitting in the lobby waiting for their room. There are also two other girls at the reception area. So I go up to Fatima and ask her if the room is ready and she tell me no. So I told her that we would be sitting in the lobby and if she could please let us know when the room was ready and she ok. We waited and waited and nothing. Finally, like at about 3:45 I go back to the reception desk and asked a different young lady, as Fatima was no longer there and she asked me for my name. I told her and she gave me the new room key. I noticed it was tapped to the pillar next to the reception desk with my name written on it, because I saw the young lady reach for it. Fatima never let us know that the room was ready and instead just let us wait. I also noticed there were other people waiting in the lobby for the room to be ready and it was well past the 3:00 standard check-in time. We get to our room on the 8th floor; this room was much quieter, warm, and was also clean. The next day, we noticed there was no "Don't Disturb" sign. Whatever, we didn't think much of it as we noticed no one else had one. However, for a couple of days during our stay, we were awaken by housekeeping staff banging on our door yelling "HOUSEKEEPING!â€� Really?!?! I think we got housekeeping service done about 3 times throughout our 6 night stay. We decided to stay an extra 3 nights and wanted to inquire what the original rate would be. I called the reception desk and the young man transfers me to reservations. I explained to the reservation agent and he informs me that the rate would have to be determined by the hotel itself because he was unable to pull my current reservation. I explained to him that the hotel receptionist had transferred me to him and he apologized and stated that unfortunately the stay hotel has a bad reputation for doing that. After that, I was DONE and decided to just look for another hotel for the remainder of the trip. I cannot believe the level of customer service that I received from this hotel. I have never experienced anything like this before at any other hotel in NYC or elsewhere. Needless to say, I will NOT be staying at this hotel EVER AGAIN. I suggest you stay somewhere else, unless this is your last resort. The hotel itself is clean and I have really no complaints about the hotel itself, as the rooms are clean and comfortable and it is in a great location. We ended up staying at the Best Western Presidential hotel in Times Square for the last 3 nights of the trip and had not one single problem.

Reviews.Title: “Location was only good thing”
Reviews.Author: Beth H
Reviews.Content: Room was way too small. 8x10. Says "Egyptian cotton sheets, feather duvet, high def tv with 100 channels" all BS. Elevator was 3x3 enough room for 2 people. Restaurant was good. Mac and cheese, the best I've ever had, but pricey......room needed some repairing, not very clean, was looking for bedbugs in the mattress, thankfully none found. Not recommended for 200 per night. Maybe worth 99$ per night. Misrepresented on web site.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only positive about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzyCol
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked a trip to NYC for my christmas present, I am 20 weeks pregnant so we knew this will be the last time we get away before the baby comes. We took a late flight and arrived at the hotel around 00:30/1am, the gentlemen at the desk was welcoming and first impressions of the hotel are great...nice recpetion area amd very modern. The receptionist provided us with our room key. My boyfriend requested a quite room as we knew times square would be fairly noisy. We were placed on the 8th floor in what is described as a spacious queen room. The lift is small and very slow, we arrived on a dark floor with marks on the walls where the wallpaper had been knocked from luggage. My initial thoughts were that the hotel looked tired from the minute the lift doors opened! We opened the door for our room and immediatley see the bed, the room was tiny and no way near spacious...the room had a mild smell of smoke not fresh as if it had been smoked in before...the skirting boards were chipped and marked...wallpaper marks...and the black valance sheet that surrounds the bed was ripped and covered in marks...the bathroom door and front door had fingerprint marks on...I knew straight away I could not sleep in the room so we requested another room...we placed in room 225 on the second floor this room was better but still not what I would call 4 star....we struggled to sleep due to the outdoor noise of times square and the main road...emptying of rubbish...sirens...I would rather sleep in a room with noise than the first room we was in. The following morning after only a few hours sleep we woke up, got ready and packed our bags. I spoke with a very rude receptionist who had no sympathy and did want to hear any feedback her response was 'all hotels in NYC are of this standard' I requested to speak with the manager...we spoke with the manager and she was very apologetic she understood and sympathised with our situation. She told us to enjoy our day whilst she investigated with housekeeping and advised us that our bags will be moved to thew new room when we return. We returned feeling apprehensive about the next room..we were placed on the 9th floor in room 902 the room was what we were originally hoping for, although we were upgraded to a king room, nice large comfortbale bed, bigger room with more space and quiet .The hotel manager left a lovely apology note with fresh fruit and still water. This was very kind.However, there were still some problems they place a throw on the end of the bed, in all rooms they were stained and either need replacing or washed, the bedding consists of a sheet with a duvet and another sheet, every night I would do my best to not let the duvet near me just the new sheets as I assumed the duvets were not washed! The lifts are very frustrating, slow and small, your better off taking the stairs unless you have luggage! We will not be returning to the hotel, the third room was much better and comfortable and I am sure if we were put int there in the beginning our experience would have been very dfferent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tessabear2010
Reviews.Content: All the negative reviews I read were related to the size of the rooms. Since this was a fraction of the Marriott Marquis on New Years Eve and still conveniently located in Times Square area, I gave it a try. I loved the black contemporary motif and subtle lighting in the room, the large screen tv mounted on the wall, mini bar, bar/restaurant next door attached to the hotel. There is a nice wall aquarium in the entrance of hotel. We stayed on the 2nd floor and used the two stair cases avoiding the tiny slow elevator. We were street side and the noise of the crowd and tourists were not a distraction to us but rather entertaining. I didnâ€™t find the room too small. We used the room to sleep in and were busy on the streets of NY other times. The staff was friendly. I will return to this hotel in the future and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a lat minute gem!”
Reviews.Author: winelover11
Reviews.Content: The city was so swamped, we decided to stay after our show. We literally booked our room on lmt.com while sitting in the bar next door, 20 minutes before we checked in! This gave us a great rate and even though the front desk hadn't received the booking yet, he was kind enough to check us in. We had a slight issue with noise from the A/C, but we were sufficiently compensated. Nice room-chic minimalistic decor And what an amazing location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Leeleebelle2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed in stay for 4 nights in January and were so pleased with what we found. The location is unbelievable-stand at the front door and look to your right and you are literally in times square. Walk two streets over to the left and you are on fifth avenue. It's incredible. Our room was a decent size which we weren't expecting after reading many of the reviews here. It was cleaned every day and the bathroom was a great size. View was of a brick wall but that was our only complaint! The concierge was so helpful-she recommended a restaurant to celebrate our engagement and it was spectacular. We were on the 6th floor and had no trouble with noise from the bar below as outlined in some reviews. We also found the lift to be not half as bad as some reviews state. We tended to use the stairs to go down anyway and the lift was always prompt in the lobby. The only warning we can think of is to check your bill upon check out as there were charges for mini bar drinks which we didn't use. This was quickly remedied though without question when it was pointed out. We had a fairytale trip to new York and stay hotel really helped make it special. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent treatment towards the client”
Reviews.Author: Victoria M
Reviews.Content: I have had some experiences in New York hotels, and Stay hotel has surprised me pleasingly. The hotel is nice, in a very good situation and very, very comfortable. And very important, with a excellent treatment towards their clients. We had two problems, one about our reservation, and one with the transfer vehicle, and the hotel solved us the problems better than we expected. I hope to return to stay Hotel in my next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for staying in heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Katelle627
Reviews.Content: This place was great for our 1 night stay! Quiet, clean and literally 10 steps from the hustle & bustle of Times Square. Yes as everyone on TA writes the rooms are small but as long as you know that in advance - whatever - for 2 of us it was perfectly fine. Hotel has a very modern feeling and room was very clean. Agree with everyone else that the elevator is slow and small but definitely would not NOT stay here because of it. We just took the stairs down every time we left our room. Lobby looks pleasant and cool to hang out with a laptop or drink from the Social Lounge. I'm glad we found this place and will likely be back.

Reviews.Title: “great location, terrible room cleaning”
Reviews.Author: nenhum_11
Reviews.Content: the location is perfect for those who want to stay around times square and other major tourist attractiions. However, the room cleaning is terrible. When we arrived there was garbage from the last guests under our ber and, surprise, three days later it was still there. Only after we asked especifically at the front desk the problem was solved. The concierge is excellent, really good. Keep in mind that there is a disco club at the ground floor on tuesdays and saturdays nights. We had no problem with the noise, but we felt a bit unsecure as anyone could take the elevators to other hotel floors.

Reviews.Title: “i love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mahleen
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights (christmas eve and christmas day) and just came back. the lobby is chic,modern and comfortable chairs. their christmas decorations are just right (not too much and not traditional.) clean, and very comfortable double beds. we had corner room so, i guess it's bigger than the other rooms. we had early checked in (12:15p), that was very nice and accommodating by the staff. thanks to the asst. manager on duty! she cares about the needs of the guests. we were told upon check in that their restaurant is open from 7-4am and that they have karaoke, dancing, room service, etc. you don't have to go out and have fun! it's right across double tree hotel on the corner but, very affordable and newer property. the elevator is smaller but we're party of four and we fit in with luggages. their shower area is huge and the amenities are very nice. i've stayed at W, Metropolitan, Marriot, etc. in NYC, and i like this place a lot better. location is the best. you're right on time square without the noise. it's walking distance to everything. we left our luggages after we checked out and picked it up in the evening, no problem. they also have security by the door. you will feel safe here. i would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Silence, despite of location”
Reviews.Author: Billybrazil
Reviews.Content: Open your eyes and you are 30 meters far prom Times Square. Close tour eyes and you can sleep as a king. Stay Hotel is an excellent choice for whom want to visit NYC and its magical night life. It is near Metro, buses (7th Ave and Broadway), walking distance to Central Park, MoMa, 5th Ave. But even in a busy location, there is no noise in the rooms. It is like a boutique hotel: comfort, design, excellent quality of sleep. The main problem is the elevator: small and no sufficient for a hotel with lots of rooms. Be prepare to wait your time. By the way, Stay is a fantastic option with a very reasonable (for New York standards) price.

Reviews.Title: “Big bucks - tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: KatieOCo
Reviews.Content: I have to say great location, just off Times Sq. We had an interior room so wasn't too noisy but that's the best things I can say about it. On the website, I thought it looked like a boutique hotel, when we got there it was only the lobby that was contemporary. -the lifts were the slowest, smallest and most fickle in the world. the hallways dark and narrow. The room was tiny tiny, so small it didn't have a wardrobe or in deed any where to put your clothes. We lived out of our suitcases, which we had to stack on top of each other and then put our shopping on top of that! So it was a bit of a fiasgo every time we needed something out of our suitcases. The bathroom relatively speaking was only tiny, but the door kept jamming shut from the outside- the door handle was loose. In fact everything was a bit tired including the curtains not hanging properly. The bar seemed to look nice, but every evening we went to use it, there was a private party. We definitely will not be staying there again we were sooo disappointed with our room.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Alot. STAY Delivered!”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Just got back home after spending a week in NYC with Stay. (FYI we're two guys 21 and 24.) Before the trip I read one or two bad reviews on TripAdvisor but my trip seems to have discredited them all. The hotel location in simply unbelievable. I could literally walk from the Hotel door to the middle of times square in 60 seconds. It's unrivalled in terms of location. The lobby of the hotel is super fancy and modern, colourful lighting, crazy metalwork and a massive fish-tank. Very Cool and Chic! Check-in was super quick. The elevators were the completely opposite. Very slow, but given that you might only use them a couple times a day they're fine. The room I was really impressed with. They are small, I expected that, but they make up for it with quality. Comfortable Bed, Massive TV with lots of channels, Fully stocked minibar, Safe and an excellent view. The bathroom I liked the most, It was all new and very minimalist. Hotel staff were very pleasant, they always said Hello and had a quick chat in the elevator. Housekeeping we're brilliant too, each night we came back to a spotless room. Checkout was quick and easy, they didn't rush us at all and they stored our luggage until our cab time. We didn't use the Bar or Restaurant, seems nice tho. Check out my tip!! In a nutshell: LOVED IT!! I'm going back in Feb and will 100% return to STAY

Reviews.Title: “Some good/some bad”
Reviews.Author: FranknDebbie
Reviews.Content: Location and friendly staff are the high points. For tourists, close proximity to Broadway and Times Square a big plus. Subway access (lines N,R) immediately adjacent. You get a free pass to NYSC health club, with several nearby locations. But this comes with a few negatives. Elevators are super small and super slow. Hotel bar is nice (Aspen Social Club) is cool looking, but always either a)too crowded or b)reserved for a private party. Please note street noise can be heard until about 1am; if you are a light sleeper, you want an interior room. Rooms are small, but that's typical of NYC hotels - I have been in smaller - but would say that if more than 2 persons, then not the place for you. Key - the rate - I stayed for 10 days, and it varied from $330 to $189 per night, depending on the date. If <$200, it's a good deal. If more than that, then consider other options.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay at Stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SRStein
Reviews.Content: I'm kicking myself for somehow overlooking the reviews which all stated TINY rooms! I brought my mom to NY for her B-Day and out of all of the hotels in mid-town, chose Stay because of the pics on the site and again, not sure when browsing, I "missed" the negative ones. I should have known when we walked into the elevator and my mom & I barely fit in with just our overnight bags. When we stepped out, the hallways are so narrow that they feel like they're closing in on you. Our room was, well, our first room was dark, TEENY TINY and looked out into another wall and some hotel plumbing. $500/ night?? This wasn't going to work! We ended up getting put in an accessible room which I'm not sure had that 36" clearance everywhere but at least my mom & I didn't have to turn sideways to walk past each other. OK, so we did get our room changed but after saying how disappointed we were, we were never even offered a comp glass of wine, free wi-fi, nothing as a measure of good will. We were on the 2nd floor and heard loud noises from outside ALL night long. Not sure about the ventilation, we woke up stuffy and it smelled like someone was smoking in an adjoining room and blowing the smoke right through the vent into our room. We did go to the hotel bar late night which has great music/dancing & a decent atmosphere. There is free & paid Wi-Fi. Overall, I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey yet smallest rooms on the planet.”
Reviews.Author: The S
Reviews.Content: 3 nights, mid December. Very pricey $330 night,. We usually stay at Marriott properties because we have lots of points. None of the NYC hotels allow points or offer any deals in December. This hotel has the smallest roomswe've ever stayed in, including Europe. Room 916 has no closet and no dresser. The bed isn't big but it covers all but 12" of walking room and you have to duck under the television mounted on the wall at the foot of the bed. The available floor space was taken up by our 2 bags of luggage. Estimate would be the room is 8x12. Oh, upon leaving the bellman tried to get us a taxi. Told us it was a flat $70 to the airport. We're from New York and remembered it was $45 flat rate. Bellman said a taxi was only $3-4 cheaper and he was getting us a "black car." We told him to just get us a cab and, sure enough, it was just $45. He was trying to get an extra $25 from us, probably for a buddy of his driving the car. Lesson: Don't try to book hotel rooms in NYC in December. If you do, spend $450 or so and stay at the Marriott or Hilton, or some other larger hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in NYC: good hotel in a good localization!”
Reviews.Author: patriciapoliveira
Reviews.Content: If you will go to NYC in your first time, choose Stay Hotel: it is in middle of Broadway, so close many atractions! Many people don't like Times Square because it is too dirty and noisy, with a lot of people. But, if you need a excellent place (clean, pretty, good bed, good servive), near many different subway lines, close differents atractions (Radio City, Rockeffeler Center, Empire State, Central Park) and stores (Toy R Us, Macy's, MAC, Victoria Secret, etc...), with a good price, this is the best option. And is possible to go to hotel's louge to drink and enjoy yourself in the night! The concierge (Mr Walter) is helpful and friendly too. I will come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: cheekyt0mat0
Reviews.Content: We booked this place at the last minute after our flights were delayed out of NY. Terrific location - close to Times Square and various shops. We managed to get the queen room for the price of the double (internet deal). The room is a bit small (pretty much just the queen bed and space for one suitcase to be opened). The bed seemed a bit smaller than the average queen, but we were told it was. Lobby is nice, with free wireless internet. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Not too expensive with great location.”
Reviews.Author: subzeropr
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. Rooms are extremely small but very clean. Bed is confy. They let us leave the baggage before check in and after checkout at no extra charge. They have computers with internet free at the lobby. I will come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: deneeb
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Stay for 6 nights! I had paid for 7 nights in this hotel, so that we could check in early when we arrived at the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel we had to wait around 30 minutes because they were "checking" on our room. What this really meant was they were cleaning our room because someone else stayed there. I know this is the case because when we arrived in the room, the smell of cleaner was fresh in the air and there was still water on the floor of the shower. The front desk girl was not helpful or friendly. The room itself was perfect! It was clean and modern and a really good size for New York! The location of this hotel to Times Square, the subway and little markets and stores is also perfect! The elevators in this hotel are extremely small - barely fitting 5 adults in them and they were slow!! One morning our toilet quit working and we called down to the front desk only to find out after 2 more phone calls that the maintenance man wouldn't be in for another hour. Again the customer service was terrible! I would stay here again because of it's convenience factor!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: jazerly
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights at Stay and i would have to say that i have a pleasant stay at Stay. Although there were a few hiccups during the period of stay, i think this hotel still provide whatever that i wanted. I arrived at the hotel about 9.30am on 5 Nov. I do understand that i will not be able to check in that early but i still try to request for an earlier check in since we have been on the flight for more than 20 hrs and all we want is to wash up and freshen up ourselves. The receptionist told us that we can get the room at 11am and we were ecstatic. We decided to have our breakfast beside the hotel and it would be just nice for us to check in by the time we finish our breakfast. However when we return back to the hotel another receptionist told us that the room will not be ready yet and ask us to wait for a while more. We sat at the lobby all the way till 1.30pm. I guess if the first receptionist did not tell us that we can check in at 11am, we wouldn't hold so much hopes and probably we can walk around time square while waiting. This is probably the only complain that i have during my stay. I have read many reviews from tripadvisor about Stay and many reviews stated that the rooms are too tiny. However we feel that the size of the room is perfectly fine, the Queen size bed we have is really comfortable and the room is very clean. We are both able to open and pack our luggage in the room at the same time, and i guess this is good enough for us. I have taken the advice from the previous reviews to request for room on a higher floor in order not to be disturb by the music that comes from the drinking lounge at first floor. I have also requested for an electric kettle. There isn't any coffee cups in the room but you can easily get it from the restaurant downstairs. The hotel provide me with whatever that i requested for and they tidy up our room everyday. There was a night when the air conditioner in my room failed to work. It was really warm and i requested for someone to check it out. They quickly sent a guy from maintenance to get the aircon fix. Within 10mins, the temperature was back to normal again. Very efficient indeed! The porter were extremely helpful and always greeting us when he sees us. The location of the hotel is superb. Times square is just a few steps away and there is no problem for us to walk around even at night since Times square is always crowded and the hotel is just there. The lift can be a little slow but not as slow as what was commented in some of the reviews. If i were to travel to New York again, i will definitely stay at Stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Lobby, Good Location... That's About it...”
Reviews.Author: polski86
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in nyc quite a few times, we decided yet again to stay near Times Square. When you first walk in the lobby is very hip and trendy and the staff is very helpful/friendly. Having stayed in many other hotels in Times Square i was somewhat disappointed at just how small the rooms really are here, probably the smallest i've ever had the displeasure of staying in. The elevator was extremely slow and quite small as well. Be advised if you stay on the 2nd or 3rd floors it is very diffucult to get any sleep until 4 am when the club downstairs closes, we literally felt like the party was in our room. For the money, if you shop it around, there are definitely better places to stay in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms that don't feel calming after a crazy day in NY”
Reviews.Author: jenmc37
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights this marathon weekend. The lobby is trendy and fun but the buzz stops there. You'll wait for slow elevators ( which we didn't have time for) so we took the stairs. Climbing stairs isn't a problem but if you are there to walk, explore, or run a marathon it's tiresome and annoying. Besides being slow the lift only fit 6 people max, 3 comfortably. Also, with regard to space, there was barely room for one shared suitcase. You cannot unpack because there are only shallow desk drawers- no dresser. If you are the kind of person who needs to spread out and organize your stuff, make sure you spring for a large room--and find out what "large" actually means. Our room couldn't have been larger than 10x13 with a full size bed taking up most of the floor space. It is hard to understand how small this is until your find yourself loosing things because piles of paper and bags quickly accumulate with so little storage space. On the up side, it felt safe and reasonably clean. There is a 24 hour grocery with healthy food next door and a Starbucks up the street if you need to get some early coffee like we did. I think they should consider removing the Bose Wave Radios and replacing them with little coffee machines. That would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: Diarmuid O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at your hotel in mid october with my girlfriend and just wanted to thank all your staff for an excellent holiday. It was our first time in New York and Walter, the concierge on duty all week, ensured our stay was as good as it could possibly be. He took the time on our first day to find out what we liked etc and then followed up every day with queries as to how everything went and tailored subsequent advice on that basis. He was so helpful and ensured our stay was as much fun as possible. All other staff we had the opportunity to meet were very helpful and friendly too. All in all, we3 had a fantastic time and wouldn't hesitate to recommend your hotel to any of our friends. Thanks again! Diarmuid

Reviews.Title: “Good location but tiny rooms and in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: bp1London
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night only having stayed at a nice hotel for the other nights of our stay in NYC. We wished we had just stayed an extra night somewhere else. Nothing abysmal about the place, and it does the basics ok but the room was absolutely tiny and a bit run down. Lobby/entrance would lead you to believe its nicer than this. Not bad but not great by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Alstromeria33
Reviews.Content: The Stay is a rather affordable address given the location and the level of service. The rooms are pretty small (at least mine was) and the decoration is quite minimal, be it the bedroom or the bathroom. It is clean, good grade for housekeeping. You will find bathrobes, iron board and safe in the room. And you can ask for a boiler (but it comes without mugs or spoons... you get ... a boiler) . What I liked : the bedding (confortable), the hall and the restaurant (very lively). The location (right on Times Square: theaters, food, bars...) On the downside: the elevators (only 2) are very slow and you have to be ready to wait and wait ... appliances in bathroom are minimal. It is noisy when your neighbors could not care less about the world around them. The TV channels are few, and many do not work. I would probably prefer a more roomy, just a bit fancier place for a romantic stay, but for work, tourism, and shopping I need no more.

Reviews.Title: “sardine box, tiny, tiny, tiny!”
Reviews.Author: GalsintheKnow
Reviews.Content: The front desk guy was quite nice and the look of the hotel is very groovy, but tiny room and no tub;-(

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: coethiel
Reviews.Content: The stay is a fine place to stay - - itâ€™s not a great place to stay. The good - Price - New York is expensive and this place is reasonable for what you get. It was clean, safe, convenient and friendly. - The staff â€“ friendly and helpful seemed to care about customer services - Location â€“ steps from time square, 30-rock, subway etcâ€¦ The Bad: - The rooms are tiny â€“ that said I have stayed in smaller in New York. The Queen is a double, not a queen. That said itâ€™s New York â€“ why are you in your room? - Housekeeping â€“ our room was never cleaned while we were there â€“ sort of a bummer - Noise â€“ not street noise, internal noise. The walls are literally paper thin. We heard every flush of a toilet, every shower, every movement of a passer-by. I mean paper thinâ€¦ if you need silence to sleep this is not the place, if you are too tired from seeing the town and donâ€™t care well thenâ€¦. - Location â€“ literally 30 steps from Time Square, if Time Square is your thing then great if itâ€™s not it is a bit too close.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money... and so noisy”
Reviews.Author: Marc L
Reviews.Content: Welcome rather good Concierge advices excellent and very friendly; Rooms are small, Take 1 luggage because you will not find space to place your second one... Elevators (2) are slow and you be ready to wait long minutes before you'll enter it. Be prepare to dance in your bed. A nighclub is located at the groud floor; DJ is probably not aware that people are in their hotel room also to sleep... Be prepared also to welcome some young unexpected drunk guests as neighboors coming at the middle and shout, dance, ... Positive point: location near Time square.

Reviews.Title: “sleep in your car instead”
Reviews.Author: Beverly P
Reviews.Content: Overall horrible hotel. Our first room was a 10 by 10 coffin like room that reeked of fumigation along with ripped bed linens, The "our queen" size bed was a full bed and the room was dusty, malodorous and the AC fan moaned and rumbled. We demanded a room change -did get nto a room less smelly but when tv hardly worked, outlets were broken and the dust was layered around the room.. The cleaning staff obviously do not move the furniture to clean - NO SPACE thus a think band of dust circles the bed, desk and side tables. The elevators minimal and you wiat long periods to go to your room. The lobby scene is transient and tacky. Every aspect of this hotel is worn, and reeeks of grime. I recommend you avoid at all cost. Lesson learned. The staff response= "well we are near time square" thus all issues must be excused due to location. I made a BiG mistake going here. I hope I did not bring home bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Irina
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for a quick vacation with my wife, in February 2011. Finding a hotel with a better position, at the same price in New York is almost impossible. Actually the rooms are not that big, but they are very clean and the position is perfect: two steps away from times square and broadway. But most of all I would like to spend a few words about the staff: everyone was so nice with us and everyone did his best to make our visit as enjoyable as possible. Especially our new friend Walter, at the concierge, since he did everything for us! He told us where to go, booked for us tables in the best clubs and restaurants etc... And everything at the last minute! I will be back for sure, strictly recommended! Marco & Irina From Italy

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Service and Environment”
Reviews.Author: Jason T
Reviews.Content: I travel often for work and see all shapes and sizes of hotels. I recently spent 5 nigths at Stay on a business trip. The design and feel of the public spaces and the room were truly impressive. Very clean, and uber hip! That's not the best part though. I am very critical of customer service in a day and age when there is none. Sally worked the desk most of the days during my visit and she was aaamaazing! She assisted with any request I had, always with a smile. I was so impressed by her service and the hotel I have already booked another stay, with Stay. Check it out, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Hnjammal
Reviews.Content: Walking into the hotel, you find yourself in a typical retro boutique style hotel. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were extremely clean. The location was prefect. Almost all of the NYC metro lines went through the area. You have movie theaters, restaurants everything. Also, we ended up with free internet. Now for the Cons. The rooms generally are small that we initially requested to be shifted to a bigger room which they did free of charge. Also the hotel only has 2 elevators which meant waiting forever for you to get the lift.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, horrible room”
Reviews.Author: Shannon R
Reviews.Content: I brought my cousin from Texas to NYC (she had never been) and wanted to show her a good time. We decided to stay at the Stay Hotel, being super close to everything. The location is what you pay for- it was great to walk out onto Times Square! The price was unreasonable for the tiny, closet-sized room we booked. There was two of us and we couldn't move around at all! The bathroom was untidy and needed a deep cleaning. Our "city view" was of a brick wall with no daylight coming in. The hotel staff was very friendly and always willing to help us. The elevators were super small and couldn't fit two people plus luggage, so we constantly took the stairs. We were on the 2nd level, and the bar/club noise was unbearable. The elevator made an awful noise that kept us up all night. Perfect hotel for someone who wants to party all night-sleep all day! Perfect location though. Would stay again if the rooms were bigger!

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobia hotel”
Reviews.Author: din i
Reviews.Content: Tiny room. Tiny bath. Small and very slow elevators so slow that people don't want to wait and get packed in it till you cannot breath. Bath accessories were very cheap. Good part is the location - theater district, but if you want more for your money there are plenty same price hotels around. Will not stay even for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay”
Reviews.Author: jenn597
Reviews.Content: Pretty expensive for such tiny rooms, but you're pretty much paying for the location, which you can't beat. You're just a block away from Times Square! Our room the first 2 days was on the 2nd floor. Couldn't even open up my suitcase all the way because the room was so small, and kept banging into things. The bathroom was tiny, and not much shower pressure, also took a while for the water to heat up. The TV display was a bit fuzzy. It took us a bit to figure how how to turn off the desk lamp that was already on when we came in, and found the switch was hidden under the desk... There wasn't much of a noise problem, but those 2 days were in the middle of the week, and apparently Friday/Saturday is when it can get loud on the lower floors due to the bar/club next door. However, on the 3rd day, we were able to move up to the 9th floor, and it was soooo much better. The room was maybe 1/3 bigger, the shower was better, TV was clearer, we actually had a view of Times Square (instead of a brick wall on the 2nd floor). It was still small compared to non-NYC hotels, but much better than our first room. The elevators really are tiny, but we almost never had to wait very long for them. The lobby area is nice, and has free wi-fi (you have to pay $10/night to have it in your room). Wished the rooms had a mini-fridge in them. No water fountain in the hotel either, you have to pay for the bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and unclean”
Reviews.Author: CPMpls
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 5th floor and the music coming from the bar on the first floor was loud enough to wake us up during the night. In the bar itself, I could not hear a person shouting right next to me. There were two very small, extremely slow elevators in the building - so we usually just used the stairs. After guests finish eating a room service meal, they leave the trays and the uneaten remains of their meals in the window wells of the stairway. Those trays would stay there for as long as 24 hours! It was disgusting. We stayed at this hotel for three nights and I saw this happen every single day that I was there so it wasn't just an anomaly. I found the concierge to be more interested in what he thought we should do than in listening to what I wanted to do. Not very engaging. The location near Times Square was great but I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, comfy beds, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ieatmushrooms
Reviews.Content: We liked this place however there is a bar/night club on the ground level which was directly under our room. I wouldn't stay here if you intend to get a good sleep, especially if you have kids or ask to be on the top floor

Reviews.Title: “you can do better”
Reviews.Author: SocoboyRegina_Sask_
Reviews.Content: it's true, the rooms are brutally small, and what was also a disapointment was to learn very little cleaning is done. We had dust all the way up the wall from the ventialtor, when brushed down some fell to floor, on opposite side of bed. It stayed there the whole time. Perhaps the cord from vacuum wouldn't reach? The location is second to none. 120 feet out your door your in times square. Good deli and breakfast restauraunt just a few doors down. The elevators are slow but not as bad as described. The lobby and bar is OK. And it does have free WiFi down there. For the price i'm guessing you can find something equally as good where your not walking into one another trying to manouver around the room

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms don't justify the price”
Reviews.Author: GermanWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: The decor of the lobby, bar, and restaurant are VERY cool. The staff at the reception friendly. However despite having reserved a room with a ling-size bed I ended up getting a room with a queen-size bed, which was so small, that a bigger bed would have not fit. This was also the first hotel I have ever stayed that didn't have glasses in the room, not even plastic cups. I finally got a bigger room, on the 2nd floor which was extremely loud all night. After breakfast in the hotel restaurant, where the waiter jelled at me at almost assaulted me (and other guests), I check out and moved to the Millenium Broadway a few blocks away, same price and standard, bigger rooms and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location, slooow elevators, variable staff.”
Reviews.Author: wguterbock
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel a half block off of Times Square, very close to a lot of theatres. We were in an upper room on an airshaft, so the room was relatively quiet for being so close to Times Square. There are many dining choices within an easy walk. A block from the Hershey and M&:M stores. It is a converted older building. Once you get past the glitzy lobby (the large saltwater fish tank is fascinating!) the actual product is so-so. We had a room with a double bed that was tiny. Barely enough room for a suitcase in the space around the bed. Room was clean and had a Bose radio and a big screen flat screen TV. Air conditioner is noisy but effective. Window in bedroom did not open. No microwave. Minibar. Shower, no tub. Shower was very good and amenities are interesting. I did see some other rooms that are bigger. The elevators are small and slow. Some of the staff are friendly and helpful, others less so. The doorman, for example, watches while people struggle to get their bags thru the doors. The concierge was helpful but the desk staff was somewhat surly. Used room service trays stayed in the stairwells for days, untouched. On the whole, my impression is that this was an unhappy team that needs a new leader. However the room was acceptable and the price reasonable for New York and the area. One concern is that the stairwells are open so that in case of a fire on a lower floor smoke would fill the upper floors. There are enclosed stairwells as well, but this strikes me as a hazard. Internet access is not free. No gym or pool in hotel; they give you a pass to a club in the Crowne Plaza that is large and very complete, two blocks away. This club has a pool, free weights, and lots of cardio and weight machines. Bring your own earphones. Towels provided.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Atoff
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel just off Times Square. Good size double room, my friend did complain his room was a little small. Good bar in hotel and a couple of bars opposite and next door. Staff were very helpful and friendly. As another review says lifts were a liile slow, but its a small issue. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Very Nice Stay in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: EdwardR62
Reviews.Content: As many others have said, the room we stayed in on the 8th floor was small. That being said, the hotel lobby and room were clean, the bed was soft and comfy, and the bathroom was nice for a hotel room. Everything in the room worked and the water was hot. We didn't use room service so I can't speak to that. We are not hotel snobs and didn't spend our day in the room so lack of space and creature comforts was not a problem. Location was excellent. We arrived at the hotel about 9:30 a.m. intending to leave our suitcase with the bell captain until later in the afternoon. They had a room ready for us so we checked in right away. After checkout the next morning we did leave our bags with the bell captain until we left town that evening. There was no charge for bag storage and no trouble retrieving them. We really enjoyed our stay at Stay and will definitely use them again the next time we stay overnight in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Saty a week”
Reviews.Author: George6977
Reviews.Content: The overall experience at the Stay Hotel was excellent. Nice lobby, good internet access, room with enough space for a couple, not big and spacious but well fit and clean. The hotel crew is nice and warm and for anything you need you'll get proper advise.

Reviews.Title: “Central New York”
Reviews.Author: Cairnschick
Reviews.Content: Booked the stay hotel directly through their website, I was staying for 9 so they had an offer at the time for 30% off. It was $1990 in total. Not cheap, but hey, this is Times Square NY. It was a great location!! The view isnâ€™t the greatest since itâ€™s off a side street, but that also means itâ€™s not as noisy if it was directly on 7th Avenue. With the discount, it was only approximately $236 more than a 2 star hotel on Times Square also, except the reviews werenâ€™t as favourable. Whatever it was, it was about average $26 extra per night. I arrived quite late and the room, I was originally given was absolutely tiny with no real closet space or general space at all, the clothes space was essentially a coat stand. It was on the third floor so I was slightly concerned about the noise factor since other reviews mentioned the noise travels quite a lot. I spoke to Jazilyn the next morning about the room size since I had booked a queen size room and she organized me to be moved. She was absolutely lovely and extremely helpful. The new room was a lot nicer and more spacious. I would love brighter lighting in the room, for makeup purposes, but otherwise it was good. The room contained a bar fridge, however, you couldnâ€™t put your own bottles in since it was the system of if you remove any bottles, itâ€™s automatically charged. Frustrating also, since I would've loved to have bought fruit to snack on and with the temperatures, you just couldn't leave it out. The only really annoying thing was the internet. There was free wifi in the lobby area however, not in the rooms, which I personally thought was bizarre. Overall, I was happy with the hotel and I would consider them again if I returned to NY>

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Adnyl123
Reviews.Content: Room was small, but this is to be expected at the older NYC hotels. Bathroom tiny with bad lighting (I have no idea how my make-up looked!) Otherwise, adequate and clean. Bed very comfortable. Service was excellent. I explained that I followed a very restrictive diet and asked if I could use the bar fridge (which was not working) to store food? They immediately sent up a small fridge at no extra charge. A/C noisy. If you have to get up for a meeting on a Sunday morning, be aware that the noise coming from the Aspen Social Club IS loud and penetrating and will likely keep you awake.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and comfortable bed, but small room for a not small price”
Reviews.Author: betsy1224
Reviews.Content: I decided to use my AMEX miles for a hotel in New York, and my assistant found Stay based on the location near my meetings. The Midtown location near Times Square and Ave. of the Americas is great, but I can't believe the "rack rate." With taxes and fees my tiny room would have cost over $500! I know NYC is expensive, but rooms here shouldn't be more than $300-$350. While the room had all of the necessary amenities and the bed was very comfortable, the sleeping area and bathroom were really small. To put on my makeup, I had to close the bathroom door. The hotel clerk originally gave me a room on the 2nd floor, but thanks to other Trip Advisor comments about noise on the lower floors, I asked for a room on a higher floor, and she immediately gave me one on the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “i can't believe that someone liked it”
Reviews.Author: semya
Reviews.Content: really, everything except for the lobby and this hotel's location is awful. rooms for 2 are like rooms for 1/2 person. we booked 2 double rooms and they both were unbelievably tiny! the bed was for 1+1/2 person. conditioning was directly targeted to the bed, so you had to either hide under the blanket and sweat, or get immediately cold without it. the smell in one of the rooms was unbearable. and it was one of the most expensive hotels we booked in US. sure thing, it's right at the times square, but c'mon, clean the rooms and make them single rooms so that you could have place for your luggage in addition to yourself in this room. will never stay at stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Lynnhughes67
Reviews.Content: Having tried many hotels this is now my place of choice. Small but lovely rooms. Great service with a personal touch and an ideal location. The bar (Aspen Social Club) makes it even better

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Shatom1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just steps from Times Square. The rooms are small, but beautiful, the appointments are wonderful, staff was wonderful, price excellent. Close to tour buses, so you can get off an on and tour all of the city, and then when you get back for the evening you can walk to theatre, restuarants. Nice little breakfast place just a few doors up, where you do not have to pay Times Square prices. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, good location”
Reviews.Author: WeekdaySkier
Reviews.Content: Between rockerfeller center and broadway/times sq. Very convenient to subway. Crowded area. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Internet is in the lobby only. A bonus during our stay is the complimentary loaner umbrellas

Reviews.Title: “It was good for the Price and location”
Reviews.Author: Ravi S
Reviews.Content: Rooms were really small. I'm sure you'll notice this in all the other reveiws. When I say small, I mean small. But it has a big screen TV, the conceige is really nice, people are friendly, lobby looks incredible. Things that suck: - elevators (there's 2 and they take forever, but there are stairs which doesnt take that long honestly) - rooms are small - no good views Things that are great: - right by times square (like RIGHT by it, not even a 1 minute walk) - close to everything you can imagine (say shows at the radio city hall, grey line bus tours like 30 seconds away, food, pretty much all to do in NEW YORK is your front lawn by this hotel) - its safe, and theres a restaurant in the hotel, and it turns into a lounge at night - price is cheap - looks classy and modern (has an aquariam in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Stay. is always our choice in New York and has the best concierge in the world.”
Reviews.Author: ClarissaSerpa
Reviews.Content: My mother and I have a lot of experience in international travels and our choice of hotel in New York is always Stay. We believe that one of the biggest differences of this hotel is Walter, The Concierge. Walter is definitely the best concierge in the world. Attentive, helpful, gentle, tireless, professional and efficient, he is always willing to indicate the best choices and directions of the city. Stay. has an impeccable cleaning and its location is perfect. Although most of the rooms are small, they are very comfortable, secure and sophisticated. As a suggestion, it would be very interesting if the Hotel could provide an ice machine on each floor, and also offer a welcome drink for each guest who returns, in recognition of loyalty.
