In addition, last time we were checking out, the front desk lady informed us that â€œthe manager likes to read about the guests opinionâ€�. We loved to know that the Stay. cares about the opinions of itâ€™s guests. People, believe: when the website says that â€œit is not just a hotel, but rather a place to Stayâ€�, it is true. We canâ€™t wait to go to NYC again and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Really Friendly Staff, Great Location, and Quite Pretty”
Reviews.Author: o0o_wanderlust_o0o
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was courteous, relax and uber friendly. The concierge was a big help and actually spent the time to talk to you and offer tips to do and see and points you to good spots around the area. The room was clean and housekeeping kept it proper everyday and did a real good job of it. Location is great just a few meters from Time Square and offers a lot of things to do, places to visit and restaurants to try out!. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I need to Stay. again here Real soon!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal R
Reviews.Content: Stay. Hotel caught my eye as soon as I came across it online, and guess what? Stay. was SOLD out. Ready to have purchased my 5 nights, I decided to room else where for my first night in NYC. My second night I passed by it, I walked in and asked if they had any availability, and they did, I told them I would get back with them, I did at 4am, luggage in hand. The Courteous Gentlemen by the name Amaury was very kind and assured me that there was a room for me that night and helped me book my 4 remaining nights with them.Â  My room (single queen bed) was perfect for my modern taste, small and very CLEAN. The bed was soft and extremely comfortable (4 Pillows)! I enjoyed the 4 different light preferences: Dimming Celling lights, Lamps, Desk Lamp and table Lamp where the BOSE Radio with AUX for your iPhone/iPod/MP3 player is set. Flat TV Screen. Digital A/C. The extras such as: "Green" Earth Friendly Soap, Facial Cleanser & Shampoos. The Vanity Box, which includes Q-Tips, safety pin and needle with different threads. An Amazing Conair Professional Hair Dryer. Many & Plenty of Towels. Two Robes in the closet with iron & ironing board. A Safe for personal belongings. A mini-bar :) Â Nancy my housekeeper always had a smile on her face. She was happy to help me with anything I requested. I also noticed how she updated and changed out my magazines on the Desk!Â  After Midnight on the weekends, I went downstairs for a surprise. The Hotel's Restaurant turns into enjoyable entertainment, bringing it's daytime lounge image into Life at Night! Amaury and Sangbo (the door man) were always present late night and assisted me with any questions a night owl and/or tourist could want answered. Fantastic Service! On my final day upon checkout, I was greeted by two friendly ladies at the Front Desk named Norma and Fatima. They asked me how my visit to New York has been and asked if I needed anything else before checkout. I did, I had a late returning flight and Carlos Held my luggage until I returned back. Norma & Fatima answered a few more of my tourist questions and pointed me to the right direction. I returned back to the Hotel around 5pm and Carlos called for a Taxi immediately as I requested!Â  Stay. has been my Favorite Hotel Experience Ever! Great Location, Price is on Point and OutStanding, Gratifying Â Customer Service! Truly a Satisfied Guest. I cannot wait to comeback to NYC with Stay.Â  RECOMMEND Â BY CRYSTAL R.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, nice hotel, clean but small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: merrys021
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by all the friendly help we received from the front desk staff, Norma Tabora, and Jazilyn in particular. We came to NY for a seminar without booking a room first. We were lucky to find "Stay" last minute and had no problems checking in. We only booked for 2 nights, even though we needed to stay for 5, hoping that we would find better rates at another hotel. The girls at the front dest, Jazilyn and Norma worked hard to get us the best rates and it was not worth the trouble to pack up our stuff and move to another hotel. The room was very small but clean, and the minibar was a nice plus to store meds that needed refrigeration. The only down side was the loud noise the air conditioner made, and kept us up at night. Luckily the beds were very comfortable. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor, medicore service!!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya L
Reviews.Content: Great location, poor service. Upon checkout , came across an unpleasant young woman by the name of Sally. Dont bother asking her any questions- very abrupt. On the other hand, great decor, nice aquarium. Small rooms, but cozy. Overall 3 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Metro Hip Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dovhoz
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get a great package deal with a major online website and chose this place primarily for their location and price. It's located 1/2 block from Times Square, so you're in the middle of it all!We were pleasantly surprised with the ultra modern decor in the lobby and the staff were very very polite and helpful. Our room had a king bed and not much room for anything else in it. The window overlooked a/c units on lower floors, but this is typical in NYC. The bathroom was quite tiny but everything had a nice touch considering the size. The elevator holds about 3 people, so we opted for the stairs on several occasions so as not to wait. The bar decor was very cool and extremely popular with the locals that weekend. If you're like some of us--a hotel room is just to sleep and shower, and this was a great deal for the price but above all, the best of locations. The tour busses load at Times Square, the trains are a block away. Tons of restaurants and theatres within a short walking distance. After staying at this hotel, I made a point to check out the STAY hotel while visiting downtown LA as well. They're a clean, affordable hotel and very easy on the eyes. 2 Thumbs UP!

Reviews.Title: “I wish i could stay longer”
Reviews.Author: Hva91
Reviews.Content: Such a lively atmosphere, staff were extremely friendly and helpful, very clean room, such an amazing location was minutes away from everything. Definitely made my first trip to new York memorable, would definite recommend and return here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at the Roomate Grace Hotel, but when I got there I found out that they had some issue with pipes and had to close some rooms, so they sent me two blocks over to Stay. Pros: Exceptional staff. Everyone was so nice, friendly and helpful. Room was very clean, had a flat screen TV and a Bose wave radio. It's on 47th between 6th and 7th, so was very convenient for Broadway shows and lots of good dining. Couldn't hear any street noise or traffic, halls were generally quiet except I think I might have been near an ice machine or something. The bed was very comfy, but pillows a little too flat for my liking. Concierge will arrange for Airlink shuttle to the airport for $20. Took 90 min. Cheaper than a cab which is $50 I'm told. Cons: Poor lighting in the room and in the lobby. In my room I couldn't even see well enough to put my make-up on. The room was very small, but for one person, acceptable for a couple nights as a place to crash. Only one available outlet in the room worked and it was on the far side of the bed by the window. No room to setup an ironing board there. Plug in the bathroom didn't work either, so couldn't use the blow dryer.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Steinsopp
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four days, and I can't come up with any gripes with the place whatsoever. The room was large enough, contained all necessary facilities, bathroom large enough, safe in the bedroom, enough place to hang up my clothes, clean bed, clean linen, desk and chair in bedroom, everyone who worked at the hotel provided me with a comfortable experience. They guys in the reception area provided me with advice for my stay in the NY area, directions, ordered my friends a cab saturday night so they could return to their place at greenwhich village (Man , those cabs were hard to come by...or rather, get a hike with.) Silent quarters and large flatscreen TV, a modern clean comfortable experience. Cleaning personnel were very helpful when asked for extra soap and shampoo by pen and post it note (provided by the hotel.) They did a clean and thorough job at my room every day. Even from the moment when I arrived at the reception area to find I forgot to open my credit card for use in the USA, everything went smooth sailing from there on..it wasn't really a problem, I could pay later on that day They even returned my lost and found 'harry potter' pencil by fed-ex when I asked for it....haha. Silly me. Staff and support functions on email work fine and everything was good enough or better than expected This place definitely deserve the 3+ or four star ranking, I opt for the latter....I have been living in London on a 3+ hotel where my room was the size of a credit card and the tube ran under my spring bed several times a night...I believe it was called the 'free massage' feature....but not so with this hotel. Thank goodness for that I promised myself I'd mention names in my review but I have forgotten ...all I remember are smiling faces and helpful advice. Sorry about that :) Thank You, Stay hotel, you made my first-time new york experience a very comfortable one :)

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: gid66
Reviews.Content: the hotel is clean, the rooms are in the middle of new york so small but comfortable, the view of the room facing the inside but to see the courtyards of the houses in New York is still an experience. the noise of the pub on the ground floor of which is mentioned in other reviews in effect does not exist! the staff is friendly, helpful and polite. when we return to New York without a doubt we will return to the hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awkward rooms, not much care for the hotel guest.”
Reviews.Author: travwellfriend
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation and quaranteed my late arrival with a credit card. I noted in the reservation that my flight would land at 11:30pm (JFK). They called cell as I was disembarking the airplane to ask if I were coming to the hotel - I said yes, of course. I arrive to be told that there is only one room left, and not the king I had reserved. Its midnight and I'm tired having flown from west coast for business. I'm now told I've been "upgraded" to room with two fullsize beds - what? I'm 6 feet tall (only) and yet my feet hang off the end of the bed with my head against the headboard. Not comfortable. Furniture so tight its almost impossible to sit at the desk. The bathroom is a different story. Lets just say your entire bathroom kit fits in sandwich bag or no room. Last, the Aspen Social Club which adjoins the lobby and under my "upgraded" room (and many others) is hosting a private party wherein the DJ (a very unimaginative, and simply put, not very good DJ) was allowed to crank the volume well past their small lounge "loud music" threshold and put the music loudly in my room. Yep, cut right through the sleeping pill. I called the front desk at 11 (wasn't upset) and was told an hour more...fine. 12:30am comes and it gets louder. I call back to the front desk - no hotel manager on duty (pretty common in the evening here) So, with no adult on deck to take care of business, its left to the bar manager to think about the hotel guests this magical Thursday night. Oh, not to be. I am now told by the front desk at 12:45am that it will only be another 5 - 10 minutes as there are hardly any patrons left. Ok, cool. What?! - now the music gets even louder...until 2am. I've stayed here before, put clients up here and recommended ad infinitum. Well , I truly regret those days are over. The management has lost customer quality control. I love music and hotels with DJ'd lounges, but I've never been to one that totally disregards its paying guests. Sad and not a great business model. But hey, the front desk called me to say that for my inconvenience, they would comp my to little bottles of water that I drank in my room. I'm always ready to see the phenomenal customer service reach-out and Rocky-like comeback. This restores my faith and I am inevitably happy because of this great, we-care-about-our-guests effort. Hmmm, well two little bottles of water was their master stroke. I'll not stay here again, and rather than recommend, I will instead actively refer friend and clients elsewhere. Shame really. And to all a good night.

Reviews.Title: “The best service”
Reviews.Author: Livia L
Reviews.Content: The best service I have ever received during all my job and pleasure travels, in particular thanks to Ms. Norma Tabora. Whatever you need ask for her help, she is very gentle and will help you to work out little problems of being in a new city, she can suggest you good things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lelake
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ Stay for one night prior to taking off for a cruise. It was small but comfortable, clean and affordable. The location was perfect, close to Times Square and it was walkable to catch the cruise. The staff were all friendly and very accommodating. The room was small, but perfect to catch some sleep and venture off to see the city. I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean, and close to Time Square”
Reviews.Author: TerrySaultSte.Marie
Reviews.Content: Absolutely n problem with this hotel at all - very satisfied (except for small rooms) - which is acceptable. Only there for a short time. Clean - appeared to be recently renovated,,,,,easy to get around. Food in restaurant was great (morning waiter needs help when it's busy). Staff at front desk very helpful, along with all other staff we met. Excellent location, and price not too bad for the time of year.....highly recommend to anyone,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, great price.”
Reviews.Author: xiphoid76
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before and really liked it - the price and location can not be beat! Unfortunately when we checked in, they said they did not have a king bed which we had confirmed and they moved us to a queen room instead. They said we should have been notified prior to coming to the hotel but we were not. The adjusted the price to a queen and then we had to move to another room the next night. I did not find this acceptable and complained and they lowered the price of the first night of our stay 20 dollars. Not a bad gesture, maybe expected a bit more. The hotel is very clean and yes the rooms are small but nice for Times Square. No complaints there. We moved into a king room the next day and then the air conditioner did not work so had to move again - have to say the staff was very nice, especially the hotel manager Anna who listened to my complaints. She moved us into another king with a working air conditioner (as it was 100 degrees in NYC that day much needed!). They did give us a fruit plate and a letter and some water for our troubles which was nice. There is no free wifi in the rooms but is available in the lobby. The bar downstairs is sooo loud you can hear the music thumping all night - we were on the 4th floor and could hear it very well. The bellman at the end of our stay tried to get us to take a limo to the airport instead of a yellow taxi which we wanted and was a little rude to us as well. It was not a good beginning or end of the stay at Stay, but the hotel is so reasonably priced it may be worth a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Small room&bathroom but still recommended”
Reviews.Author: Travelerjerseyhot
Reviews.Content: Pro: -location -clean -free Internet in the room (advertisement said only free Internet in the lobby) Con: -small room is ok, but super small bathroom is a little too small to me

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, only yards away from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: DieterSzurowski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at "Stay" at the last July Weekend and it is a really nice place to be. The staff is very kind and the rooms are clean and well equipped. The Lobby is cozy. The night was around $200, what is a very fair rate for that location and weekend. The room was kind of small, the AC kind of noisy... But hey, that's New York...;o) If you look for a place right on Times square what is affordable and clean, you should consider "Stay"

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved this Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LD5500
Reviews.Content: Ended up at Stay randomly from an online bid. We were so pleasantly surprised! The hotel is trendy & modern. Rooms are NY-small (yes, that means tiny, but that's not uncommon for NY). The room was clean and the desk staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't need to pay for wireless, because they provided free wireless in the lounge area. It was quiet and comfortable, in an area off the main lobby. Location was great - the hotel is centrally located to everything in or near Times Square. The price we paid was excellent, based upon location, accommodations, and the prices in the surrounding area. We were quite pleased and are likely to consider Stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: shani-71
Reviews.Content: We were 12 nights in "stay" hotel, first room was very small but after we talked with the reception, they exchanged into a more spacious room. The room neat and clean, good hotel service! Want to mention the excellent guest service and especially mr. Daniel Feurtado was courteous, nice, and served us nicely throughout our stay. (Daniel helped us with every problem we had). Thank you Daniel !!! After we have received good service and good hotel, we definitely come back to "stay" hotel. (Already booked for October)!! shani and orly cohen

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: Reeno19
Reviews.Content: My husband has been there for 1 one week during a business trip and I've reached him during the last two days. At the beginning they gave him a very very small room in a lower floor, but as we know it was a noisy floor during the we due to the club, I suggested him to ask for another room in upper floor. The staff have been very nice and moved him to the new room. We appreciated it very much as he was there for job and he wanted to sleep without being disturbed. The room was larger than the previous, nothing big, but comfortable, I think I could considered good for NYC standard. Bed was comfortable and furniture was modern, also very clean. The hotel is very close to Times square and it's walking distance from shops and restaurants. When we left they also arranged us a trasfer to the airport at a very convenient price. The only negative is the elevator is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Gems of the city”
Reviews.Author: sizzleskins75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between 4th July-8th July. Location is the best!! Theres a mini super market next door. Major shopping outlets is just around the corner. It's also nearby to Radio City where we watched Zarkana. Overall we haved enjoyed our stay here and if I return back to this wonderful city, I would love to go back to Stay. Thank you for all the great service. We will never forget that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: gihanson
Reviews.Content: I've stay at the "Stay Hotel" before so I came back in 2011 because the value and location were truly worthy! The best location in NYC is right there: Times Square, and, compared to other hotels in the area, Stay has a great price! Ok, no breakfast or internet included, but there are tons of options in the area (and if you are in a lower floor-room you can access the free wi-fi internet that comes from the lobby!). The only thing was that the room was super-small!! Literally there was just enough space for the bed!! When I was there in 2010 I stayed in a 2 bed room which was, at least, triple the size. So, my advice is, even if you travelling with a partner, book a 2 bed - room (you are not going to regret having the extra space).Another tip is: don't get a room close to the elevator! You can basically hear everything going on in the hallway! "Stay" is kind os modern hotel (beautiful decoration in the lobby area), so, don't expect the staff voluntarily trying to help you. If you ask for information they'll absolutely provide it, but don't expect much of a hospitality and people greeting you as you walk in! Even though it is very worth the stay at "Stay".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kristy225282
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying 2 nights at STAY. I have to say that I was a bit worried after reading a few of the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. True, the rooms are small (as most places in Manhatten). True the elevators are slow when going down (we found that going down the stairs wasn't any trouble and we were on the 10th floor). Another benefit for being on the 10th floor is that it is so quiet! We never heard a peep from the Aspen club. And I'm sure that if we did the staff there would have done all they could to help us out. We found them to be overly accomidating and friendly. Overall, the location is perfect! Literally the hotel is 20 steps away from Times Square and all the broadway shows! If you have any hesitations about this hotel, don't! You will absolutely love your stay at STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Stay. and you won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: fleur_1349
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at Stay. and were not at all disappointed! Excellent service upon arrival at the reception desk. Weâ€™d requested a kettle for our room, which was provided with complimentary tea of our choice. There was also a plate of fruit in our room, which was a very nice though. We requested non-feather bedding, which was also provided. Room was lovely, very chic and modern, as was the rest of the hotel. Location was incredible: 30m to Times Square, but on the sideroad, so it wasnâ€™t noisy. We were on the 8th floor and didnâ€™t hear anything from the bar on the night time when we went to bed. I know some reviewers from lower floors said they did, so perhaps request a higher floor. We had cocktails in the bar, which were nice and the food in the restaurant good quality. A little expensive, but then it is Times Square. Overall, the hotel was good value for money - would recommend highly to anyone! Only criticism would be a very minor point: perhaps another elevator would be useful. There are 2 small ones and it got stuck one morning and we had to wait for a while. Other than that, thank you. We had a great time at Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation Close to Time Square”
Reviews.Author: Kruzein
Reviews.Content: Stay hotel was a stones throw from Time Square. The room itself was small but had everything that is required for comfort. The bed was very comfortable large TV and the bathroom facilites were very clean and fresh. We were on the first floor which enabled us to have free high speed Wifi when usually there is a charge for in rooms however there is free wifi in the lobby. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. This accomodation was right in the middle of everything. We will definentely stay here again because of the location and price and the quality of the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Such Accomodating Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: krlerose
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say that I always enjoy staying at a hotel that really makes the guest(me) feel like a top priority. Sally was great at greeting me and trying to get the largest room possible for my stay, she then advised me to check back in the morning so I could upgrade to a larger room and was all smiles and very professional. The next morning I felt like a top priority to Jazilyn and Norma as they worked as a team it felt, to make sure I was happy with the room change. Even followed up with me to make sure everything was to my liking. Great communication between the staff members and myself. Customer service was an A+! The rooms could be a little bigger though..haha - Great location - Right in the midst of time square.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for a Theatre Trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Theatresouth
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller to NYC for the theatre, I always find it hard to find a decent hotel, within budget. I think that I have now found one. I found the best thing about 'Stay' was its excellent location, literally a minute from Times Sq. Its true that the rooms are small, but show me a decently priced hotel in NYC that doesnt have small rooms (I remember before having to sit side saddle on the toilet before !). There was a bit of noise from the bar on Friday night until very late/early (but again this is new york !). Room safe and door lock didnt work, however I am sure that if we had flagged it someone would have done something. There was also no where to put luggage or any closet (which was unusual) but for a 4 night stay it wasnt too much of a problem. The staff were exceptional, the rooms clean and safe, and there was a nice modern feel about the hotel. It was good value for money,

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Roadwise2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been at Stay. for the last 3 days. The rooms are small, but comfortable and efficient. It was exactly what we needed because you don't spend much time if your room in NYC. The room was clean and absolutely prefect except for the border rod sticking out of the mattress seam. The hotel itself was very nice and trendy. We were on the 5th floor which was perfect. The elevators are INCREDIBLY slow when you're traveling down (on the way up, it's relatively easy), so if you're going to go with anyone elderly, you might want to request staying on a lower floor, unless you don't mind waiting 10 minutes to go up and down. Also, I wouldn't recommend staying on the 2nd floor. On the weekend, the restaurant turns into a nightclub and it's loud.

Reviews.Title: “Smack bang in times square”
Reviews.Author: Khebb
Reviews.Content: Modern and hip with great service and free Internet. The location makes it easy to get the best Broadway tickets at the tkts queue and good shopping and eating. Staff helped us locate laundromat and hairdressers v good. Only downside v small room, even for NYC but if you are out and about lots like s less of a concern. Best service we had in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel just off Times Square and very near Rockefeller Centre”
Reviews.Author: hsqos
Reviews.Content: I got really good deal via lastminute with the Stay Hotel coming up as one of the cheaper hotels. Based on tripadvisor reviews booked this. The reception area was very impressive fish tank was amazing, very modern. Reception allowed us to check in early. Our room was on 9th floor, can't complain on size enough room to sleep, shower and move around. Given the amount of time you spend in room it's completely functional. Location is great, just off times square, near a subway and close to rockefeller centre. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryJane337
Reviews.Content: yes rooms are small, but from what I hear most hotel rooms in Midtown NYC are small. We were on the second floor and never heard any noise from lounge. Staff was very helpful. 1/2 block off Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price and great customer service, some rooms are super small though!”
Reviews.Author: keriUk
Reviews.Content: We arrived here 2 days ago and just when we were checking in at 2am in the morning I relised I had made a mistake with the check in date and this meant that they did not have to give us a room until 3pm that day. However the check in desk cover was so helpful and it was not a problem, he even upgraded us. However the rooms are small and we struggled to fit all our luggage in and be able to leave the room. There was no wardrobe so we considered keeping cases in the shower once we were dressed and washed but thought this was crazy and asked for a bigger room. We were moved from the 7th Floor to room 305 on the 3rd floor and this was a great room, plenty of space for luggage, a wardrobe and a bathroom window area to store all the shower products. They were so helpful and really made everythign so easy we did not even have to move our cases. The location is fantastic you ractically step out onto times square but yet you dont here the hustle and bustle from your room. Overall a great stylish contempory hotel with super helpful staff. Just check you ask for a suitable sized room as the one we first got on the 7th floor was too small for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Stay - someplace else”
Reviews.Author: swixo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic lobby. It's where the niceness ends. The layout of the hotel above the lobby looks like a poorly restored classic building. The halls are narrow and rooms too small for the price charged. I generally expect a nice room. Good furnishings and some style. Regrettably I saw none of this in the two rooms I was in. Noise from a night club below was unacceptable to boot. The bell hop recommended I stay elsewhere as he detected I was a little discerning. He was right.

Reviews.Title: “Expect the unexpected (in a great way)!”
Reviews.Author: JimEveryCountry
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Stay Hotel. While the tag line is "Party all night, sleep all day" - as a business traveler I did not find it to be an issue. I ate at the restaurant for breakfast twice (both times they were out of some items because of the "party all night" thing, but the servers were very accommodating. Dinner was good and they had all of the items on the menu. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were very clean. Starbucks 2 doors away (pretty good) and a Staples print center 2 blocks. The Mediterranean restaurant across the street was awesome (as well as the Indian restaurant across the street and up the block).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ErikaAnne1
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night for a bachelorette party. The location is INCREDIBLE...literally right in times square! The lobby was beautiful and the rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-decorated. They provided bathrobes and great eco-friendly bath products. The rooms with only 1 bed are very small (so is the bathroom), but the rooms with 2 beds are much larger. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful as well. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “They went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQSB
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for the two great ballet companies: NYC Ballet and American Ballet Theatre. I chose Stay for its perfect location, its style and its price. My room was small, but I knew it would be and I was fine with that. It was elegant and had every amenity that all good hotels offer. The nice bathrobes became especially important to me. The staff was friendly and efficient, especially Walter, the concierge. I loved my three days of ballet performances and my little home away from home to return to every evening. On my last night, I woke up at 3:00 a.m. and was violently ill. After more than an hour of desperate illness, I managed to get my cell phone and call 911. I was too weak to put my clothes on, so I wore the Stay robe to the ER. (The nurses thought it was beautiful.) When I was released from the hospital later that day, I had missed my flight and my checkout time. The Stay staff was really helpful getting me back on track. Every person I saw asked me how I was feeling and really wanted to help me out. That meant a lot to a woman traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Lousiest Hotel Ever - Run Scared”
Reviews.Author: K2335
Reviews.Content: I was at the Stay Hotel three nights on business earlier this week. Upon my arrival, they had no notice of my Corporate Travel Agency's notification of payment (sent two days earlier and confirmed by their reservation office). I have stayed in small rooms before, but having no access to the nook in the wall they call closet because furniture actually blocks it, is definitely a first for me. That made for crinkly business clothes the next day. The deadbolt on the door did not work. Upon arriving at their restaurant for breakfast, they have the nerve to charge you a service fee (euphemy for forced gratuity) for a pretty much self-service meal. My room was not made in 36 hours despite various requests from me and having heard the front desk clerk literally call on a maid over the radio asking to clean the room. Several fixtures like drawer pulls were broken or stuck. After three days, they still could not locate the person in their reservation department that had processed payment since last week for my room. The hotel had the nerve to charge my personal credit card, which they had on hodl for extras, for the full stay, thus duplicating payment and having to reverse payment afterward and refund my card. I had stayed at another Vikran Chatwal hotel before: Nigh Hotel. Great service, accomodations and overall experience there, but steer clear from the Stay Hotel if you are on a business trip, you'll spend far more time than you can afford to sorting tout heir own poor procedures. at $350 a night, one could expect far more than what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Uber trandy and fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: skylar09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally on Times Square, so is incredibly central if you want to be in the heart of it all. It looks amazing inside with trendy decor, stunning fish tanks in the lobby and the bar looked funky. I couldn't fault the decor. We booked a small double, and it was the cheapest we could find for the location at Â£220 for the night including taxes. Other hotels in this area are twice that and then some and sometimes not even half as stylish. We have been to New York three times, staying twice in Times Square and once in lower Manhattan, so we know what are to excpect for our money. So yes the hotel room was tiny with just reasonable space to walk around the bed with a bedside table on one side and small desk on the other with a small bathroom. However, the room was decorated in a dark gothic style which was good for sleeping and the bed and pillows were the most comfortable I have slept on, despite the fact the bed was a slightly smaller double. I had a great sleep. The room had all the mod cons, a tv on the wall, a safe, an impressively stocked mini bar, even an iron and ironing board. In the bathroom they had a bathrobe and a hairdryer as well as eco friendly toiletries. I think this room would normally be for a solo traveller with most couples opting for a king room, but we didnt have a lot of luggage and didn't require a wardrobe as we were only there for one night, though I would still consider staying longer than that. I didn't find the size oppresive, nothing was left out of the room. I will say the bathroom could have done with a better clean, but it wasn't filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rhardwick
Reviews.Content: Positives: Brilliant location, modern decor, comfy beds and great helpful staff, nice bar! Negatives - the standard rooms are TINY, ask for an upgrade, we got one free as we were almost falling out of the beds. Our upgraded room was excellent :) Right in the centre of the action, Stay is a funky modern comfortable hotel I would highly recommend. We did plenty of research before booking and it was worth it! 10 mins (walk) from Central Park, 1 min from the TKTS booth in Times Square, 2 mins from the Subway station and 20 mins walk to Greenwich Village.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff, great service!”
Reviews.Author: nahood1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I went to New York for Business in April. Check in was smooth, the staff were very friendly, we had a great turn down service and they have wonderful eco friendly toiletries in the bathroom. We had quiet uninterrupted sleep at night, it was not noisy as some other guests had reported. i booked this hotel through Booking.com, and there was an additional charge of one night (Booking.com mistake). I spoke tot he General Manager and he reolved this for me in an instant! Now that is what I call great customer service! Thank you to all the STAY team who made my stay in New York extremely memorable!

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: ruthCH079
Reviews.Content: I very much liked my stay in New York - the more I had the chance to stay at the hotel Stay - just a ffew meters from Time Square. It was an outstanding stay-nice big room on the 9th floor, very friendly and supporting staff as well as excellent food.Since I was staying for quite a long time(18 days....) I more than once needed assistance from the front desk staff. I could always count on their help-they found out everything for me.....In this regard I'd like to mention Sally Garcia and Guido receiving the guests at the stoor step. So I'm glad my son is soon going to spend a few days in New York - and where will he be staying at - the hotel Stay of course - where else.....Sally and Guido will be pleased to receive him - they both promised!!!!!!!!!!! Ruth Brawand from Zurich, Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “I love stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tatia065
Reviews.Content: The staff is excellent, the location is great, good value for money! The room was very clean and the lobby was very inviting. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad i chose Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Bunhun
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Stay hotel for a total of 4 nights and i'm very pleased with my choice! I requested for a quiet room after making my reservation as my husband & i are light-sleepers and was glad to get a room on level 9. The hotel is very near to Times Square and is relatively near the subway station. Although the room was small, it was okay for the both of us. It was clean and the bed is very comfortable. Only thing is the water take some time to heat up so it will be good if you can turn on the tap in advance before showering. There is a 'do not disturb' sign which u can turn it on at the door so it is not like the review i read below which says that sleep was being disturbed. We had a good sleep throughout our 4 nights and will definitely head back to Stay again when we go back to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: M3lody11
Reviews.Content: Only good thing about this hotel is it's location. Right smack on time square. Room is very small, price of this room can get a better hotel around the same location. House keeping service is bad. They knock on your door every early morning to check on whether they can come in to clean, the hotel dont have any thing to hang at the door for house keeping or do not disturb. Basically they will knock every couple of hrs to check starting from 9am which is very disturbing when you asleep still. Hall way sound proof is very lousy, basically u can hear everything. I stayed at the 5th level and I can hear the hotel bar banging with music and crowds almost every night until 3am. No ice no hot water. Basically very simple small room, good location but won't come back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great service,perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ana_83_11
Reviews.Content: Located one minute from Times square, close to Broadway, MOMA museum, with pleasant rooms, nice bar in the hotel, modern interior and above all- excellent staff this hotel is a perfect place for young people! Concierge at the hotel, girl named Ana, was very attentive. She helped us find the best tours around the city, tickets for Broadway show, advised us about City fast pass - that helps you save money and wait less for seeing attractions ... you name it. The only drawback of the hotel was internet- we had to sign in to some site in order to get free internet in the room- took us some extra minutes but it was solvable. For sure i would try to get the same hotel when i come to NY next time.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great service”
Reviews.Author: jetset1967
Reviews.Content: I travel for business on a weekly basis and I've stayed at this hotel at least once a month since last fall. I have never been disappointed by the service I receive from everyone I encounter. During my latest trip the front desk was very flexible about a mixed up reservation (my fault), the engineer answered my request for a safe in 15 minutes, and the doorman hailed a cab with a smile. The front desk manager and Sally, Oscar and Sam provided the kind of service that keeps me coming back to this hotel. Other points: The rooms are small (it is New York, after all) but the beds are among the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The rooms have always been spotless. The location is great. It's close to shopping, theaters and several restaurants that offer prix fixe menus. I think the hotel restaurant is run by different management. The food is usually pretty good, the drinks are strong (in a good way) and I personally enjoy the DJ. I would not; however, count on having breakfast here. There have been a few times when I went down and it was either closed (with no notice) or only coffee and muffins were offered for sale. On the whole, the hotel has everything I need for a great stay in New York, including friendly faces.

Reviews.Title: “Staff at this Hotel is without question one of best ever”
Reviews.Author: DonnyGreco
Reviews.Content: I have to compliment the person who hires the staff at this hotel. never before have a met a staff like this from car service..porter to bar tenders they are all amazing. I mean this because I travel alot and it is refreshing to find a gem like this. Ask for JOSE MARTINEZ for car service....my colleague and I just spent the day with him on a trip to Connecticut and back to the hotel and I felt like I was with a long time friend.KUDOS to the staff at STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square - what more can you want?!”
Reviews.Author: bridgiebaby
Reviews.Content: The fantastically convenient and vibey location more than made up for slow lifts and a broken shower head! We got a great last-minute rate (can't remember if it was Expedia.com or Bookings.com) but I suspect if we had paid full-rate, my rating would have been lower. The staff were fantastic - particularly the helpful and friendly Dennis at reception. The rooms very clean and attractive but the hotel is not completely sound-proofed and getting to sleep before 1am may be difficult. Our shower (room 523) wouldn't stay attached to the wall. Free internet in the business centre may have had virus - it was so slow, we couldn't use it. Would we stay there again? - absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Good Loaction but small room”
Reviews.Author: Mas_The_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great, just off Time Square. But the room is tiny, like others have said, just big enough or the bed, room is very drak and you can hear everything in the hall way and the room next door. The pictures you get on the site are of the reception area which is done up, the rest of the hotel is just like any other NY brownstone, small, dark and dated. They are differently miss representing the hotel by focusing their picture on reception areas. There are only two very small lifts servicing the whole hotel (only one in the main area), so going up and down was a pain, we ended up taking the stairs on most occasions. Staff were okay not bad but not too helpful, but remember to take a normal cab back to Airport, their pre-paid service cost be almost twice as much! The reason for the low score is that it doesnâ€™t cut the grade for a 4*, itâ€™s a very good 3* in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Right at the center of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Duartini
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff very nice! Clean and quiet! Surprising how we could found this lovely hotel right in the middle of Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Moonpie711
Reviews.Content: Rooms are modern, and sleek. Bedding is clean, and nice, as well as the bed size itself. Room is small, but it is New York City after all!! Bathroom was a decent size and clean. Quite! We didn't hear another guest the ENTIRE time. If you are looking for a place to time square, that is clean and accommodating the Stay is great :) We would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “We loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: bisousNorway
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home from our one-week trip to USA. We spent 4 nights at Stay. and 2 nights with relatives in PA. Our stay at Stay. was an awsome experience in any way. We found the hotel after googleing a reasonably priced 4* hotel on Manhatten, Midtown. When first arrived late in the evening we were given a small room with no closet to put the clothes in. The day after we asked for a room with a closet and we were then moved to a much larger room for the next 3 nights, with no extra charge. However, the both rooms were very well equiped, with a flat screen, bathrobes, iron, and most important of all: the most comfortable bed ever! The linen was very soft with a de-lux-feel in it. The hotel is just around the corner from Times square, and it's really near to a couple of subway stops. However, we could not hear any noise in the room, we slept very well there, no ear plugs needed. We also borrowed an adapter for charging the batteries, which was free of charge. Very large and nice umbrellas for rent as well at the hotel lobby, free of charge. The staff helped us with some advice on how to reach a train to the Newark airport (take a train from Penn station, it's the cheapest and fastest way to reach the Newark airport, and other way around). We only ate one breakfast there, it was a very expensive experience, and we would not do it again. We discovered a Starbucks and pret-a-manger on our way to 6th avenue and had our breakfast there. You can also buy food and drinks in a small store next door. Just vis-a-vis the hotel is a restaurant called Dervish, it serves turkish/greek food, and we had some wonderful meals/dinner/lunch there. Prices are very good there! Next to it is an Irish pub, but we did not try it. At the hotel we had a couple of small problems with the telephone and radio, but that was very quickly handled by Oscar the charming! We loved the place, and we would definitely come again! We would also recommend you to buy one-week subway ticket (if staying that long). It took us every place wanted in no time, for "no money". Taxis are cheap, but often stuck in the traffic. And don't forget the theater tickets booth, called tkts, where you can buy some cheap tickets for that evening's performances. The booth is just on the corner between 47th street and Times square, a 100m from the hotel. Have a nice stay at Stay. ! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: tranquilaNY
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a very central location. Everything you think a boutique hotel should be- cozy, warm, friendly with soft lighting. I accidentally reserved the room for the wrong day, I called and they canceled the reservation immediately, put me on the correct night and even gave me the same "deal". When I arrived my room was surrounded by smoking room and was unpleasant, i called to the front desk they gave me a new room and even sent the bellhop up with new keys. Amazing customer service!!! Room was typical new york, small but luxurious. It had a Bose stereo and even biodegradable toiletries. The Aspen social club was attached and perfect for drinks! I definitely recommend giving STAY a chance, it's super romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, great location, but room too small to claim 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: rapdc
Reviews.Content: 100 feet away from Times Square, nice lobby/common spaces, good sheets and amenities. HVAC was rather noisy; 8 of the 36 tv channels had no sound. Main issue is that the room was very small. I've been to NY many times and I expect the rooms to be small. But for an alleged 4 star place, this was VERY small. Westin calls itself 4 stars and is MUCH nicer. In short, STAY is a solid 3 star place in a good location. It's not a 4 star stay.

Reviews.Title: “"stay somewhere else" the worst stay”
Reviews.Author: hoteltraveler87654
Reviews.Content: this hotel is the worst ive ever stayed at.....the rooms oare about 8 by 8 feet . You can hear everthing in the hallway and stairwells..No ice or ice machines Cant access your car while u "Stay" if i could i would have stayed anywhere else in times square.... tried to order roomservice only to have to phone answered by someone who didnt nKnow anything about the menu and also had to wait 20 minutes on hold for just the order.Then i asked to speak to the manager and never even got a call back..my advice stay anywhere else dont befooled by photos the lobby,s as small as the rooms some pathetic fish and cubicle seating...a weak attempt to be "hip" more like ...custied out..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and the perfect location for your NY stay”
Reviews.Author: leeoliver
Reviews.Content: Attentive staff to guide you through your stay whether new to NYC or returning guest. Personal touches in terms of housekeeping ensuring you didn't go without any toiletries. Commited to ensuring your stay is memorable and will go above and beyond to deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot to STAY”
Reviews.Author: sunnyfer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 1st days of our honeymoon. Perfectly located in Times Square. Service was really good. Love the decoration and style of the Lobby, the bar was great and with accesible prices. The rooms were tiny tiny and the bathrooms even more, but that's expected in NY., the bed was soooo comfortable, nice sheets and pillows. The concierge was a nice guy who suggested and recomended us lots of places, restaurants and plays to visit. He was very kind and helpful. I loved staying at this hotel, love the vibe it has.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Rookieposer
Reviews.Content: We visited in January "11 and 1st thing I noticed was the receptionist's were lovely very friendly and helpful, next was the gorgeous lobbey, I ventured in the the bar to try a local bottle of beer $8 sweet gawd across the road same bottle $4 no surprises where we put slot of our hard earned money, the room was tiny but comfortable with exception to the noisy heating in the middle of the night ? As I previously said only for location you would prob Stay else where (pun intended) the security at night was bad any one could walk in and did walk in. Management were rude when rang up in middle of night to complain about noise, Only for the lovely receptionists I had a bad service from this hotel, wouldn't recommend for this alone,

Reviews.Title: “NOT SATISFIED FOR A 4 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: matteomatteuzzo
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights, position of the hotel is delicious (times square) but the big issues are: Room cleaned to a satisfied level The room are big like a closet, noisy especially at lower floors due to the presence of a disco (you can hear the music) heating system of the room is really noisy you can't sleep when is on. The staff is OK Wifi is free only in the hall These are not requirements for a 4 star hotel according to my opinion. Seen the the hotel is really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “STILL EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: lcesar
Reviews.Content: Once again I have to say that Stay. is still an excellent hotel. Jazilyn Fernandez, Fatema, Sally (one name is missing, sorry) do a fantastic job at the Front Desk. Walter Carmona and Ana Jankovic they are in their place: Concierge. They know everything about Manhattan. I do intend to come back. Luis Araujo

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryMG1
Reviews.Content: I travelled for a quick NYC weekend with my granddaughter. Her first time to the City (she's 11). We got in early Friday afternoon, checked in, Alex checked our luggage so we could wander Times Square before our room was ready. The hotel is lovely - from it's eclectic design to it's impeccibly clean room. Our room was very small - but we didn't need any more since we were "out and about" from early morning to late evening. Why would you need to pay for a bigger room only to sleep? The bed was very comfortable, room service in the morning was very good (except the coffee - way too strong for my taste). Staff was great - concierge gave all sorts of tips on where to go and what to see - if we didn't already have an itinerary. He got my granddaughter to WANT to go to MoMA and St. Patrick's Cathedral....how great is that? I can't say enough about it.....I would love to go back! (well - we didn't want to leave :( ...)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay/Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: tyffany6
Reviews.Content: I just have to say that from the time I booked this hotel until the very end...it has been wonderful. I saw an ad for a particular price online and when I called I was not able to obtain that price. The General Manager (C. Mallon) contacted me directly and gave me the advertised price. He was so accomodating towards me. I travelled with my 10 year old daugther, my friend and her 10 year old daugther. We did not know what to expect...Well, it was great. The location is fantastic..5 step to Times Square, close to EVERYTHING... I have never stayed so close to Times Square. The rooms were clean, the staff was fantastic. I called down for extra towels and they were knocking at our door within 5 minutes. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff is exceptionally friendly, nice and courteous. I will go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Action”
Reviews.Author: joannek81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stay Hotel with friends and on first arrival the staff where helpful and friendly. The reception was very nicely laid out and the bar/restaurant were reasonably priced and very popular with locals. The rooms were a little small and not great views but the hotel is just off Times Square and in an excellent location for all attractions in New York.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Athens_Greece_Val
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a perfect spot, just 2 minutes walk from Times Square. The hotel personnel is very kind and helpful (they even offered big umbrellas when it rained). There is free internet, we could check our mail and check in to our flight from the lobby. But... the rooms are tiny and the bathroom even smaller! We had a medium queen size room, but the bed dimensions were smaller than the normal double bed (and we are really fit). There is no place to leave the luggage, the hotel's walls are not soundproof, so we couldn't have a good sleep and from our window we could see...a wall! I would prefer to walk more and feel more comfortable when reterning to the room from sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what an amazing STAY literally!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Girlsinluv
Reviews.Content: We live in NYC but enjoy getting away once in a while for a nice relaxing few days. After MANY, MANY searches for hotels we came across The Stay Hotel on booking.com. My main concern was the fact that all the hotels in NYC have issues with Bed Bugs right now and have for years. So I went on several sites and looked for a hotel that has never had any reported problems or reports of Bed Bugs. This hotel came up as one that has had neither. We called the hotel direct and spoke with Amary the night clerk. He was wonderful and so helpful. I knew right away we needed to book our stay. We went to the website and might I just add the Stay Hotel is far more beautiful then the pictures on the website. The feeling you get when you walk in the doors is so relaxing and comfortable. The atmosphere is incredible. Sally was working at the front desk and she was so very helpful in our of our requests for our stay. (So far so good 2 out of 2 staff members were very caring and helpful). She made sure we had everything we needed and was so pleasant and friendly. We needed assistance in our room and Sally sent up Oscar. I always get a little nervous about having someone I don't know come into my room but wow was I surprised. Not only friendly and very professional also very funny. He was helpful in answering some questions we had for our stay in the area. When we needed extra towels we had the pleasure of meeting Mohammd. He was so friendly and you could tell right away he really was here to please and take care of the guests because we tried to tip him and he didn't accept it and said " Iam here for you" WOW I mean really how often do you hear that from a staff member at a hotel!!!!!! So nite rolled around and we realized we had forgotten our slippers so we called down to the front desk to ask if the had some here at the hotel. We then met Dennis who was very helpful and in no time we had slippers delivered to our room. When we went down to the lobby to ask about some shipping needs we had we were amazed at how helpful Dennis was. He not only answered our questions he helped us sign up for the "IPrefer" Rewards Program thru the hotel. Bottom line this hotel could be the best kept secret in NYC!!!! Great prices, great location and a staff that goes above and beyond for their guests. I have traveled and stayed in tons of hotels and I can honestly say I have never in my time ever had such a wonderful experience. The staff treats you like your family, the hotel it self makes you feel like it is your home away from home and what more could you ask for!!! ****NOTE TO OTHER TRAVELERS**** This hotel is a must!!! It has everything you need and much much more!!!!! You could not ask for a better experience I can promise you that. Amazing amazing amazing!!!!!!!! Again "what an amazing Stay literally"

Reviews.Title: “Best guest services i have ever encountered.”
Reviews.Author: smithrep72
Reviews.Content: After a horrible experience at another hotel in the CIty, I booked a room last minute at "stay". Guest services representative, Sally Garcia, was beyond accommodating. She was pleasant, and quick to checking me in. I will definitely be returning to "stay" on future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “I wish there are more hotel managers like Christopher Mallon.”
Reviews.Author: Ys238
Reviews.Content: I am looking for a place to stay for my visit to NY in the end of March. After seeing the special offer of Stay on Internet, the complain of a customer and the response from Christopher Mallon, the general manage of this hotel, I decided to writer an email to verify if the special offer was real. To my big surprise, I got an email reponse from Christopher immeadiatly. I am very impressed by him through several email exchanges and even its special offer does not work for me, I believe this hotel is very trustful with a manager like Christopher Mallon.

Reviews.Title: “What a great STAY!”
Reviews.Author: kinnie70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last November and the previous November. We found it to be wonderful both times. I must mention Jazilyn the receptionist who was friendly and efficient. We did not have the voucher we had received from our first stay there and she negotiated a free night with the manager for us - Thank You! Whilst the rooms are not huge, they are comfortable, nicely decorated and the location is superb. We will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect "Stay"”
Reviews.Author: FreshNell
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, now my fiance booked the hotel for us for a 2 night stay. We extended our stay because our room, especially the bed was so comfy. We live in the countryside and expected to not get a wink of sleep in the hotel because of the location but in fact we both could not get over how quiet it was. We checked out and travelled half way across town only to discover that i had left my wallet somewhere in the hotel. Fortunately for me some honest person had found it in the computer room in the lobby and handed it into reception with everything still in it. What a relief. We will def stay at "Stay" again.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed for 3 incredible days, which is about how long it took for us to get something from room service”
Reviews.Author: cbg9323
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very spacious and the location was great. The front desk and concierge were incredibly helpful and very informative. It was really quite and the bose ipod player is pretty awesome. The only negative thing was the room service. We waited 4 1/2 years for a bucket of ice and then another 3 months for 2 glasses. They seem very nice and willing to help on the phone, but once you hang up, you have to shave twice before they knock on your door. The only thing else negative about this hotel is the restaurant. You have to pay 5 dollars and a left nut for a bagel with cream cheese, and above all, it takes 20 minutes to make.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jaseace
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife for her birthday and early anniversary for what was our first visit to New York. The hotel is situated very close to times square, in fact from leaving the hotel doors you can walk onto times square within seconds, but it is still far enough away for an uninterupted sleep which is certainly what we had for the six nights we stayed. The hotel has a very 'chic' and stylish interior and I was impressed with the hotel lobby area upon arrival. The staff we dealt with were all very friendly which to be fair is what we have come to expect on previous visits to the states - certainly put ourselves to shame on the service side of things. Check in was quick and efficient and we were given a room on the 5th floor, the elevator we found was quite slow and seemed to take an age to get to the floor but again this is just a minor gripe. I did ask for a room with a view of the city but we only got a room looking at other windows of the hotel but to be honest I think where the hotel is located it may not have been possible to get a different view but thats not a problem. The actual room was a double guest room and has a safe, ironing board with iron, a refridgerator stocked with drinks, hairdryer, 2 bath robes which was a nice touch and a flat screen tv which was on the wall, a 'Bose' clock radio and a telephone. We found everything to be clean and the bathroom has a large shower. There were no tea making facilities in the room but room service was available if required. I had read reviews saying the rooms are small and yes, I have stayed in larger rooms but it as certainly large enough for two people and as already touched upon we were not disturbed at all during the night. The bed was comfortable and the room has air conditioning which was needed as we found the rooms to be warm which was no bad thing. We only ate at the hotel once and that was at breakfast which was very nice and filling, we wanted to eat somewhere different each day and that was the only reason we didn't eat at the hotel more than that. The hotel bar is nicely set out and again staff were really friendly. There are loads of other bars and places to eat near to the hotel if you do want a change. The hotel does also offer WI-FI access which you can get for free. I can't really think of anything which we didn't like about the hotel and I would definately recommend anyone to try this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Friendly staff, hotel with a good location!”
Reviews.Author: Kaisa189929
Reviews.Content: I really want to thank Hotel StayÂ´s staff of friendly service. Special thanks to Concierge Walter Carmona. He is execellent at his job! His friendliness really made as feel as a guests welcome. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, small but excellent hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: hiact0r
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at stay. It's a small hotel, a few houses from times square. The room was clean and comfortable, bathroom was fully equipped and clean as well, staff were friendly and helpful. Overall I can nothing but recommend Stay for a stay in midtown Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “For the sleek, petite, and discriminating traveler”
Reviews.Author: brookemily
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel and the restaurant! I was traveling alone and stayed three nights. The room was small, stylish, well-appointed and had every amenity I needed--fluffy towels and robe, hair dryer, iron, toiletries, internet for a $10 fee, and a comfortable bed. I ate at the restaurant twice because the service was excellent, the food was fresh and delicious, and the small plates were the perfect quantity for a later dinner. It's not a boring hotel cafe, it's a hip bar/restaurant. I was on the 4th floor, which was plenty quiet. They have two open staircases, so I was happy to be able to use the stairs and not wait for the elevator. The location is incredible! There is a market next door that sells fresh fruit salads, coffee, breakfast sandwiches, and dairy. Starbucks is across 7th. You don't get the Times Square noise because it's on a side street, yet you are steps from the subway and Broadway. Walk to Hell's Kitchen around 9th (hotel is between 6th/7th) and there are plenty of great real NY restaurants that are not the touristy TGI Fridays of Times Square. You will appreciate this hotel if you are a minimalist, organized, and petite solo traveler (not too tall or chubby) who chooses quality over quantity and is comfortable with an experience that is more typically European than middle America. If you are very tall, very wide, carry a lot of luggage, or need to pace your room, this may not be the place for you. I only had one issue. The heater is loud, so I should have requested an additional blanket for the bed. Would you select the sashimi plate and cucumber salad and leave feeling comfortable knowing you had delicious, high quality food or would you go to Claim Jumper so you can get a large portion and be completely stuffed?

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great hotel -the stay”
Reviews.Author: lmsyd
Reviews.Content: The stay was a great hotel! It is just around the corner from time square. Everything you want or need is in the area. The staff members were amazing. They were friendly and helped me with every issue I had, including a parking ticket. They went above and beyond in assisting me with that. I also liked the fact that there was a lounge down stairs. Great hotel for those who love to party! The stay is the place where I will literally stay every time I visit the city that never sleeps. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service which kept outdoing itself”
Reviews.Author: PandIorJ
Reviews.Content: The service at Stay can not be faulted! The staff were always friendly and remembered you from previous times. Nothing was a drama for them - even when I kept getting replacement access cards because I kept putting mine next to my credit card; or when my husband had a sleep in and the cleaners were waiting (patiently) for the room to be empty; or when we had to book 2 extra nights because our flights got cancelled (they even happily matched the internet prices). Then to top it all off, when I found out back in Australia that the town car we used to go to JFK had double-charged us, the staff at Stay contacted the town car company on my behalf and organised the refund for me. Another great advantage of this hotel was the location. So close to Broadway and comedy shows and still walking distance to Central Park. There's a great diner just 2 doors down which was our main breakfast haunt (and even has yummy black and white cookies). We also tried out the Turkish Restaurant across the road and were happy with the food on offer there. The only downside really is that acouple of nights the Aspen Social Club is playing loud music late into the night (I think it's Thurs, Fri and Sat nights). I can't say it affected our sleep at all but I could see how it could be annoying for others. My advice: ask for a room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to "Stay" in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: caholmes
Reviews.Content: I took my partner to NYC with the plans of asking him to marry me. I spoke with the Chief Concierge named Walter via phone off and one the days leading up to our arrival. What can I say, other than he went above and beyond in assisting me every step of the way! I contacted several hotels in the area and as a gay couple many turned me away when I asked for their assistance in planning the BIG question. Walter and the entire staff of Stay never batted an eye and were amazing! I know that for my partner and I, each and every time we visit NYC we will be staying at Stay. This goes for anyone and everyone that we know!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Amazing Hotel, Great Location, VERY New-York style Shiek!”
Reviews.Author: drwalsh06
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was absolutly amazing. After reading the more current reviews about Stay, I was a little nervous about booking for me and my girl friend, but I did and it was wonderful! First off, the location could not be better. Literally about 20 steps from the top of times square. Noise not an issue. The hotel lobby is sooo New Yorky with awesome decoration and design, exactly what I had wanted this being my first time here.The resturant downstairs was VERY high class and the decorating was unbelievable!!! Food was great and atmosphere was even better. The room was very small, but what I had expected. Amazing sheets and pillows (soooo soft) on the very comfortable bed. Hot water was not problem and the A/C worked perfectly. Big T/V in front of the bed (but beware of the 3, 24hr. adult channels, smack dab in the middle of the channel line-up..-I loved em')Everything worked great and the staff was extremely friendly and took care of me very well. They even sent complementary cupcakes with candles because it was my girlfriends birthday! Business center was great for finding out new places to go, just a room with 2 computers and free internet. Bad things could possibly be slow, small elevators, but there are only 8 floors, was not a problem during my stay. All and all, the hotel was GREAT! The price was sooo cheap from priceline and everything was as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; tiny, noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: travellerdolcevita
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel only if you're in NYC to see the city; the rooms are incredibly tiny (hardly can walk around the bed), the ventilation is noisy and indeed; you can hear every room door closing around you (and toilets being flushed next door), the rooms are so close to each other. Having said that, the location is priceless, Time Square is literally round the corner, and if you want to spend only the night in the hotel; you don't necessarily need the space.

Reviews.Title: “Stay. My favorite hotel in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: LoveNYC_11
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC countless times and stayed all over Manhattan but I have to say that STAY is my new favorite hotel. I was only there for 2 nights (unfortunalely had to transfer to the Waldorf Astoria Towers). From the cool hipster ambiance of the lobby to the dark seductive hallways, this hotel is defiantely a must for the ultra young and hip. I'm already planning to book again for the Spring.. And Danny at the front desk is so helpful and charming.. So take your girlfirend/boyfriend or both and come to STAY. I promise, you will not regret it. ps- this is not the hotel for families with kids, it will ruin it for the rest of us.

Reviews.Title: “Does size really matter???”
Reviews.Author: mcm1970
Reviews.Content: First off we arrived a little over an hour past check in so you would think that our room would be ready. Well, it wasn't! We were told the person previously in "our" room had a late checkout. Our options were to be downgraded to a Queen size room instead of the King we had reserved (at no discount to us, just the regular Queen size room price), or we could wait over an hour until the King size room we reserved was ready. We chose to just take the Queen size room so we wouldn't have to wait. The room was very tiny, but I did expect that since it is in NYC. It was nicely decorated and clean. Nice view of the M & M store's GIANT jumbo tron tv but the curtains did keep most of the light out overnight. There is no closet or storage space in the room. Just a small arm sticking out of the wall next to the bed to hang a few things on. The bed was comfortable but my boyfriend and I both agreed it had to be a full size mattress and not a queen like we were told. It was small. The lighting in the rooms is horrible also. There is a mirror on the wall but no light anywhere near it so this makes getting ready to go a difficult task if someone else is using the bathroom. The elevators take forever to get to you and to get you to your floor. They're also VERY small. We are small people and felt very crammed just the two of us with our baggage (one each). The lobby is very pretty and the bar/ restaurant were good. I'd stay again but only if I have the room I was promised when I made my reservation. The best part was how close this place is to Times Square. So if you're not spending much time in the hotel or in your room it's a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are incredibly small, elevators even smaller`”
Reviews.Author: jwh86
Reviews.Content: Before stay i emailed the General Manager to request upgrading our room, as from TA i heard the rooms were really small. He never got back to me which i found surprising given how he follows up every review after a stay at Stay on TA. Check in was nice Elevator took about 4 minutes to get to us and about 2 minutes to get to the 8th floor, several other guests i spoke to didnt use it as it was so small (5 people in it max) Room had nowhere for 2 bags bathroom was small but enough Bed was comfortable Noise in room - there is a nightclub on the 1st floor that you can hear on level 8, there is also a little noise from outside, but not too bad TV was good except when we turned it on it was on channel 66 which is a hardcore adult entertainment channel which is not what we were expecting. Got Id coming back into hotel on Saturday night due to the night club which is a little annoying when you should be a guest. All in all its ok value although very small it is very close to times square.

Reviews.Title: “Five star location, two star service”
Reviews.Author: tubbygalah
Reviews.Content: Stay. hotel boasts an excellent location (Times Square is literally around the corner) and rooms which are reasonably sized and very comfortable. We really liked the modern artwork and lobby fish tanks, which suits the overall atmosphere of the hotel. Our room had a comfortable double bed, TV with 30+ channels, desk, enough floor space for two suitcases (with room to move around still) and bathroom. The only issues we had with the room itself were the loud heater motor and slow-to-warm shower. Not a huge issue, but a bit annoying in the mornings. Unfortunately for the first two nights of our six night stay, we were woken up by our neighbours loudly (and drunkenly) fighting. This was no longer an issue after we asked for a different room- evidently the rest of the hotel is very quiet, despite it's proximity to Times Square. The desk staff were not always as helpful as they could have been- the concierge twice gave us incorrect advice and the doorman refused to help us carry our bags to 7th Avenue upon check out to catch a cab (47th Street was closed due to snow). The cleaning staff were very pleasant in the hallways and elevators though. We found it very convienent that there is a great diner literally meters from the hotel, the subway is close by and the shops are open til late. Plus, there is free wifi in the lobby, which is more of a comfortable lounge. Very handy! Overall, it is a very good hotel to stay at if you want to do the major tourist things but don't expect high standards of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “The Stay was perfect for a Bachelor Party”
Reviews.Author: duckturtle
Reviews.Content: Actually, I was at the Stay Hotel on July 2009 for my bachelor party, and I believe it was a perfect fit for a group of men between the ages of 25 - 50 just looking to party in NYC for five days. It wasn't my first time to NYC, but it was for a my Father In-Law, Dad, and a few of my Groomsmen, so the location next to Times Squares (so they could get their Tourist photos), and a few bars was perfect for us. Also, it was easy to find all the Subways since they were close to our hotel. The price range was prefect for us -- there were three of us to a room. Also, there's a nice little diner next to The Stay which was perfect for breakfast. We had the good fortune of eating breakfast next to the Rev. Al Sharpton -- he didn't want to eat with us. The staff was great, the Bar staff was especially great and helpful towards us -- even suggested a few good places for us to party. My Best Man was good enough to get our rooms away from the Club, but to be honest with you, we were either too drunk or didn't get back to our room until after the club was closed, so the noise wasn't really a problem. Beds were comfortable which was a pleasant surprise. Bathrooms were clean which was my only main concern, because I hate hotels with dirty bathrooms. I must say the big window in the middle of the bathroom was a bit weird; I'm sure no one could see in but it took me back a bit. The room was very spacious especially compared to the hotel that my wife and I stayed in about a year prior. I'm heading back to NYC in May of this year with the Mrs. and I might pick the Stay again for that two day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and Comfortable King Room”
Reviews.Author: GABuyer1
Reviews.Content: The bed was very comfortable with high thread count sheets. Furnishings are contemporary. The room was spacious by NYC standards; it was large enough for two people. The bathroom had nice slate floor tile, a pedestal sink, and a large shower with good water pressure, but there was no bathtub. Fluffy bathrobes and a safe were in the closet. A mini-fridge was under the desk. The front desk staff was courteous and efficient. Don't miss the vertical fish tanks in the lobby! While on the way to our room, we could hear someone singing Broadway show tunes loudly in her room. Other than that, the hotel was very quiet. Despite a recent snowstorm, the sidewalks were pretty clear, and we were able to walk to Radio City Music Hall, just a few blocks away. It was a great stay, and we'll return as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “one night too long”
Reviews.Author: flitzaround
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here.....on night too many. I have been travelling in the USA for 7 months in comparably rated hotels. This is by far the worst. Is there enough room in this review to cover all the complaints. The room was so dark I could hardly see, making it very difficult to sort clothes, etc. The shower arm was broken. There was no room service menu (they were being printed). It then took 30 minutes.... a mush of something which was tasty and edible, and a salad smothered in oil and squashed with plastic wrap. And a glass of wine. $74!!!......I also had a sick stomach for a week afterwards?? The air conditioner was very loud. The lifts are inadequate and very slow.
