When I went to sleep I had the TV on a Public Television channel; next morning I switched it on to the next channel and was confronted with hard core pornography....for the next 3 channels as well. I was disgusted and insulted and was very pleased I didn't have a child with me. Is this legal? The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the stay for a great stay ;)”
Reviews.Author: Yshai
Reviews.Content: We cancelled our reservation at the Milford Plaza after sleeping there 2 nights in 2 different rooms... It was terrible... dirty and very old. So we decided to try the Stay Hotel. We got to see the room before booking and it was great. Because of the christmas holiday we got a free upgrade to a deluxe room. The room was good. Small for a deluxe but it looks nice and has a great Bose Wave as radio and alarm clock. At night it is a bit noise because it is located around the corner of broadway but it was ok. Subway across the street so that made our trip extra pleasant. All in all very nice place to stay in new york!

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: BALPMAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Stay Hotel NY between Dec 10th through 13th. The location was great. However, the reason I write this review is a single staff working in the hotel named Sally Garcia. She was always smiling, sincere, enthusiastic, kind and helpful. I would like to thank to her once more from here and sending my best wishes again. As long as she works in Stay Hotel, I would definitely consider to go and recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARS819
Reviews.Content: First time in NYC, and we chose a place close to Time Square which it is only steps to the bright light. Very modern/attractive inside, donâ€™t be discouraged from the outside. We were expecting a small room (heard all of NYC hotel rooms were small), and boy was it small. The king bed we had to upgrade too was so small, I am 5'9" and my feet hung off. This was not a King size bed, but for some reason was really wide??? There is a club /restaurant/NIGHT CLUB downstairs and we were excited to check it out. At night on the weekend the club goes until 4AM!?!? We were on the 4th floor and the music kept us up, until about 2AM, we heard screaming, looked outside and a fight had broke out from the club. Luckily they closed down for the club for the rest of the night. The other disappointing thing that happened was I accidently broke a bottle of nail polish in the bathroom sink (no cabinet space for anything in the bathroom) and did not have polish remover. I called downstairs to see if they had polish remover or would help me and they said "no, but you better clean it up or you will be charged for that, but go down the street to the market and buy some." This was a little irritating since most hotel staff in other places seem to always want to help since you are the guest visiting. I assumed since we had paid a lot of money to stay there, they would of been more understanding, it's not like I did it on purpose. Overall the location is great, and I truly enjoyed my first trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “the Stay Hotel,made it even better”
Reviews.Author: Mark60898
Reviews.Content: on our wedding anniversary vacation trip my wife and I were greeted in a friendly and professional manner upon our arrival at the Stay Hotel. Checking in took only a few moments and the Conceirge took us to our very spacious room,that was complemented with Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries.The Stay Hotel being located near the heart of Time Square puts all the excitement of NYC in walking distance. i recommend the Stay Hotel for anyone interested in visiting NYC,i know i will not stay anywhere else from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: fionaot
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in November with my boyfriend. After reading the reviews on this website I had prepared myself to be sleeping in a wardrobe for the week-not so, thankfully! when we checked in(fabulous lobby area) we were told we were getting a "medium" sized room as we were stayin for 6 nights- it was more than enough room for me and my boyfriend and two large suitcases. Really nice bathroom too, huge shower and cleaned perfectly everyday. A little on the pricey side but i guess you pay for location- times square is at the end of the street. We did have a couple of nights distrubed sleep from the loud music downstairs. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never on a Friday or Saturday!”
Reviews.Author: UKSevenoaks
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel is relatively modern and appears to have been refurbished to a rather fashionable standard recently and is also very central to all mid town attractions, I would strongly suggest that unless you plan to use the downstairs nightclub that operates on a Friday and Saturday night you avoid staying here at all costs. We had an "upgraded" room on the second floor which happened to be directly above the bar / nightclub venue, the noise was incredible with objects literally bouncing on the table. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels all over the world some of which have suffered from varying degrees of noise on occasions but this is in another league. The club finishes at 3.30am but then the "phase two" starts, drunken kids banging on doors, shouting, swearing, arguing and generally doing what drunken kids do. I tried to change rooms at 2.30am but of course the hotel was fully booked. It is possible that rooms on higher floors are better but somehow I think you will still suffer. Having complained the following morning the manager readily offered us a significant discount but of course this never fully compensates for a complete lack of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ToodlesBetty
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews on trip advisor i was extremly concerned about my trip to New York and staying at "stay" for 5 nights. I emailed the hotel via the email given on the hotels web page and never received a reply, I re sent the email and then got a response that the mailbox was full, so indicating that the email was not checked or else changed. we decided that because of the excellent location we would just risk it and hope for the best!!! We had booked a medium Queen room and after reading all the poor reviews on room size i was expecting tiny, it was small but i would have serious concerns on how small a standard room was if what we had was a medium queen room. however we had enought space for a large bag at each side of the small double bed... we were "cozy" for our 5 nights anyways!! the rooms and bathroom were very clean, lovely fresh towels everyday and an overall clean appearance throughout.. on the down side we looked onto a flat roof and a wall, we had requested a quiet room away from the club and bar based on previous reviews so this wasnt an issue as there was no street noise, however there was a constant humming from a generator or air con until from outside all day and all night, if you were a light sleeper this would be a big problem as even with ear plugs you could hear it. the lift can be very slow but not a major issue. the staff are friendly and welcoming and the location is fantastic better that we had imagined, right on times square, perfect, the taxes came to over $200 more than the on line booking price so you would want to remember this when booking.. I would definatly return to Stay and really enjoyed our break in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST FRONT DESK IN TOWN”
Reviews.Author: lcesar
Reviews.Content: JAZYLYN, FATEMA AND NORMA they are the best. Jazylyn always smiling, Fatema takes a while to smile but she is great and Norma new in the hotel and a very nice person and very effective. Norma was a great acquisition and we hope she stays forever. Walter is the best concierge around, always a helpful person. Besides he knows everything and speaking in at least three languages. Me and my wife had a good time in the hotel and we thank these fantastics people. Luis and Maria Scarlet Araujo

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION AND VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: drea65
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a fantastic location steps from Times Square and very good value for money. Unfortunatly the rooms were extremely small even for New York standards and we could barely get our cases in!! The only downside was that we ordered a taxi through reception and it took us to the wrong airport!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Londontraveller1971
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel right on the edge of Times Square, but rooms are quiet (if tiny). We stayed for 4 nights whilst I was running in the NYC Marathon, and it served all our needs. We didn't use the bar much (for obvious reasons), the shower was a tad on the cool side, but the hotel loby had a good vibe, the bed was comfortable, and the room nicely decorated. Most of all, everything you could want of Manhattan was on our doorsteps. Good value, and we'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Stay? How about don't.”
Reviews.Author: bexiboo09
Reviews.Content: I haven't reviewed on this site for a while but after retrieving my password, I'm doing a bit of a catch up. I stayed at Stay Hotel for 2 nights in April and it was probably one of my worst stays in a hotel. The hotel is spectacular in the public areas, you can't deny that. It was the funky decor and attached bar that led me and my colleague to book the rooms in the first place. We came from another hotel in NYC to this one as we were staying in the city on our own budget for the weekend and the hotel staff kindly offered to look after our bags as we were too early. No problems there so we headed out for the day. We came back and that's where the issues started. The hallways are gloomy and tiny, the rooms even more so. My room faced a wall and had no hanger, just a pull out rack from the wall with no hangers on it. The bathroom was small and my toilet leaked - This was reported several times throughout my stay and nothing happened. My colleague had to move rooms as his hot water didn't work in his room. Mine achieved lukewarm status after a few minutes but it still wasn't a pleasant experience. The air con was so noisy at night that I couldn't sleep properly and yet turning it off wasn't an option due to the unseasonably warm weather beginning of April. There was also people walking up and down the corridors or night and the walls were paper-thin. I was ill during the stay and ordered room service one night. This turned up from downstairs over an hour later, after one follow-up call, and was stone cold. Not the greatest of experiences. The final straw was when I came downstairs in the lift to check out at 4am and could smell weed in the hotel lobby. I asked the receptionist if she could smell it, as it was particularly pungent, and she just shrugged. I did email the hotel afterwards to complain about my experience and did, to their credit, get an email back. I just wish I hadn't shelled out so much to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, but not great”
Reviews.Author: galactictravelers
Reviews.Content: We were in New York to see a show and celebrate my Birthday. My partner and I choose this hotel because of fun ambiance it provide from the photos on their website, when we arrived we were disappointed with the room, it was tiny, one widow facing a wall. The bathroom was super small too, not enough room for two people. No coffee-maker either, just a fridge fully stocked with over-priced drinks. The service was pleasant enough, but when we got back in late we were hassled and asked if we were staying at the hotel by staff hanging out in lobby. My over all impression is its looks great on the website but everything is much smaller and looks of lesser quality in person. I wouldn't stay at Stay again. Location is near Times Square, so expect mobs on the weekends, we couldn't find anything else note worthy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Stay? Overbooked, bait and switch.”
Reviews.Author: busitraveller_10
Reviews.Content: I booked the Stay Hotel as part of a special birthday weekend with my daughter. I called the night before to confirm everything was in place and met with terrible service from the reservations staff. So, I had my travel agent call back and speak with the manager to be sure everything was set. When we arrived at the hotel, near midnight, we were told that they had cancelled our reservation and had no more rooms. They claimed the credit card denied, but the card they mentioned was not mine. Initially, the manager said there was nothing she could do because they were full. I appealed for her to find us another hotel. She did, promising it was a comparable property. It was anything but comparable- dirty, and further away from the meeting and then social activities we have planned. I think the truth was that the hotel had overbooked and was able to get a higher price from another guest than the rate I had booked. Terrible service. Rude staff. Bait and switch, with no accountability.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: driaday
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic, 2 minutes from the centre of Times Square. Double rooms was extremely small with no wardrobes Service was abit slack, and staff did not seem interested sometimes. There is a bar/restaurant atteached whichis pleasant but servicew slow &servers could be rude. Bar got busy at weekends and customers had to use hotel toilets which staff did not clean. check your bill aswell as added extras appeared!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful! They are crooks”
Reviews.Author: vertef
Reviews.Content: They added $ 23 dollars on my bill after I checked out and claimed it was from the minibar! I did not consume anything from the minibar and I was asked at check out if I had and said no. Someone must have felt thirsty and taken water and Redbull ( I don't drink that stuff) and billed it to my account. And they didn't even believe me when I called them. Do not trust them check the minibar yourself with the staff ! It is too bad in spite of the very small rooms and the very loud club scene in the lobby I thought it was decent enough but I guess not they cheat too. I would not stay there again or recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay...away!”
Reviews.Author: beachrunner123
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write negative reviews, but... I am used to the price and size of Manhattan hotel rooms, but this room was ridiculous. Max 10x10, No closet! Rack on wall, and oh yes, bring your own hangers. No drawers to put clothes away, I KID YOU NOT!! The bed took up the whole of the room, a very, did I say, very small bathroom, again, no place for toiletries. We paid almost $500 for one night for this. Least I forget the flashing neon dancing m and m sign flashing into our room all night long. If the room didn't bother me enough, there is a "Social Club", their words, attached to the hotel which attracted young, rowdy people. The music blared into the lobby late into the night, (don't get a low floor!!) but what was shocking and a real danger to us was that the club opened to the elevators which lead directly to the rooms. Anyone could wander around the hotel unchecked. If the hotel states they have cameras to monitor this, they should be more concerned about preventing this!!!!!! The lobby is beautiful but upon check-in at 5 o'clock I couldn't see to sign in! Ambience taken to extreme! There are much better hotels in the area, much better priced, more amenities and reasonable rooms. I will not stay here again. If I were to say one positive, it was very clean. My advice... STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..Small Room...No Views”
Reviews.Author: slpilot
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before we booked the Stay hotel so I was expecting a small room. It actually was a little smaller than I expected but I've never been to Manhattan before so I didn't know what to expect. All in all the size was fine. I was disappointed that the room lacked a view of anything. It was a view of a brick wall, which made the room feel smaller and darker, but the hotel never advertised views. The location was amazing. Lounge and bar downstairs that is apparently a go to spot. On Saturday when coming back to the hotel we had to show our room key to avoid the line trying to get inside. The BIG downside to this is that the bar/lounge uses the same restroom as the lobby. On two separate early mornings (6-7 am), the men's bathroom was filthy from the night before with tons of paper towels on the floor. This was very unsatisfactory that hotel guests had to endure the dirtiness of club patrons from a few hours before. back to the location -- a 30 sec walk to Times Square and a few minutes walk to Rockefeller Center, Top of the Rock observation post, and NBC studios. Their sister hotel - The Night Hotel - has a cool lobby too. I think they are doing a cool job with the building they have and for the price they charge, but next time I'l opt for a room with a view and pay a little more. Oh, and the AC wasnt loud in my opinion. A steady hum. ALSO, the closet is very small and painted black and does not have a light. I had to use my iphone to find anything in there because the room lighting was too dark too. The hotel really should install a light in the closet or paint it white inside.

Reviews.Title: “WORSE SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED!! (and I travel 85% of the time for my work)”
Reviews.Author: v2blake
Reviews.Content: To Whom It May Concern, I had terrible service at your hotel from the time I checked in ... till the time I checked-out. I am a Chanel employee and our corp. office booked 8 rooms at your hotel from Sept. 22-25th. When I arrived on Wednesday, Sept. 22 (around 1:00 P.M.) I was greeted by a very nice doorman who took me to the front reception. When I arrived at the desk, there was a young girl socializing with another gentleman checking in. He was obviously flirting with her and she was discussing her life history of living in the Bronx and going into detail about her nightlife among other things. I patiently waited for 10 mins, and she saw me waiting to check in .. but continued to ignore me and flirt with the man as he engaged her. Finally the door attendant recognized my frustration and was apologizing for her. He got her attention and kindly directed her to me as I was standing there with all my luggage waiting. She told him and me to hold on as she was talking. He offered to take the luggage of the guy she was speaking to in order to move him a long and she snapped "I'll call you if he needs his luggage taken". Finally he found another front desk attendant for me ... this process was over 20 minutes and clearly set a tone for the service of my stay. The next morning, Thursday Sept. 23rd, my co workers and I went to the Aspen room for breakfast. There was one young lady working and she was clearly the only one available to service us. She did the best she could clearly, but the service was EXTREMELY slow since she was waiting on others, and I assume was doing the cooking as well?? It was impossible to get out of there in a timely manner due to her being the only attendant. We decided to try the Aspen room again on Friday, Sept. 24th to the same reception. We were having to chase down the waitress in the back to get our checks, refills, and service. I want to make clear this young lady was not terrible, she was very nice, but a hotel restaurant needs at least 2 people working in order to accommodate the guest! I finally left Saturday morning on Sept. 25th. When I went at 5:10 am to check out there was not a front desk attendant. I tried to call using the house phone, and no answer. The phones were ringing behind the desk from other callers (or guests) and no one was present. I went to the front door and the doorman was laid out on the chair snoring!! I tried to wake him up 2 times before having to shout to get him slightly awake. He was not coherent my first try, I asked if he worked for the hotel, and he mumbled "yes", then went back to sleep. I tried again to get him to wake up and he just mumbled. I once again tried yelling behind the front desk and there was no answer or help. I walked into the restaurant and no one. Finally I screamed at the sleeping door man and he finally came around. I told him I needed to check out and he finally woke up enough to radio the front desk guy. Upon the arrival (about 10 mins later) of the front desk attendant I was able to check out. The whole process took 45 mins!!! The front desk attendant asked if I wanted a cab and I informed him "yes I needed to go to LaGuardia". There was a black lincoln town car out front and I asked him if a cab was available? He said they were all the same price. I got into the car service and was hit with a $55.00 car ride to LaGuardia (which is normally ranging from $30 - 40) and was upcharged with a service fee of $5.00 for using a credit card.) Your attendant did not try to fulfill my request for a yellow cab service, he rushed me into the car service with the comment " they take credit cards and are all the same price". I am terribly disappointed in my experience at your hotel .. for $350.00 a night I can stay at the Essex house, or Helmsley Park Lane for much better service and room .. and I promise Chanel corporate travel will know my experience with your hotel as they use you for a lot of their business travel for their consultants! I spoke with another Chanel employee also staying during my visit and she had an even WORSE experience with service at your hotel. I am sure you will be hearing from her too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IFgirl
Reviews.Content: Stay is a great place to stay! If you plan on never leaving your room while in NYC, this place probably not for you. The rooms are a bit small, but very comfortable and clean. There is a closet but not alot of drawer space. There is a diner, grocery and irish pub steps from the hotel, you can see the red steps of Times Square from the sidewalk, yet the noise from the street or the nightclub could not be heard in the room. We were on the 8th floor so that may have made a difference. The sub way is steps away. Staff was pleasant, I didn't notice that the elvators were slow, there are two, very small ones but never had to wait more that 2 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Compact and well positioned”
Reviews.Author: paulbriden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located within 10 seconds of Times Square, and of two subway stations within eye shot. The rooms are very small, 12 ft x 12 ft but very well thought out and clean, The aircon was not the quietest but was very efficient, The room has a huge widescreen tv and the bed was superb if only 4ft wide. As you look at the front of the hotel, to the right is a superb Delli, which does a great breakfast roll and sells everything you would wish to eat. To sum it up, the room reminded me of sleeping in a well thought out Camper van.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: PnJ10
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we had a problem not having a credit card even though the travle agent insured us they confirmed with the hotel we didn't need a credit card. Because of it we had to pay a big deposit. Very clean room, small but comfortable for people who intent to explore the city. The location is great. When you step out and take 50 steps right you're on Time Square. The hotel staff was okay. When check out we had to wait over 3 hours to get our deposit back. We would definitily recommend to stay here to people with credit cards and want to expirience the best of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Stay...in a very small room”
Reviews.Author: miumiu4me
Reviews.Content: This was the smallest hotel room I had ever seen (although my husband insists his room in Madrid was similiar). It was a bit cramped for 2 people for 3 nights and the walls were a bit thin. I heard the neighbors on a few occasions. But it was mostly clean (the cleaning crew did leave garbafe out on the desk once) and nicely decorated. The location is great if you're in town to see shows, which we were. We went the Aspen club downstairs and it was fun, even if it was full of oddly dressed tourists (free fashion tip - don't go clubbing in your old prom gown). The staff wasn't rude, but they were pretty indifferent and one of the overnight people was sleeping behind the desk around 4am. I'd recommend Stay for a short visit to the City.

Reviews.Title: “Best avoided if you want a nice stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: guyaboutuk
Reviews.Content: Unless you are really desperate then donâ€™t stay at Stay! There is nothing boutique about it, basic would be a more honest description, though whoever took the pictures for the website is a real artist proving that the camera can really be used very creatively! There is nothing luxury about the guest accommodation. We paid for a king size room which was small and in need of redecoration. The bathroom was stark with a shower head which was drooping with fatigue. The TV didnâ€™t work properly though strangely the porn was not encoded. Itâ€™s not my thing but not good if you had young people in your party. Good luck playing â€˜lift rouletteâ€™; the smallest lifts ever and you need to guess which might arrive first and run up and down the corridor between them. Overlooking the cross street we did at least have a window but you needed to be a contortionist to see the sky. Mind you the single pane windows did mean that you could enjoy the noise from all the early morning traffic and the men emptying the bins long before the sun came up. It also meant you could enjoy the music from the â€œnight clubâ€� on the ground floor whether you wanted to or not. We were on the 4th floor, I canâ€™t imagine how it must have been for anyone lower. The staff are mostly noticeable by their absence; the concierge seems to be part time most of the time and apparently doesnâ€™t work at all on a Monday. Trying to find the door host to get lunch at the Aspen Club was equally difficult and in the end we gave up. NYC is such a great place full of quality, style and hospitality. Itâ€™s a shame that places like Stay lets it down so badly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Yannis84
Reviews.Content: I visited NYC and stayed at Stay for 8 nights. The hotel location is more than great just a couple minutesaway from Times Square. The staff is very helpful and polite and the lobby is a small piece of art. The room is tiny but this is expected in New York and since I only needed it for a shower and a bed it was fine (bathroom was a bit dark though). Very good housekeeping. Free wifi at rooms would be a major plus although sitting at the lobby is relaxing I would stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Such a hit-or-miss hotel”
Reviews.Author: bppotter
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here multiple times for business and I just never know what I'm going to get. It's more often a "miss" than a "hit." Sometimes the rooms have been clean and great; once I was assigned a room that was already occupied by another customer; frequently the room hasn't been cleaned after I've checked in. It's convenient to our NYC office, and I use it as a back-up if my other, regular hotel is full. The lounge with all its leather furniture is funky and fun, with a good atmosphere and a good vibe (with XM's CHILL playing in the background).

Reviews.Title: “location location location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hanora79
Reviews.Content: stayed here in march for St. Patricks day, the hotel is modern, the rooms are clean and comfortable but small but i expected this it being in new york. the staff were very professional in all dealings with them, the location of the hotel is the perfect base for touring the city, i would recommend this hotel and when i return to new york i will be staying here

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Swanky Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: no1likeval
Reviews.Content: I LOVE NYC! Therefore I try to stay at a different hotel each visit, but usually opt for midtown/times square...where the action is! The lobby here is small, but inviting. Reception clerks were very friendly and helpful, as was the concierge. Rooms were small, however we were generously given an 'accessible' corner room, with a more spacious room...by New York standards. Only thing about the bathroom in that room, the shower is wide open, with only a curtain. Showering is pretty much like standing in the restroom with a shower head; you will splash the toilet/sink. There's a small window you can open in the bathroom, and I could see the bright lights of time square from there! It was pretty cool out, so I left it open most of our stay. Bed was comfy, loved the ipod dock on the night stand, and the 'blackout curtains' . There's also a bar/lounge downstairs. We didn't get a chance to visit it, but heard a live dj and lots of mingling. Elevator is small and takes kinda long...but no big deal. Great place for the price, and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Chidders
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a small double room and it was indeed small. We were there for 4 nights and i think that would be the limit for that size room. However it was clean and tidy. We arrived on a Saturday night and we were wide awake until 4am due to the bar playing loud music downstairs. We were on the third floor. This late night music is on Thur,Fri and Sat nights, so we only suffered one night. However the location was amazing, it was literally 1 minute to Times Square. The reception was very funky and had free internet. The location more than made up fr our small room and the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Be Honest With Yourself”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityWomen
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest. What do you really want. Price..Location. Just start booking this hotel right now. New York is expensive. The only reason I use a hotel in New York is because it is convenient to everything. I don't need a pool or lounge. 95% of the time when I'm actually at the hotel, I am unconscouis...sleeping. That being said, I understand the reviews I read. The decor of the hotel was stylish. This includes the room. I was definitelly ok with the style. However, the room we received was the size of a large closet. The desk drawer handle was broken. Average cleanliness feeling. I could still see hair on my towel. Granted, it was my hair but if I was cleaning I would have removed it. It was an impression I received. The staff is not rude. Most respond to you but they are not service oriented. I went up to the desk several times. They kept asking me to move to move to where they're desk was. I guess they weren't where their desk is usually. They don't immediately respond to you that's true. They'd rather finish their own conversations with other staff members than see what the customer needs first. Also asked for a cab, ended up hailing my own cab in the rain. It was annoying but I'm pretty independent anyway. Plus, it's pretty hard to hail any cab in Times Square especially when it's raining so I can understand why they didn't seem really enthusiastic about it. The air conditioner was extremely noisy. I can sleep with noise if it's a constant noise but this air conditioner would be humming and then it would start another noise like rushing water or something. I fixed it by just turning on the fan instead of the air conditioning. The fact of the matter is the place needs good management. But lets be honest if it did, we'd be paying a lot more for the room so I'm ok with everything. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lisac1523
Reviews.Content: My friends surprised me with a trip to NYC for my 30th bday and we stayed at Stay. right in Times Square. The hotel was right around the corner from Broadway and minutes from everywhere else. When we told the front desk it was my birthday she upgraded us from a double to a queen and the room was very nice! The bed and pillows very comfortable! I also asked the hotel manager for a recommendation for my bday dinner and the place she suggested was awesome! She also sent a complimentary chocolate fondue and fruit dessert to my room to celebrate with a card! I've never been treated so well at any hotel ever! The only thing I recommend is to not stay on the second floor over their night club Aspen but we were warned before hand. Other than that I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will travel back again and again! Awesome price for an awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LellaSS
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at this hotel from July 16th through 20th. I had reserved via booking.com for a reasonable rate. The main reason I chose to stay here was its excellent location: it's basically in Times Square, corner of 47th and 6th Avenue, a block away from all the main attractions, like Rockfeller Ctr, subway and railway stations and only 5 minutes walk from Central Park. On my arrival I found out my room ( a standard queen sized) was upgraded to a King room. I was thrilled at first because I had not requested it and , moreover, I didn't have to pay extra. To my surprise, when I got to the room (room 820) I discovered the size of the whole room was miles away from being King sized. Anyway, it was clean, the bed was comfy and the bathroom spacious enough. Better suitable for one person, not for two. But once in New York , one would not expect to spend their whole day at a hotel, so for the night it was ok. There was a mini fridge in the room, a flat TV screen a Bose radio station with Ipod cradle. There was no proper closet though, except for a tiny wall closet with a safe and ironing board in it. So I had to leave all my stuff in the case. In the room rate a special pass to a nearby fitness center was included upon request at the reception, but I never took advantage of it. Free Internet connection was provided on the lower ground floor in the business center, as well as free copies of the New York Times. Breakfast was not included in the price, but giving the hotel's central location, loads of options where handy (Starbucks, Pret a Manger, Sbarro, to name a few). All in all , I would say that it is a place with no frills but good for exploring the city- far from top of the line but affordable and clean. I would recommend it to both young people on a budget and families and personally i would stay there over again. Only drawback, the heavy noise at night. I could not sleep most of the time. This is the toll one has to pay to stay in Times Square...but who cares anyway when you are in the City that never sleeps? .

Reviews.Title: “STAY far away from here”
Reviews.Author: donotSTAY
Reviews.Content: Lets start off by saying that it would be an EXTREMELY BAD idea to spend time at this hotel. Save yourself the heartache and stop by the lobby and lounge for a 45 second view of the downstairs decor. I read the reviews about this place and called right before I was going to book a reservation and spoke to a man by the name of Daniel. I expressed to him that though most people enjoyed the decor of the hotel, the noise would be an issue for me. I requested to have a room on floor 8, 9 or 10 if i was going to spend my 2 nights at their facilities. Daniel checked the occupancy and assured me that was not a problem at all, and was going to notate it in their files. So before grabbing a train out from Long Island, I called the hotel to verify my room arrangement... guess what, not only did they not have any notations of my room request (guaranteed via Daniel), they also had NO RECORDS of my reservation at all!!!! After spending an hour and a half back and forth on the phone with the front desk staff, priceline.com, and a man by the name of Noah at the central reservations office, the conclusion was that over the course of the past 30 hours, not a single manager at the hotel downloaded the reservations from the central reservations office (as well as there not being a manager on duty to do such tasks). End result, was that Noah had to call the hotel and have them do the reservation manually; to which the guarantee of a room on the top 3 floors was granted to me via Noah. Upon final check-in at the hotel, after already leaving my credit card for payment; I was given a room on the FOURTH FLOOR. I was baffled and argued with the man at the front desk for a minute, to which he replied to me "well sir, I understand that people told you that, but daniel isnt here right now and this is the only room I can personally give you." Man was I screwed. I just paid this hotel $775 for 2 nights stay. I was stuck in a room with only about a foot of room around the bed, the noise level from the streets and the club could wake up a hibernating bear, the housekeeping staff seemed to be constructing a village right outside my door, and the staff were straight up rude and disprespectful. After arriving home, I called and spoke to the general manager "Chris".. wow. what a shotty guy this is. I explained this entire experience at the hotel to him. He asked what would "make me happy", I told him I didn't think I should have to pay since... I already charged the room to my card, then got blown off for the guarantees made to me by both Daniel and Noah. his response was a rude chuckle, and a sarcastic "that isnt going to happen." He asked for my email address and then told me i would hear from him in the next 48 hours, but that unfortunately, I did stay at the hotel. I would once again recommend to stay far away from this place, the gorgeous decor is a facade to a poorly run organization. My guess is that they emptied their pockets on decorating and in turn, have no money left to pay for a good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are terribly rude / Managers ignore customers and do not deal with incidents!”
Reviews.Author: orlaclare79
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after a long flight from Ireland. We entered the very small shabby dark grey room which we noticed was tiny but we thought we are in NYC so it would not bother us too much. I went to open a window as the room was quite stuffy. When I lifted up the window the entire window came off its frame and smashed down immediately onto my left hand. I had to shout at my husband who was in the bathroom to come fast as i could not lift the window off. When i got my hand freed it was extremely swollen and my wedding ring finger had doubled to twice its originial size. Thankfully my wedding band had saved my finger being shattered/broken. I was upset and immediately put my finger under the cold tap. After a few minutes i phoned to reception and quite shakily told them of the situation. They did not seem to care very much but she said she would send someone up. About 10 minutes later two mainatinence man arrived up to fix the window! I was incredibly upset at this as I said I thought at least a manager would come up as clearly this was quite a serious incident and I was still in pain. The two men were embarassed as clearly they did not know what had happened. I told them that obviously we did not want to sleep in a room without a window so i said that i presumed we would be moved to another room. These two guys were actually nice and understood where we were coming from and they were the only ones that saw the size of my hand. About twenty five minutes later a manager PHONED the room and said that they were quite full but had another room they could move us to. I told the manager that i was annoyed this was taking so long as i was in pain and we just wanted to get unpacked and rest up. She then asked me if i needed medical assistance! I declined as the cold tap seemed to be bringing down the swelling a little however there was clearly alot of bruising. Also i informed her i was pregnant and could not take any anti-inflammatories. We moved to the new room which was smaller even and there was a bowl of fruit left there. We never heard one word from reception staff or a manager since. We were paying this hotel over â‚¬2,000 as we stayed there 9 nights and for the remainder of the trip we were pretty much ignored. Door men and reception were cold and unwelcoming, never saying hello when we passed which was also the same for other guests we spoke to. We were so disappointed with our stay as we have been to NYC twice and both hotels were so nice and welcoming. ONLY stay here if you like to be treated like you are nuisance. 12 days on my finger is still very bruised and I am unable to wear my rings. STAY ANYWHERE ELSE REALLY AS THE MANAGEMENT ARE SERIOUSLY LACKING CUSTOMER SERVICE HERE. All I wanted was for a manager to acknowledge that a window should not fall out on a guests hand and I would have liked an apology but instead we were ignored!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Jess1983Perth
Reviews.Content: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION, smack bang right near Times Square. A very modern, sexy hotel in the core of the city. Rooms and ensuites are tiny, but immecably clean. The quality of the toiletries were really good in comparison to other hotels. The mini bar has a sensor so you can`t keep your own things in there, though there is a really good mini-mart right next door. The staff are lovely, though I had to ring for ice numerous times on the one evening. The next street - West 46thSt is a lovely strip of good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Can find better hotel for same price elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jtaylor6
Reviews.Content: Cons: Brown water came out of shower head for awhile, Bed was sunken in, Dirty carpet, Toenails on bathroom floor, Loud AC, Close to the street and the walls/windows are not soundproofed in the slightest so could hear every little noise, Small room Pros: Nice lobby, Staff was friendly and they tried, not their fault the hotel was dirty and small, Good location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean modern rooms, fabulous common spaces”
Reviews.Author: atlgraham
Reviews.Content: By booking about two months ahead of time for a 4 night stay in late May, I got an average rate of $195/night. Compared to the other properties available at that price, I think Stay was an excellent hotel. Stay is in the middle of a one-way side street that leads into Times Square. The street itself is quiet, but literally within 20 paces, you are in the middle of Times Square. Great if that's where you want to be (or if you want to be close to the myriad subway lines near the hotel). Times Square location can be annoying on the other hand when you have to wade through all the tourtists just to get where you are going. I had an uneventful and pleasant check-in experience. My medium queen room was on the fourth floor which was quiet at all hours. The decor was modern, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The linens were fresh and new, and the bathroom, though small, was very nice and clean. I even had a little bit of a view, even though I believe my room looked out over the back of the hotel. The restaurant/room service menu looked great. I came close to grabbing a drink or some food from the restaurant, but ended up going out with friends instead. I also sat in the lobby for about an hour each night to catch up on email (free wifi in lobby; $9.95 per day in room). I have absolutely zero complaints about my 4 nights at Stay, and if I could get a room around $200 in the future I would surely stay there again. As for all the bad reviews about nightclub noise on the low floors, I can't speak to that (but I can say that if I had to live through that, it probably would have been miserable). Perhaps this hotel is only worth it if you can get a room on the 3rd floor or higher? P.S. My rate included free pases to the New York Sports Club, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable location, excellent service, and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerOfLife
Reviews.Content: This is an AWESOME hotel. The room service is excellent. You are 1/2 block from Times Square. If you want to have fun at night, there's a nightclub downstairs. But yet it's also quiet! I heard no noises from the nightclub in our room! The staff are knowledgable and courteous. The room service is EXCELLENT (large portions, great food, and again very nice staff). If you bring a car, not only do they have valet parking, but they also are right next to a parking garage if you want to park yourself. Also, despite what some other reviews say, the rooms are very large (I travel a lot for work so I would know a small room when I see it). And did I mention you're right at Times Square??!!! My stay at Stay was just wonderful! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not a high class hotel”
Reviews.Author: born2bowl2
Reviews.Content: Walking into the lobby you would think you are in a 5 star hotel but the rooms and the customer service tell a different story. Actually the people at the front desk are personable and friendly but the bellhop had to be paged 5 or 6 times before he showed up to get us our luggage. I understand the hotels are limited in space and the small size of the room did not bother me. What did bother me was a lose bathroom faucet, a broken bathroom shelf and a window that wouldnâ€™t close all the way so I was able to hear the street noise all night long. The elevators are unusually small and used by room service which makes it quite snug for 3 people and a cart of food. The bed was way too soft and seemed to failing in the middle. I think this is a good hotel is you get it a good price but not worth $300-$400 a night. PSâ€¦â€¦â€¦donâ€™t eat BBQ at Virgil's. If you want BBQ you are better off at Famous Daveâ€™s.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare...SIMPLY HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: bugstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend and let me tell you, everything about this hotel is deceiving. The location is good, but for this price, go to the W hotel. We were given rooms on the 2nd level, right above their club and it plays music until 2am. The music vibrated our room and we were unable to fall asleep until 2am. To make matters worse, we had to leave the next day on an 8AM flight, so we requested a wakeup call for 5am, which we did not receive!!!!! Luckily our colleagues called us at 5:45am to wake us up! When we called to change rooms at 11:30pm that night, we were given the 3rd floor! Are you kidding me? There is no way the 3rd floor would have been better. This hotel doesn't care at all about the customer, otherwise they would never sell a room on the 2nd floor. They should invest so money for better insulation. Not to mention, we had a street view and we heard the crowd and noise on the street all night since the WINDOWS were also poorly insulated. Our group is extremely angry and we urge the management to fully reimburse us for our stay. It is the only right thing to do at this point since they soured our trip to NYC and 100% duped us on a room that is practically like sleeping on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay again!! Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Thomp11
Reviews.Content: Stay was a great value for the money..Great Location. So glad I checked the reviews before we got to the hotel. I asked for a higher up floor so that we couldnt hear the night club downstairs. We didn't hear a thing and our room was great. Not big what so ever but we only slept in the room as we were out and about in the city all day. Go to the deli next store, the food was great and cheap and a great way to start the day. We stayed on the 9th floor so our room was nice, a small closet with a safe in it. Water was hot and the a/c was cold. We would stay again in a heart beat. Times Square is 3 steps to the right!!

Reviews.Title: “If you can avoid it, do NOT "Stay" here...”
Reviews.Author: VL199999
Reviews.Content: Too bad the rooms don't match up to the great location (Centrally located a half block away from Times Square). I'm not a particularly picky or obnoxious hotel guest. I don't make demands, and I don't typically complain about anything. BUT...then I stayed at this hotel. The lobby is adorable and the room is decorated in a contemporary/modern style which is nice. Unfortunately, the TINY (and I mean you barely have room to move around...THAT'S how small it is) room is a little uncomfortable. But, you only have to go to the room to sleep, right? Who cares how small the room is when you're in NY? Well, good luck sleeping. The walls are PAPER THIN. We could hear people coughing down the hall. Everytime someone closed their door in the hallway it woke us up. We could hear our neighbor's conversations clear as day. Friday night the club wasn't in full effect, but Saturday we were in for a double whammy treat....hallway and neighbor noise AND a thumping club we could hear from the third floor. The airconditioning vent is so poorly situated and LOUD. It was blowing from the ceiling right down into our faces. We then had to decide if we wanted to have cold air blasting us in the face all night (and the noise when the AC kicked on waking us) or deal with the heat. We turned the AC off despite it being overwhelmingly hot in our room. If you want the worst night's sleep of your life (we stayed two nights and went home thankful to be back), stay here. It's a shame because the beds were actually comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Night Club on 1st Floor of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: digitravel2000
Reviews.Content: There is a loud night club on the 1st floor of The Stay hotel. It blasts music until 4 a.m. The hotel won't tell you anything about that when you check into your room. They put me in a room right above the night club and didn't warn me that the room would be extremely loud until 4 a.m. The room was fine when I checked in, but I went out for diner and a walk around the city and returned to my room to find I could feel the bass rumbling beneath the floor. There was no way I could sleep in the room, it's an obvious problem that the hotel ignores. It was the worst hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: lyndey
Reviews.Content: Location: I went down to see several Broadway shows, so the location (47th between 6th & 7th) is ideal. It's a safe block and the diner next door is great for a quick breakfast. Service: My first room was shoebox-sized, and the front desk staff found me a better room within the afternoon. I had also forgotten my toothpaste and they sent up some travel packets to hold me over. The lobby team (concierge, front desk, bell hops) were friendly and helpful. Two issues to consider: 1.The lighting is dim, even in the rooms. I realize that they're going for an uber-hipster feel, but adding better lighting would be helpful. The orange accents in the room decor are nice, but brighter is better, especially for those of us with less than stellar vision. 2. Wi-fi; I couldn't get a connection with my laptop in the lobby. I was able to use the business center computers to get the information I needed, but wanted to download some things to my laptop and was unable, which is odd, because I've never had a problem in other hotels. I wasn't willing to pay the 9.95 for the in-room service, so I can't attest to the quality of that wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “If you are stranded, get stranded here!!”
Reviews.Author: NicLiz
Reviews.Content: We checked into Stay having been stranded by a pesky volcano and following 13 nights of 4*+ accomodation across the USA and 1 night at an airport hotel in Queens... I'd selected it based on price (Â£534 for four nights), reviews and location after a very frantic evening surfing the internet looking for somewhere affordable and well located for cheap/free entertainment... and I was not dissapointed. Check-in was easy. They even let us check-in three hours early, which was brilliant as we literally had nowhere else to go!!! Hotel is TOTALLY smoke free and you are asked to sign a waiver when you check in, which states that if you do smoke in your room you are liable to a $250 charge (I think)... so if you can't do without a smoking room, this is not the hotel for you. Also asked to sign a waiver at check in that states that if you use the minibar to chill you own drinks you are also liable for a charge, which seems a little excessive - would've been nice to have a nice cold bottle of water in the room, but hey ho!!!!!!!! Location is fabulous. From the entrance of the hotel you can see the red steps of Times Square. Literally a minutes' walk away. Close to Rockerfeller, Empire States, Broadway and the subway... so really can't complain in terms of location. Rooms are 'compact and bijous' but do have all the necessary elements to keep you happy... decent bed, great TV, safe, radio alarm... No coffee/tea making facilities though. Makes an ideal 4 night NYC crash-pad, but would not recommend if you are intending to spend lots of time in your room as cabin-fever would set in quickly!! Small bathroom with shower but very clean and very nice complimentary toiletries. Agree with other comments that the lifts are incredibly slow... we were on the ninth floor and it took ages... Free wifi access in the lobby made keeping in touch with home fairly easy. Drinks etc. expensive in the hotel bar - but there are that many alternatives close by (highly recommend the Pig n Whistle next door which has great service and lovely tapas) that this shouldn't be a reason not to stay here. Bearing in mind our 'unique' circumstances, the reception staff could not have been more helpful - holding a room for us while we returned to JFK to check out the situation and cancelling it without penalty when we found out we were going home!!! All in all, would highly recommend this hotels for young(ish!) couples needing a good base in NYC for a few days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kate1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in April, this hotel is in a great location a stones throw from Times Square which is slap bang in the middle of Manhattan. The rooms were cleaned every day, there is a bar on site and plenty of restaurants nearby. It is in a safe location, handy enough to walk north to Central Park or walk south to Lower Manhattan. The staff were helpful, and although the room was on the smaller side we spent so little time in it that it really did not matter. Showers were powerful and clean. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who does not want to pay over the odds prices and is happy with better than basic accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay in New York, stay at the STAY HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: guggah
Reviews.Content: I took my grandson as a treat for his 18th birthday. We arrived late in the evening and noticed that there was rather a lot going on around locally. Turns out the Stay Hotel is a stone's throw from Times Square and was right in the heart of things. From the minute we booked in we were impressed by the standard of service (Fatima on reception was a delight). The rooms were excellent. In the reception are two large pillars that are tanks filled with tropical fish. The lounge was really chic with it's white leather seats and blue glass wall and water feature. The bar was really buzzing at night. The only down side is the noise level if you take a room at the front (street) side. I had room 401.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - if you don't get a really good deal”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrippineurope
Reviews.Content: I'm at the hotel right now. The tiny room feels like a black hole. A very noisy one. Staff hasn't been helpful at all, arrogant and not helpful at all. If you don't get a rate below $ 150: Avoid. I will never return to this place, even though the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location - Just FAR TOO NOISY in room!!”
Reviews.Author: newbie2010
Reviews.Content: Superb location, Hip looking hotel, Great looking bar (VERY EXPENSIVE THOUGH!!) Checked in, went to our room 8th Floor - Room was tiny!?!? About 8ft Sq!! Managed to change room to a bigger one, no charge, but room was only about 8ft x 10ft. 3rd Floor. Did think of checking out and going to another hotel but decided to give it a go. Your in New york so won't spend too much time in the room. It was around 50-60 degrees outside at its peak during our stay, so pretty cold outside! But room was unbelievably HOT!! Turned on Air Con and you have to shout to be heard over the top of it. The walls are paper thin, and the slamming doors are a a very big problem. All doors are thick and swing shut, VERY VERY NOISY. Don't want to moan as i really enjoyed my trip. BUT.... there were just too many problems with things you take for granted, AIr Con is unbearably Noisy, Neighbours doors are far too noisy, rooms are very small if you intend to spend much time in them. Absolutely love New York, This hotel has a fantastic location, really struggle to better it. but would not recommend it to anyone. Shame really but for the sake of a few dollars more there are loads of better accomodations available within a stones throw. If Air con and slamming doors are sorted out then a superb location for someone not minding staying in a mini room. Just please be aware of the Air con, lots of people have mentioned it but I just thought they were moaners!!! I've understated the noise. I still have the noise vibrating through my body!!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is - a nicely decorated budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrConsultant
Reviews.Content: First, the positives. The location is fantastic. It's located on 47th just east of 7th. Times Square is probably a couple hundred feet down the street. The rates are very good for the location. If you want to stay at a chain (Marriott, Hilton, Starwood, etc), you'll definitely end up paying far more than at Stay - think around 40%+ more. The lobby is very chic, if not a little cold. Loud music and modern style, if that sort of thing appeals to you. Now, the neutral. It's a small room. If you've stayed at places like the Marriott Marquis or Hilton Times Square, the rooms here are probably anywhere from 1/2 to 1/3 the size. Given the room rates, it's expected and it is what it is. TV is nice, a lot of channels, although a channel guide would be nice. Room has everything you need - radio/alarm, wifi, fancy VOIP phone, toiletries, iron, hair dryer. A luggage rack would be nice, though. Room is nicely decorated with all black furniture, although it would be nice if they could touch things up every now and then - the black desk was scratched up, as was the closet door. AC is a tad loud, but not terribly so. Works just fine. Echoing previous reviews, yes - the elevator is tiny and slow. I took my time and walked up and down the steps (there are 2 sets - one with the fire doors and one across the hall that is open). Annoyances include: Outlets by the desk are literally at desk height. In order to use them I had to move the desk away from the wall. Same with the outlet on the other side of the bed, which was behind the nightstand. On top of that, those particular outlets are tied to a switch by the bed, which was off when I came in. I didn't realize for a while that they had no power and it took another minute or so to figure out that I needed to turn on the switch. Minor annoyance, since I did figure it out. The front desk staff was a disappointment. There was one young man on duty who didn't acknowledge that I had walked up to the "window" for about 20 seconds. He was efficient, if not polite. No eye contact and I felt that I was inconveniencing him. Perhaps this is supposed to be an aloof, pseudo-European thing, but I found it a bit off-putting. Random observation: The website touts L'occitane toiletries, but they are, in fact, some eco-friendly brand (don't recall off the top of my head). I read through some older reviews and found one from August 2009 saying that they had been replaced over the summer and yet, the website has not been updated. This needs to be corrected. A quick note about the recommendation - I clicked yes, but it's a qualified yes. Would I stay here again for a business trip? Probably not, unless my client was particularly sensitive to cost. Would I recommend it to colleagues? Again, probably not with the same caveat. Would I recommend it to friends/family? IF they are looking for a place in the middle of the action and are on a budget and don't mind "cozy" accomodations, then yes - they could certainly do much worse. However, they must also know they won't earn any loyalty points, which is a big deal for me, at least.

Reviews.Title: “VERY noisy room but great location”
Reviews.Author: KJE4150
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and chic. We were surprised that for such a great price we could stay in such a cool and modern hotel. The room was clean and had nice furniture, but was very small (hey.. what can you expect for a hotel less than a block from Times Square?). Staff was great. There is a really cool restaurant/bar/nightclub attached to the hotel. One big problem that the management needs to take care of.... We came back to our room, exhausted from the day, only to find that our room was literally vibrating from the noise in the club downstairs. It was throbbing! We didn't bother complaining because we knew that there was no way they would turn down the music but be aware that if you stay here, don't expect a good night's sleep. Management... please add some extra insolation, carpeting, or something!

Reviews.Title: “Stay if you can”
Reviews.Author: Brockpc
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel. This trip was a second honneymoon for us. We found it to be convenienty located in Times Square. The lobby has plenty of swagg and the Aspen Club is a good hang out for drinks and a quasi club sceen on the weekend. Martinis are pricey. Our room was petite with little to no storage but that didn't bother us since we were gone most of the time. The staff was helpful and courteous they even recomended a few places to hang out and gave us a coupon for future use. Overall hotel Stay is more than worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Olood96
Reviews.Content: I was feeling a bit weird booking this hotel after reading the reviews but I figured that most of the people who write reviews are probably people who have nothing good to say. First of all the hotel is so hip. Its right smack in the middle of times square and there is something to see at all corners. Upon checking in the girl at the front desk asked us what we were in town for and we mentioned that it was for our anniversary. We also told her we were only in for 1 night and she was very nice and offered us dinner suggestions. She told us to go to "restaurant row" which is right around the corner from the hotel because this particular block had a lot of good restaurants. We took her suggestion and walked over there. We ended up at a small italian restaurant with really good food and wine. It was great! Really good food a a nice romantic atmosphere. When we got back to the hotel the lounge was playing really good music so we decided to sit down and have some drinks. Drinks were a little on the overpriced side but really great. After we went up to our room and found a fruit platter with a note from the manager congratulating us on our anniversary! Now im not sure if you receive this type of service at other hotels but we were so surprised and flattered that they would take into consideration what we were here for! All in all we wish we couldve spent more than one night at this place but we definitely plan on coming back and spending a whole weekend! We had a great but too short anniversary at stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: minxi54
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be so helpful and kind. And it was such a busy time of the year. I also thought they had double-charged me but they hadn't and I got confirmation of that in 2 days. I would strongly recommend that anyone who goes anywhere in NY takes their own booze. I didn't want to spend $9 for a glass of wine, but after going up the Empire State building I felt I deserved a glass (or 6). I ended up with a couple of beers. Which was fine. But I could have bought a gun!!! But I couldn't buy a bottle of wine. So there you go. And don't forget the free refill practice they have there. That's how I got my essential cups of tea in the morning. That would be my only complaint. I like a cuppa. And it would be nice to be able to have it in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Double charged and still unresponsive !”
Reviews.Author: whatcangowrong
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 nights over the last weekend in Jan , I later found my credit card to be double billed for the stay.I have been trying for over a week to get anybody from the hotel to respond to my requests to fix this. They have given no response whatsoever. I now have to take the matter up with my credit card company. In addition , there's no double glazing and the rooms are frigid , no heating whatsoever in the bathrooms and again no double glazing. There is of course in room heating which sounds like a freight train coming through when it kicks in.

Reviews.Title: “Problems would be easy to fix”
Reviews.Author: briggsadams
Reviews.Content: In N.Y. for business and stayed weekend for fun. Overall, I was very disappointed. Location is great. Staff was friendly and attentive. Bed was comfortable. Rooms are small; nowhere to store suitcase and nowhere to store clothes other than closet (no dresser). Big problem: AC was so loud it woke me several times a night. I reported to the staff and since there was not another room free to switch to, I asked that an engineer fix the problem. Nothing happened. Another guest's dirty room service dishes were left in the hall for more than a day; I reported twice. The elevators are ridiculously slow. TV channel options are few and 3 are "adult," with no alerts to parents w/children. Room lighting is poor. I sent coments to the hotel online but have not had a response.

Reviews.Title: “I gave it a second chance... and it failed miserably again.”
Reviews.Author: adrian s
Reviews.Content: First let me start with the good. The hotel is in a fantastic location, particularly if you are going to be there for the New Year's celebration. Period. Now for the bad. Small rooms, bad service, unattentive management, noisy... you get the point. My wife and I stayed here in March of '09 and had a pretty bad experience. Staff kept waking us up as they yelled at each other across the hallway at 7 or 8am. They sounded like they were in our rooms having a conversation while we were trying to sleep because the walls are so thin. At night, you can't sleep either because the club downstairs pumps music so hard that your nightstand will vibrate. Other than the fact that it was in a good location, we did not enjoy our time there, at all. We let management know and they offered us a complimentary night stay if we chose to return. It was so bad that i didn't really even want to take him up on the offer, so at first, I declined. However, since I was in a bind looking for a hotel in a good location for New Year's eve, I figured, what the heck. Maybe now that they know they screwed up the first time, they will treat us much better the second time. Plus, it's one night for free and hotel prices were pretty high... I should have just spent the money somewhere else. Most of the things that annoyed me about this hotel were still prevalent. This time, I went with my wife and two friends. On New Year's Eve, my friend got assautled by two guys... TWO!!!! in the bathroom stall. He got pushed out of the bathroom and in self defense, he punched both guys in the face and knocked them both to the floor. The bouncers at the hotel quickly jumped on my friend, without asking any questions and proceeded to beat him sensless and pound and kick him while he was on the ground, giving him a black eye, bloody mouth, busted lip, swollen back of the ear and bruised ribs. Then they kicked him out of the hotel and wouldn't let him back in. Eventually he got back into his room. When he woke up the next morning we went down to management and told them what happened and then we called the police and filed a police report. The hotel has cameras which should have caught everything on film. Management did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING ABOUT THIS!!!! NOTHING... To this day (26 days later) my friend still has pain when he moves a certain way because of the bruised ribs. NOTHING!!! After checking out our last day, I checked the bags in because our flight didn't leave till later. When I returned to the hotel, I gave the baggage handler a ticket and he got my bags out of a room. Instead of taking it out to the cab for us, he just walked away after they were all out. I proceeded to pick up the bags on my own. When I reached down to pick one up by the floor, I sliced my finger open on one of the metal baseboards by the baggage room entrance. This is a baseboard that should be attached firmly to the wall, instead it was sticking out and it cut me so deep that I was still bleeding when I got back home to Miami. I went to the front desk and asked them for a first aid kit because I had cut my hand on the baseboard but they didn't have anything to give me. The guy actually would have been ok if I had just walked away because after he said he didn't have anything he just kind of sat there. I looked at him and said, "I'm bleeding all over your counter because i cut my hand on your property. Get me something to put on this!" That's when he walked to the back and came back with some alcohol and gauze. No manager came to say anything and again, nothing was done. There were other little things that were very annoying, such as concierge recommendations being way off, bags going to the wrong room, etc... but I don't want to be here all day. Bottom line is, I gave them a second chance after our first terrible experience and you'd think they would have paid extra special attention to making sure that things went well for us, so theoretically, they were on their best behavior. But instead of making it up to us, it turned out to be a disaster. Some things are just not worth the trouble and frankly, after our two terrible experiences here, I wouldn't go back even if they offered me a month for free. Great location though... maybe I'll stay at the W next time.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but rooms are small. Good Location”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRichInNorway
Reviews.Content: It was an OK Hotel, Hard to find at first so write down the address! Nice lobby and bar but rooms are small. I had a large room and it was still small. Free Wi-fi in Lobby only. 3.5 / 5

Reviews.Title: “Stay above the 5th floor!”
Reviews.Author: cpat57
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to NYC for more than 15 years during the first or second weekend in December and have been in this very hotel many times under previous names. It is the location that keeps me coming back. Its close to Times Square, the Theater District and Rockefeller Center. The renovations are beautiful and the rooms have been upgraded, soft and comfortable bedding, more modern furniture, flat screen TVs, nice showers, etc. The elevators were not changed and are very, very small. The worst part about this hotel is the lounge on the first floor. It's got an interesting look, but the music POUNDS loudly until 4am and while I am all for a party atmosphere, when i want to sleep I don't need to hear a base that moves my bed. We were moved, the staff was awesome about it, from the 2nd to the 4th floor and needed to be moved the next day again...this time to the 8th floor....MUCH BETTER! The location of this hotel makes it worth the stay, but i will NEVER stay lower than the 5th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Skihouse132
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend before Christmas at Stay Hotel for my wife's birthday. We found the hotel staff to be extremely friendly and helpful (even though the hotel has a super hip atmosphere). We followed the advice of other reviewers and chose a large king room, which as expected was not huge, but large by Manhattan standards. Our room was on the 5th floor and faced the street. Activity in Times Square could be heard until 4:00 AM, so if you are a light sleeper you may want to remember your earplugs. Overall we had a great experience and enjoyed the great proximity to Time Square, Rockefeller Center and 5th avenue shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, get above floor 2 if you want sleep”
Reviews.Author: btenn12
Reviews.Content: As others have stated, the rooms are extremely small, as is the elevator, and hallways. But, the hotel is decorated very nicely and kept clean. The location is ideal for Times Square and Rockefeller walking. Not a bad value, just be sure to get a room on the alley side if possible and higher than the 2nd floor if you value sleep. Warning if you book through Priceline... I assume we got the Priceline suite: Second Floor, on 47th Street, right above the hotel Club Aspen which seemed to be thumping music until 4am. Additionally, the smokers congregate just below this room which makes the room smell like an ashtray between 1-4am. There were some pipes rattling very loudly in the walls on our second night which kept us up throughout the night. I called the front desk a handful of times between 3 and 4am with the intent to pay up for another room but got no answer... only wish I done it upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Neil_Boston
Reviews.Content: The location and price are hard to beat, if you want to be close to Times Square. The rooms are very small, and even though I only had one carry-on bag, I had a hard time finding space for it. The bathrooms are also tiny. However, everything was clean and modern. The subway is also very close to this hotel, making it very easy for me to get to Chelsea and downtown. I did the breakfast buffet my last morning, which I would NOT recommend. It's $25 for eggs and sausage and some fruit. You can walk outside and go around the corner to a great healthy sandwich shop for a fraction of the cost. Also, in spite of being in Times Square, I didn't find it noisy in the room at all. The lobby is a different story, it's like a big party, which I thought was pretty cool. The decor is also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Much bigger and better than anticipated - GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi8888
Reviews.Content: We went to NY as a last minute trip during one of busiest weekends for New York so we had to pay over the odds. We found the Stay Hotel as a last minute offer and had very low expectations. On arrival we were pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff and reasonably large bedrooms. I had heard of other reviews claiming the rooms were like coffins but the room we received was very livable and it was well laid out and very comfortable - we even had a view of Times Square. The best thing was that it was perfectly located to all the main amenities.... We would certainly go back again but perhaps at a time when New York is a little quited. If you're into your food avoid the restaurant... there are a lot of better options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Poor Room !”
Reviews.Author: CovTripper
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 days at the Stay with my girlfriend. We booked a standard room and got a room with double bed only - no closet or any storage space. Please be aware that this Hotel has some very small rooms that dont have storage space. They also say a Bose sound system with iPod cradle is in every room - this was not the case. The bathroom was also a shower only with no bath. The lobby bar area is nice and there was plenty of life at the Aspen Social Club at the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, That's it...”
Reviews.Author: yungtravler
Reviews.Content: My sisters, mother, sister-in-law and I ended up staying at this hotel because we booked it through priceline.com by naming our own price. Because we booked the room on priceline.com, it was only a single bed, which would not work for all of us, so I called the hotel and asked that we upgrade the room to two double beds, and it was no trouble at the time. I called two days before we left to make sure that we were all set and the reservationist said we were still fine for the two double beds with the upgrade fee. When we arrived, we waited almost an hour to check-in because there was a "glitch" with our priceline.com reservation. Apparently the reservationist was not supposed to upgrade our room and they only have 10 rooms with two double beds in the ENTIRE hotel. The manager, Chris, came and straightened everything out, although him saying that he was going to "take care" of the person who did this was not very tactful to me. They only have two, very small, elevators and when you reach the hallways, they are very dark and narrow. I was amazed that the bellhop fit the baggage cart in the elevator! We ended up taking the stairs multiple times because we waited so long for an elevator. We were pleased to see that the hotel was steps from Time Square which made it very convenient to get to everything! Personally, I think this is the best thing about the hotel. We did need ice a few times and found it almost amusing that they didn't have one ice machine in the entire hotel! We had to call room service every time we needed ice (complementary). There was no fridge in the room, so we had to store our leftovers in the employee fridge, which was inconvenient. We should have checked before we left, but not all of our leftovers made it back to us. I think some of them were put in a different spot. Oh well, no Little Italy for the husband back home. Overall, the experience at the hotel was average. The main reason why we would return is the location. So, I would recommend this hotel as long as people know that they are paying for location and not the basic amenities in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Skip It.”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Flier74
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for two people through a third party website. Room was confirmed as appropriate for two adults ..."king, queen, or two doubles." The hotel gave us a room with one double bed and said that if we wanted a second bed we could pay an extra $200. Because reservations through such third party sites are non refundable, this definitely felt like a bait and switch. In trying to get it sorted out, the hotel staff was extremely unhelpful (in fact, I couldn't even get ahold of anyone - I got transferred at least 4 times becuase no one would pick up and I kept getting kicked back to their main operator.) I am frequent traveler to NY and I can guarantee there are far better hotels at far bettter prices, all in the same vicinity. Skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: GypsyTart
Reviews.Content: This hotel was different. The lobby is very trendy and nothing you would expect from the outside of the black building. The service was great - friendly and very helpful. The room was extremely small. In fact alittle claustrophobic. Two people could not fit passed the end of the bed at the same time. But it was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Location was EXCELLENT - 1/2 block off Times Square. Loved that aspect and the Irish pub Pig and Whistle next door. The air conditioner was very noisy and the view from the window was awful. The bar downstairs turns into a full blown nightclub til 4am. The hotel becomes extremely noisy late at night. If you can sleep like a rock you're good.
