Reviews.Title: “Did Not Enjoy "Stay"”
Reviews.Author: SarahDino100706
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend "Stay" based on our two night stay. When we arrived around 9:00 p.m., there was loud music playing throughout the lobby area. On first impression, the lobby was clean and nicely decorated. The check-in process was inefficient. There was one man working and juggling check-in, the phones, and questions from other staff. The hotel has only two elevators, which fit three people with luggage uncomfortably. I have stayed in other hotels in NYC and did not expect the room to be spacious. But, our room was exceptionally small. I kept my 26" suitcase on the desk because there was no other place to fit it. We kept our toiletries in the window sill, as the bathroom had no counter - just a sink, a toilet, and a shower. The full-size bed was comfortable, but it was definitely not fit for two people. The hotel has a very limited number of double bed rooms (I was told 8). This information should be disclosed in the booking process. On our second night, I tried to schedule a wake up call, but no one picked up the phone at the front desk. All in all, I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Look further before booking Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gabi_Romano
Reviews.Content: The only good thing of this hotel is the location. The rest was disappointing... 1-The room is toooo small, even for NYC standards. I could barely fit my lugagge (only 2 medium-size, and two carry-on). They did not have a closet, only hangers on the wall... very strange... 2-The wi-fi didn`t work in the room. I had to go to the lobby; 3-The duvet was dirty... I noticed that they did not use a duvet cover, which is really disgusting; 4- The ammenities weren`t L'occitane as described in the web site; 5-Front desk was nice, but they let me holding on the phone for over 15 minutes before transfer my call to the room; 6-What was that club??? I had to wait for the elevator where really drunk people were waiting to use the bathroom (which was in the lobby). Unless you are willing to spend your night there, this situation may be really uncomfortable; Well, I could get longer, but to sum up, you can get a much better stay in other hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would "stay" again!”
Reviews.Author: tamsterd
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the hotel, and the staff. Everyone was helpful and very friendly. We had great service from the concierge. Our room was very spacious compared to most NYC hotel rooms and a very comfortable king sized bed. The only issue we had was a toilet that plugged on our 2nd night but upon allerting the front desk this was taken care of immediately. One can't beat the location! We would definitely "stay at Stay" again.

Reviews.Title: “Started out well--- ended badly”
Reviews.Author: lkjones196
Reviews.Content: I do commend the Stay hotel for its pricing, amenities, staff, and location. Up until my last day there, it was a wonderful experience. However, my last day, I went out putting my jewelry in the room safety deposit box using the same code I had used during my entire stay. When i returned that evening, the code no longer worked and I called the front desk to have it resolved. They did send up a tech who opened the safe and while the cash and credit cards were still there, my jewelery was not. They were VERY attentive and apologetic and helpful--- at first. I told them to see if someone would turn it in, no questions asked. There was email correspondence for 3 weeks, and then nothing. The situation has yet to be resolved and they are no longer responding to any of my phone calls or emails. Upshot: the hotel overall is a great value for the money-- just don't leave ANYTHING of ANY value in the room safe!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can the rooms get smaller in NYC”
Reviews.Author: OldTravellingDad
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, unique lobby and bar area, block from Broadway and Time Square. But, oh my can the rooms in NYC possibly get smaller than these, I hope not, it was hard to turn around in the room. I had to walk in forward and back out.

Reviews.Title: “amazing romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: staceyt11
Reviews.Content: My friend organized a birthday get-away for my 40th and it was amazing. The concierge worked with him to plan everything down to the last detail. The he coordinated the roses in the room as well as included chocolate covered strawberries. My friend hadn't thougth to make dinner arrangements for sat night - the concierge took care of everything - got us into an amazing restaurant - told them it was a birthday occasion, for which I was treated to special desert. It was fabulous. The room was great. All other aspects of the service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Small hot noisy rooms, above a great bar..”
Reviews.Author: hereandthere13
Reviews.Content: Seriously, all the reviews below tell you what you need to know. The reception and bar is great. That's where it ends. Very clean and well presented, it's just that the primary reason of a hotel is normally to sleep, which it doesn't allow very well. Air Conditioning is specific to your room, (great) however it's so loud you have to turn it off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kejka
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night, but this hotel is very nice, it has great location. Its sort of a funky hipp hotel, the lobby is very nice but dark! The room is kind of small, but the bed was amazing! Would deffinetly stay here again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Loni224
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to throw a flag for the extremely small rooms. Even for NY, this was exceptionally small. The decor is nice, the cleanliness was average, the location is good if you want to be on Times Square...but the shock of the closet-sized room was enough to ruin it for me. Also, they have the tiniest elevators ever! So small and so slow...makes it annoying to go in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing sadly.......room above a nightclub?!?”
Reviews.Author: petegoddard
Reviews.Content: This hotel started off quite well......the location was great.....a stones throw from Times Square.....and I mean a normal throw not some pro baseballers throw! I checked in fine and was shown to my room which was very small but I had expected that so wasn't too annoyed. The first two nights were fine and then it all went wrong! Friday night being the start of the weekend I returned to the hotel to blasting club music in the lobby. Turns out they turn the bar and restaurant into a nightclub and crank the volume to the max.....great......if you want to party.......not so good if you are a jetlagged tourist who just wants to get some sleep in your hotel room.....above the bar!!!!!!! Oh yeah and the party goes thumping on til 4am. That was my main problem with this hotel.....no warning when checking in that the place transforms and nothing that can be done about it once you are there. Other than that there were a few niggles like the housekeeping didn't replenish anything that I had used like shower gel, toilet roll etc. Also for some reason my tv remote was replaced with another one that didn't work.....very odd.....and frankly annoying when noone will pick up the phone in reception for you to tell them you need something. I kid you not.....it rang and rang for about five minutes.....only for it to be put straight down......not good service especially for somewhere that is not cheap! It's these little things that if done right make you want to come back to a hotel. I would happily go back to Stay if they sorted the little things out.......and if I was on a rowdy weekend away with the lads!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL/ PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: handbook4
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was a perfect experience. The architecture and design of this hotel are one of a kind. I would recommend coming to see the Stay even if you are not going to be rooming there. The aspen social club is very unique as well and turns into a cool hangout on Friday and Saturday nights. The rooms were small but I've stayed in many hotels in New York city and this one was very well layed out. The bathroom was gigantic in comparison to other Manhattan hotels and featured an awesome two person shower. Overall my experience with the staff was awesome as well. When asked where a good restaurant was or which club was good on a Saturday night they always had the answer. Definitely stay here. Awesome awesome awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: VBoger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the Times Square, actually about 10 meters away from it! The hotel is really trendy and you can see that the owners spent a lot on it. But on the other hand the hotel staff is quite unknowledgeable and what was most important - the room is SOOOOOOOOO tiny small.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KThomasLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The day before I arrived, I called ahead to ask the manager to save 2 rooms close together for my friend and me. He took my name and number and said he would call right back, he never did. My room was so small I thought it was a joke. There was no closet, but hangers on the lamp. Eventually I was "upgraded", and I use that term loosely. This room was right over the nightclub. Five stories up and it felt like the band was in the room. I kept checking to see if the window was open it was so loud. There was no NY or London Times, or L'Occitane products as advertised. The towels were threadbare and looked like something you'd see at the Y. The elevators were very slow. The location was good, and some of the staff did try. But for the price, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SuzDes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at STAY hotel for our honeymoon just a few days ago and loved it! It was an amazing location...ya the rooms are small but what do you expect! No one pays to go to new york to sit in a hotel room all day...you go there to crash and then wake up and go hard the next day. We wanted to go have a pre dinner drink at the hotel resturant because on the pictures it looked really neat. The drinks were SOOOOO expensive!! $14 per drink! We aren't cheap people but common! Just down the road there was 2 for 1 beer! I would rather spend my money on going out and doing things then sitting drinking a $14 drink. But besides that it is a very good hotel and perfect location because when you need a break you just pop back into the room have a little snooze and then your right back in the action....

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to Stay longer...”
Reviews.Author: Kerry604
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here. Great location, beautiful design, friendly + helpful staff, clean room, comfy bed and fun bar downstairs. Do not worry about the size of the hotel room, people should not be complaining about this as this is the standard in New York. If you are concerned about noise from the bar, ask for a room on a higher level. One things I would recommend to the hotel which would give them a boost would be free internet. I would definetly recommend this to everyone I know looking for a hotel in New York and I am sure I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Exactly What you want....!”
Reviews.Author: holidayfanSurrey
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldnt of been postioned any better!! It was perfect. Come out of the hotel, turn the corner and you in the centre of everything. The hotel was modern and good decor, although the room slightly small had everything we needed. And lets be realistic, if like us you are in New York to see the sights and are out all day with possible popping back before heading out in evening and then its simply somewhere to lay your head before heading out again. We are looking to return to New York and would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Come 'Stay'”
Reviews.Author: 5starSpencer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Plus points - The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in, and the flat screen tv offered lots of choice (beware if you have kids as 1 channel is pornographic!) Staff are great, very friendly and willing to assist whenever asked. Close to Time Square (If you are a tourist). Free internet access with printer. Lively and very popular Bar. Minus Points - Rooms are very small, but do not be put off by this, unless you have lots of clothes, as we lived out of our suitcases due to tiny wardrobes. Close to Time Square (If you are not a tourist)

Reviews.Title: “A luxury feel at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: KayDenmark
Reviews.Content: We loved the look of Stay Hotel, with its beautiful tank of tropical fish in the lobby and its chic decor and lighting. Our bathroom was the equal of anything we've seen at a luxury hotel, and on the 9th floor, where we stayed, there was no noise problem at all. The room size problem is real, however. (When I first read the other reviews, I scoffed, having lived in both Manhattan and Hong Kong. But these rooms are on the petite side even for those locations.) I am a slim woman and I was traveling with a four-year-old, but the room size was a problem even for us. Heaven knows how two full-size adults deal with it. The real problem, I believe, is that there is no place to put luggage. No luggage rack, no closets, so you end up stumbling over it for you entire trip, or putting it on the nice clean bed - gross, considering that your bags have are probably fresh from the the filthy environment of an airplane baggage hold and luggage carousels. There was also no chest of drawers to hide away underwear, etc. for our four-day stay, which means we were constantly dragging the suitcases on and off the bed to search for the smallest things. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay at the Stay, where the location just off Times Square and Rockefeller Center can't be beat. Management might want to pay a bit more attention to service, however. We asked for our mini-bar to be locked and a broken towel rack to be fixed, neither of which were accomplished in the 4 days we stayed there. We tried to eat in the trendy restaurant downstairs, but gave up after 25 minutes waiting for a server. The front-desk lady then recommended "Maxie's" on Times Square, truly one of the worst restaurants I have ever experienced. I recommend getting out of the Times Square area if you want something decent to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and beds too small”
Reviews.Author: nzsuze
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through rates to go for myself and my daughter - usually hotels have twin rooms available as well as doubles or the beds are big enough to share without spooning but this is not the case - once we had our luggage in the room we couldn't move. There was always a long wait for the lifts. Staff were unable to give us two keys that worked for our room and after 5 tries we gave up and made do for one. Thank goodness it was only for one night. As we left the porter watched as we struggled out through the small door with our bags...

Reviews.Title: “Too small to "Stay"”
Reviews.Author: GiddyYap
Reviews.Content: The reception area and check in were both pleasant. We were told our "room" was on the third floor. A very tiny elevator took us up and we walked thru a very narrow and dark hallway. What we walked into (literally) was a bed in a closet! I had to stand with my back pressed against the wall just to allow my husband to pass by to enter. Speaking of actual closets, there werent any! Just a small garment rack with hangers on the opposite wall. For the price we paid (over $200 for the night) this was totally unacceptable. We called Hotwire and were immediately rebooked at a nearby hotel, reservations credited and cancelled at Stay and checked out faster than we checked in since there were no other larger "closets" available. Warning to anyone with claustrophobia! A very poor value for the money....

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: mbiz
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Stay before. The location is perfect, right off Times Square. On the plus side, the bed in my queen room was fine. The TV and channel selection perfect. Reception friendly, although staffed very lightly. The loud bar scene downstairs may be appealing to some. Negative: the room was small even for NY standards. No closet at all, only a few hangers, is a bit much! The bathroom too small to shave in without being a contortionist and the shower and sink showed wear and tear. Things are bot going up since last visit and certainly do not match the advertising language: no NY Times or any paper for that matter anymore, no Occidentane amenities either. And Internet is now $9.95 day except in the lobby downstairs. For the right price, OK, but not more than that...

Reviews.Title: “Great location,VERY small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RCRN
Reviews.Content: I booked the Stay through Priceline. I had never heard of it so I didn't know what to expect. I put in that I only wanted a four star hotel. No way should this be a four star hotel. The beds where comfortable and clean but extremly small. Hallways were very small and dark. The elevators were so small that I could not get three people in it with their lugage ( each had one bag) Great location and friendly staff. My biggest complaint was the room size and the size of the bathroom was ridiculously small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAMWinters
Reviews.Content: I won a trip to NY and stayed at the Stay hotel. It was a great location and I thought a good hotel. No fridge or coffee in room, but nice comfy beds and flat screen tv. I would advise to stay as high a floor as possible. We stayed on the fourth floor and traffic noise was very loud. Nice resturant and friendly staff. I enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!! Hosted rockin' bachelorette weekend”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaGirl02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel earlier this year and suggested it to my girlfriend for her bachelorette weekend in the city this summer. It was perfect and did not disappoint!!! We had the best time - perfect location in Times Square, awesome lounge - Aspen Social Club - where they have a DJ spin music, great ambiance in the lobby. We had no problems with the room and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. They helped us arrange dinner reservations, get show tickets and spa appointments. We had an absolute blast and were very pleased. I have to say that I am surprised that Stay's hotel management responds to reviews posted here. I haven't personally seen that before?, so kuddos to them for taking the time to read and respond! Thanks for a wonderful weekend for me and my girlfriends!

Reviews.Title: “What An Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: mecmusic
Reviews.Content: I can't believe anyone could have had any kind of bad experience at this hotel. The staff here were remarkable! I have stayed in many hotels all over North America and this was by far the most pleasant experience I have ever had. There may have been a little bump here or there during our 5 day stay but the staff at his hotel were so accommodating and friendly that it didn't matter what may have happened. I knew they would have taken care of us with a big smile!! The whole staff seems to really love their job at this place! The rooms are not huge but they serve there purpose just fine. Who spends any time in there room in NYC other than to sleep, anyway? On that note, the beds are very comfortable and sleep came easy!! The location of this hotel is excellent, close to many subway and bus stops, right in the heart of Times Square. There is a pretty happening club right downstairs at the hotel as well! I highly recommend this hotel for your trip to this fabulously, great city. Great JOB!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Any Better”
Reviews.Author: NJTravelingDuo
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip through "Hotwire" which I never had done before. Once I got my confirmation I emailed the hotel ref room info. Tom quickly replied stating he was able to place us on an upper floor and upgrade our room. Upon check-in very nice and accommodating front desk personnel met us. When we arrived at our room it was everything Tom had said. Nice size, clean and comfortable. Bathroom was an â€œokâ€� size, functional. Hotel itself was very clean. Great location easy in and out; would definitely sty here on our next trip. Thanks to the entire staff for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TripGirl623
Reviews.Content: Stay was an excellent hotel to stay at! We were on the 7th floor in a corner room, which I heard were the most spacious. We had a very comfortable bed which provided much needed sleep each night. The staff was great and even awarded us 2 complimentary drinks and free chocolate covered strawberries due to it being our 2nd anniversary. Thank yous go out to Angie and the other female associate who helped us check in. Unfortunately we ran out of time and were unable to redeem the gifts, but it was a very nice gesture none-the-less. The hotel was only a couple of blocks from the heart of Times Square and very convenient to the subway/restaurants/etc.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: crissymatt
Reviews.Content: I guess I had higher hopes for this hotel, even though it is only a 2.5-3 star rating. The lobby is fantastic, nice quality finishes and atmosphere. Staff were nice and helpful, although they seemed a little busy and rushed through my questions. Location is great. I know that I read this in the reviews, but the rooms are small, very small. We were upgraded for free to a larger room (I think just the basic with a "Queen" bed), I can't imagine what the smaller room looked like. I've stayed in Rome, and these are by far smaller. Small closet, no dresser, my wife and I had to put clothes under the bedside tables, or just leave in our luggage, which we also had no where to put. If I wanted to hit the bathroom at night, I had to climb over my luggage. Seriously. Again, nice quality finishes though, although the floor was pretty uneven, and a particular low spot would loudly squeak every time you walked over it. The bathroom was okay, pretty small (no surprise). Absolutely no place to put toiletries. Shower was adequate, never had problems with hot water. While there is a flat screen tv in the room, the quality of the cable/satellite feed was horrible. A/C worked great, almost too cold at times. And yes, there is a club on the ground floor. We were on the 5th floor, and after coming in each night around midnight, we could definitely hear the music in our room. I am inclined to think that the hotel puts more emphasis and priority on the club than the guest rooms (the club looked really nice by the way). Again, had high hopes for this hotel. My wife and I are young, urban, modern tastes. Just didn't come away satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: FunTravelerUsa
Reviews.Content: I had a fun weekend in the Big Apple with family two weeks ago. We loved staying in Times Square. We enjoyed our experience at Stay - it has a very fun, hip lobby and the cool Aspen Social Club is connected at the front door. The rooms run on the small side but we didn't mind because we came to enjoy the city not sit in our rooms. The staff was very friendly and nice, especially Tom (forget last name) who cracked us up and was so helpful. We has no problems at all and would definitely stay here again. Amenities in the room were nice and liked the bose speakers and plasma TV. It was the perfect location for our trip. I noticed that the staff from this hotel comment and respond to various tripadvisors. I haven't seen that before, kuddos to them!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: JackinCharlotte
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night (we had booked for two). The small room wasn't an issue....the condom wrapper on the floor, stained sheets, and a toilet that didn't flush was.......

Reviews.Title: “NEVER Again !!!”
Reviews.Author: wallis104
Reviews.Content: Went through PriceLine...... Stay Hotel came up and they gave us a room with one double bed for my girlfriend and I, so I called the hotel to upgrade to a room with two double beds. (Which cost a lot more!) Got there - room was nicely decorated, but small. Went out and returned to find that we were right over a nightclub that would be open until 4am. It sounded like we were IN the nightclub. UNBELIEVABLE noise !!! A NIGHTMARE !! The night manager was wonderful and moved us to 2 separate rooms. The double bed rooms were smaller than most dorm rooms I've seen. I can't imagine trying to "survive" in one of those rooms with another person. I took photos of the room to show my husband how small it was. LOL - hard to take photos 'cause the area was so small. I'll never use Priceline again........ Would rather pay more $$$$'s and know what I'm getting. I know we could have spent just a little more and had a beautiful room with an incredible view....... We've done that many times before. Kudos to the night manager as he was the highlight of the hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: sloping_fungus
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Stay for 7 nights in while visiting New York. Booked the hotel because of its location. Was quiet let down by the room (Have stayed in hotels in New York before which were more spacious). Had a double room on the 3rd floor. Being in such a great location didnt benefit me as my window looked out on a red brick wall! The room was tiny, barely enough room to walk around the bed which wasnt very helpful considering I was mainly there to do shopping and had 2 suitcases each. Ended up using the desk for the suitcases. As already mentioned by several others, the air conditioning was very loud and would keep you awake. Also the doors banged shut VERY loudly so it woke me up a few times during the night when others would be getting in. Also the minibar could not be used for cooling water because it might set off the sensors and have a $50 restocking charge put on my credit card, a bit annoying considering it was boiling when I was there. Very small wardobe space. Bathroom was very basic, not even a sink stopper which would have been handy for washing out clothes. There was nothing in the room in relation to the services of the hotel (room service menu, hotel details) The hotel itself was in a great location about 30 seconds from Times Square. But was quiet disappointed that Wi-Fi was available free of charge in the lobby to anybody but to the paying guest it was $9.95 for 24 hours to have it in your room. Don't really understand why guests should have to pay? The hotel turns into a club on Fridays and Saturdays staying open until 4am. Wouldnt really bother with buying drinks there though. $8 for a bottle of Budweiser, $12 for a shot of Jagermeister, $14 for a Mojito. You could head to any of the pubs close by for better value. The reception and common areas were lovely and so were the staff. Would probably recommend the hotel to a friend but would say to get a bigger room

Reviews.Title: “The staff at Stay were awesome!”
Reviews.Author: MaryCPB
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at Stay. Before we arrived, I took the advice of other travelers and requested a corner room. Angie arranged this and kept her word. She was so very pleasant. Sammy, helped us when checking out, by storing our luggage for us and helping us get it into the car. He was so gracious for the tip that we gave him. The chocolates given to us on our second night were great. The room was VERY small, as was the elevator, however, we didn't have to wait long. Again, the staff was unbelievable. We also requested extra towels and they were delivered promptly and we even received a follow-up call. Again, we had a great stay at Stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: sammy2009
Reviews.Content: We went to NY for a long weekend and I went through an extensive list of hotels as all other hotels were either too small, too expensive or the reviews turned me off!! However, I stumbled across Stay Hotel and after arriving we were not disappointed. The rooms may not be the biggest but heh your in NY to be outside not inside. The hotel is brand new and has a funky interior. The bar is great and the drinks are wicked with the cocktails potent! The staff are really pleasant and helpful. When we arrived the water in our room was warm and we called down and an engineer was with us in 5 minutes fixing the problem. The location is also fantastic... with the hotel literally 30 seconds from Times Square and you won't either realise as you don't hear any traffic. In summary this is a great hotel which I will definately be coming back too. If your travelling with a partner this is the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Location”
Reviews.Author: Declanm5000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over easter with my wife to be. The location is excellent. You can walk to times square without taking a breath!! Hotel is also quiet for its location. Rooms are very small, but in fairness i was aware of this before booking as it stated the exact size of the room in square feet on their website!Rooms nice-bed extremely comfortable-nice plasma TV in the room. Would i stay here again?-Yes i would. Highlight had to be meeting Jenifer Anniston outside the front door as they were filimg 'The Basting'. Staff very helpful. Hotel lobby very classy... Down side of the hotel- I paid extra to have Breakfast (Continental) included. This consisted of muffins, Orange Juice & Tea. Not even toast or cereal or fruit. Not worth paying extra for. The bar/club in the hotel charge a fortune for drings. One beer and a G&T cost me $20. Overall - -Staff very nice. -Complimentary internet a nice touch. -Rooms very comfortable. -Location excellent. -Food & drink way overpriced. -Will be back

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LancashireFolk2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great its just a step way from times square and i thoguht the location was good. There is a diner nearby which is useful and a shop nextdoor. With regards to the noise which some ppI have complained about I DIDNT HEAR ANY . I asked prior to my trip for a room above the forth floor and I was placed on the 6th floor. The rooms are tiny but I expected this and to be honest you are not in your rom long enough for this to bother you. The staff are friendly, rooms clean, service good.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: confplr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at "Stay" for the first time last week, at the NYC property in Times Square. This is a small hotel with a pretty and modern lobby. My room was probably the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in, but it was clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful -- even double checking to make sure my request for an iron had been taken care of. My only complaint was that the hallways were very dimly lit, and with dark walls and dark carpets it felt like I was walking through a tunnel when making my way through the narrow hallway to my room. This is something that should be addressed -- both for perception as well as overall guest safety. As I wrote in the title, it was a great deal for the location -- the heart of Times Square and the theater district. If you are not one to spend a lot of time in your room and don't necessarily care about extra space or luxuries, this is a very good pick especially considering the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, should be a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: adrianlperalta13
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews at first I was nervous about reserving however I do not regret my choice. Great area, you'll be about 20 steps away from Time Square. Hotel service was excellent, all rooms are remodeled just a little small. The only thing about the hotel that was a downer was the elevators, there are only 2 and you can only fit 4 people max, very tiny. One other thing, keep your key cards away from electronics, like phones or camera's since it demagnetizes the card. I will return to this hotel for the experience. Awesome business center.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KYM123
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel & the people are great, but the room are really small. If you're there to stay in your hotel room, this is the wrong place. But if you're there to check out manhattan, then it's a great location. View isn't great either. This hotel is all about location, location, location. The people & service is great too. I stay with some friends. The staff was very friendly & helpful. Young atmosphere. Front Desk Associates can help with some of the nightlife. A room with a view of the street means going to sleep with the sound of cars honking & waking up to cars honking. The corner rooms seem to be bigger too (we switch rooms). Corner rooms have closets. Walls are a bit thin too. Like I said, location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Intolerable deafeningly Loud”
Reviews.Author: PiFi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights paid a considerable sum for a queen room and were give a room on the second floor over the bar which we later discovered turned into a private night club at night. The noise from the bar was extreamly loud for three of the nights but we put up with it as it was off time square and to be expected and it generally finished at 2am and with ear plugs it was just about possible to sleep however on the friday night it was deafening and after several hours actually made me feel pysically sick as the base was actually causing vinrations in the roomi and the music was beyond any acceptable levels of tolerance a hotel bedroom. They had a private party and the Dj and base may as well have been in our room even with ear plugs we couldnt deaden the noiseat all. I complained so vehemantly after 1am that the night porter moved us to a room on the 9th floor.The problem with the rooms as i see it on the lower floors is that the central (escape i might add) stairwell is open all the way down from each floor no fire doors until you reach the gorund floor and then you enter directly into the bar. There is no sound proofing worth taking about to the floor slabs or to the circulation routes nothing to stop the noise travelling up several floors. The staff were unfriendly except for one of the door men and the service man. Yes we actually met the service man..3 times in fact which brings me to the next problem, the air conditioning it was making a terrible persistant squeaking sound that lasted several seconds then stoppen and came back randomly. It was too warm to not to have the Aircon on at night so this was annoying. The service man couldnt identify or fix the problem. Also reception when we complained a few times twice didnt pass on the message to him and we had to call again. The final problem was with our toilet which was prone to blocking and not though the excessive use of paper either i might add. We were heading out the first time one morning and reception assured us they would have it fixed. We came back late that night and it was as we had left it. We called recption again and when the service man arrived he said he had never been given the message the first time. He was very helpful and lovely more that i can say about any of the recption staff. In summary if you want to sleep during your stay and expect a reasonable level of service and value for money dont even consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “This is a club not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: chayler
Reviews.Content: Our room located on the second floor was so loud we could feel the bass from the bar/club downstairs. I could identify almost every song they were playing. Whatever you do don't get a room on the second floor. The music was pumping from 10PM to 4AM. They were booked solid and couldnt move us. It was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. On top of all of that the room was so small that my girlfriend and I couldn't both move at the same time. the closet couldn't fit our clothes that needed to hang and there was nowhere to put our luggage. The only window was on an air shaft that gave us minimal light. Don't ever stay in room 207, although the whole second floor is very loud and probably won't be enjoyable. Also the wireless internet they mention is only in the lobby, bot in your room. All in all I wouldn't recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to experience NYC”
Reviews.Author: AshNSW
Reviews.Content: My wife & a friend booked this hotel after extensive research on the net based on reviews and cost. "Stay" is in a great location, just adjacent to Times Square/Broadway theaters and a couple of blocks from fashionable 5th Ave and Central Park. Being right in the middle of Manhattan is just perfect for walking or taking a cab to many of NY's sights & attractions. The Hotel is quite hip and modern. The lobby has funky alien lighting and a large floor to ceiling fish tank. The staff are quite young but were attentive and addressed our every needs, although they were quite casual at times and I can see that some may not appreciate this, but it did not bother us. We requested a room on a high floor due to guests previous complaints about noise from the hotel bar/club. We had no issues with noise (apart from the usual NY sounds and regular police sirens) on the 7th Floor and our double room had ample space for 4 people, 2 comfy beds, a wardrobe with safe, LCD tv, Bose Stereo and good sized shower room. The entire hotel is dimly lit (for ambience I guess!) and we needed to put the lights on during the day to get dressed. There is wireless internet, however it is only free to use in the hotel lobby/ground floor and there is a charge to use it in your room which was a little inconvenient. The hotel has a small business centre which we did not use and a trendy bar/restaurant serving mainly light meals (if there is such a thing in the US!) & breakfast, with waitresses & bar staff with extremely short skirts-if you like that kind of thing. There are obviously thousands of other hotels, restaurants and cafes right on the doorstep. Times Square Broadway ticket stand is literally 200 yards away and is the best way of seeing a last minute show usually for 50% of the regular price. Overall "Stay" was a good trendy, clean option for a Manhattan hotel, ideal for singles, couples and small groups visiting the city. Its not perfect and many reviews have mainly complained about staff & noise. Definitely request and insist on a high level room. Staff can be good or bad depending on the day, what you expect of them and how you treat them. During our stay, they remained friendly and helpful and we got to know them over the 5 days we stayed there. My only other mild complaint would be the extremely slow two elevators, which could take an eternity to arrive and take you to your room. Otherwise we had a fantastic stay at STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from Stay”
Reviews.Author: sfyalek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend and had a terrible experience. When we made the reservation, we requested to be away from the elevator and at the high level. When we checked in the front desk did not tell us our requests were not available. She just assigned us a room on the 3rd floor and right next to the elevator. When we got into the hotel room, we were disappointed and hope it would not be too noisy. We reserved a medium size room but the room does not even has a space to store one 22" roller bag. The bathroom only has two ceiling lights. It is extremely difficult to shave or do any make up because the light comes from behind our head. In addition, the room was warm. We told the front desk to check the AC unit before we went out. They said they would send someone to check the unit. When we came back in the afternoon, nothing had been changed and there was no notes or message in the phone to address the issue. When we went out for the dinner, we asked the front desk, another person, about the AC issue. We got the same response. They would send someone to fix it. By the late night, we went back to the hotel. The situation was the same but we did not want to move in the midnight so we turned off the AC, because it was loud, and opened the window. The hotel also has a club on the first floor and plays very loud club music. If the hotel gives you a low level room, ask for the ear plugs. At 8am in the morning, the maid started to come to work and we could clearly hear their conversation. After making three complains about the AC and the noise issue and the managers had no intention to fix the AC unit or offered us to change the room. We were so pissed off and we will never go back to this hotel. Besides, this hotel was open in Sept 08 but the materials have already shown signs of wearing out. Their sister hotel, The Time on 49th is much better than the Stay in the value point.

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal Stay At The Modern STAY. Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Destiney
Reviews.Content: We travelled to NYC for the weekend to see the play "In The Hieghts" and had an amazing time! I was pleasantly suprised to see how great the hotel was considering no one had heard of it not even the taxi drivers. I found it randomly while searching NYC hotels online and Im SO glad I did!! It was a hotel that will always stand out in my opinion...The atmosphere alone was so unique and gorgeous! The hotel was VERY clean...we didnt have any complaints! As mentioned in a few reviews the rooms were very small but what do u expect for Mew York in the theatre destrict?? Unless ur willing to pay $700 a night for a resonably sized room then thats what you get...and I dont know about you but when we were there we barely satyed in the room at all...there is too much to do and see! It was perfect for what we needed....sleeping and changing and thats all...The room was very cute and modern! There was no view but again its what is expected from a NYC hotel in that destrict..It was my hirst time to NYC and I even knew that... Staff~The staff were amazing!! Everyone was freindly and very quick to hlp you out! We have to say that the concierge Walter is who really made our trip!! Being our first time we knew nothing and needed alot of help and guidance and opinions and he was there to help us out every step of the way!! My b/f and I have to say THANK YOU very much Walter for the amazing Champaign and Apetizers provided to us at the restaurant!! As well for the great photography! So all in all it was a great stay at STAY. and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Times Square/ Broadway Destrict! It was a great location and Phenominal hotel!! When your there say hi to Walter...He will be happy to help you out with anything!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Em80
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from an amazing trip to New York and a great stay at Stay. Hotel was ideally located, inbetween 6th and 7th avenues, just steps away from Broadway and Times Square. There is a couple of Irish bars, a couple of deli's and the amazing Evergreens restaurant/deli on the same street. You have to try Evergreens for breakfast - good food, really quick service and friendly staff. I would recommend the omelettes - husband recommends the lumberjack. Stay itself looks impressive and minimalist from the outside. Lobby is very chic,very modern with funky lights, tropical fish tanks and comfy sofas. Staff were polite and quick to help us check in or with anything else we needed. We had a queen room on the 2nd floor. Yes, it was small but how big a room do you need when all you are doing is sleeping in it? Plus, we both had big bags with us and there was ample room to store them (under the desk and in bottom of small wardrobe) and to store all our shopping bags without feeling like we were tripping over things. Bathroom was small but had a great walk in shower - we had no problems getting hot water and we used the shower at various times of the day. When i was told we had a room on the 2nd floor i was a bit worried as i had read the various reviews about noise from the nightclub below - i'd even packed us ear plugs as a precaution. We were directly above the bar/club(for some reason they count the ground floor as floor 1, which can get confusing in a lift) but i can honestly say that the noise never once disturbed us. Yes you can hear it but it's more the thud of the bass rather than actually being able to hear words of songs or music itself. We never once needed to use our ear plugs, we were so worn out that we were asleep before our heads hit our pillows and the background noise was so unobstrusive that it never once bothered us. The only thing about the room that was disturbing was that the smoke alarm flashes a white light every 30 seconds or so. It was disorientating the first night, but you can't see it when your eyes are shut and it was not bright enough to be truely disturbing. On our 2nd day we got back to the room to find that our air conditioning had broken. We reported it to reception and within 10 minutes an engineer appeared. It was something really simple to do with a tripped switch, he fixed it instantly but then checked all the unit just to make sure there was nothing else wrong. He was very thorough and pleasant. No more problems with it for the rest of our stay. Room was cleaned every day, clean linen and towels also. No problems like other people have mentioned. I would definitely recommend this hotel, i would say to be prepared for the flashing smoke alarm and maybe expect a little background noise but neither bothered us. Location is excellent. We got a really good price and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average...”
Reviews.Author: Lauke
Reviews.Content: We were generally disappointed with our stay here. We encountered a few problems with the room. A very noisy air conditioner that was so loud we couldn't sleep, and also a shower that would not drain. Both problems were reported when discovered and we were told somebody would come up straight away and fix the problem. Nobody came so reported it again the next day. The air conditioner was 'fixed' although it was still relatively noisy however the shower was not and was still was not draining so you could only have a quick shower before it overflowed, not pleasant! It's just a pain when you are on holidays to deal with all of these inconveniences. We were there the Saturday night as well and you could hear the bass thumping from the nightclub below so that was a little disturbing as well. Wouldn't stay here again. Just felt the whole hotel lack ambience, really disappointed. Much prefer the Hudson hotel, alot more personality and better value for money I think.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: paivi632
Reviews.Content: Myself and a fellow friend had to share a double bed for the 1st 2 nights but booking last minute and being easter we didnt mind. We then moved into a 2 double bed room which was massive, it was cleaned every day to a high standard. The location of the hotel was amazing just off broadway and Times square, the only downside is that it is a bit pricey and they dont have tea/coffee maker which is a big must in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing new except lobby”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaLiz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before. It has been many things in the past like Quality Quites hotel. They did have a coffee maker in 2005. Stay Hotel took it out. The bathroom was not swept all four nights I was there. I saw little chuncks of glass threw away one piece and left a piece under the sink to see if they would sweep, never did. Then they have this fire alarm that is like a tiny camera flash that kept me up every night. I can't believe no one else mentioned this. The bathroom light above sink was dark. The bright light was in the shower. So watch out ladies when putting on makeup. The room itself for a small room was about 8 x 8 if that much. I wanted to measure it before I left but forgot. Also, when trying to open the door. The handle needs to be turn upward not downward like you think, like most door handles. Then i had to get someone to come up and show me how since they did not point this out when checking in, so you look goofy in the hallway. So they said to have you Driver License out with key. So I did and after that I nver saw my license again. I was exhauted when I checked in but did not realized it until I got to Macy for free coupon to shop for out of towners, So not until I spoke to a very nice man at the bar next door said to go fill out a police report so i did that night before I left on april 20. The hotel front desk never said anything like that, they are very young people at this hotel. So please watch out what goes on around you. Have a safe trip. If you like a bigger room then you need to go somewhere else. I thought with all the changes they claim to have made I thought the rooms would have been bigger. Also it is just a walk in shower, no tub. So think about those things before getting a room here or ask about the size. Watch out for scams too.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: MdTraveldreamer
Reviews.Content: My friend had booked this hotel on priceline. For the price we paid we were very disappointed. Like so many other reviews our room was really small. We had to practically crawl over the bed to get to the other side. And the view was of a nice brick building, however we could see the M&M World sign if we turned to the side. Once the luggage was on the floor there was very little moving room. The bathroom was also small but for two girls we were able to work around that. Housekeeping only came to the room once during our three night stay and they didn't do anything but leave chocolate and the next day's weather forcast. Elevators were on the small side too but they did have two of them and that helped things a little. Unfortunately the elevator moved slowly and took a little time to get from the 7th floor to the main level. And to get internet in the room, you had to pay an extra $10. On a good note. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were in good condition. Location was great!!! Just off of Times Square and all the broadway shows you can see. I wouldn't tell people to stay away but I would make sure you get a really really good price for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for the dollar!”
Reviews.Author: Pizzagirl09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived late April 14th to check in for our two night stay. We were greeted promptly at the front desk, and checked in very quickly. Our room was a bit on the small side, but as other travellers have stated, we were not in New York to stay in our room. The room itself was very clean, and it had everything we were looking for - a bed and a bathroom. The hotel does provide really nice French amenities in the bathroom and the room also included two bathrobes which I thought was a nice touch for a three star brand. We had no issues regarding hot water - there was plenty of it! There was also a minibar in the room which was well stocked. A flat screen television hung on the wall. The room was kept very clean during our stay. There is a business station downstairs with two computers. We used it once, and it was handy to check emails and local weather. The hotel itself is in a wonderful location. You are literally steps away from Times Square and all it's energy. We were also just a few blocks away from Rockefeller Centre and Radio City Music Hall. Once we started walking around I could not believe how close everything was to this property. There are restaurants within walking distance to meet every budget. We will most definitely be staying here again on our next trip to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual hotel, good value for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: gimpel
Reviews.Content: Stay is a totally renovated older 10 story building on 47th Street near 7th Avenue. The location is excellent for Broadway shows; the half price ticket kiosk is right down the street and the major theaters, as well as many other attractions, are easy walking distance. Many subway lines are nearby, and 47th is a busy commercial stretch with useful inexpensive restaurants for breakfast and quick meals. â€¢ The main disadvantage of Stay is that the rooms are extremely small. My queen standard room was 12' X 12' and most of that taken up by the bed, leaving a narrow strip of carpet to navigate around the room. I was travelling alone so I could manage but even two people would find it close quarters. â€¢ However, the lobby and the rooms are stylish and chic, and my room was very clean. The decor is gray/black/white with touches of burnt orange in silk drapes (covering the narrow window looking onto an air shaft). Very attractive overall. The bed is excellent with nice linens. All the fittings are upscale, big wall-mounted TV. Bathroom, also very small, was perfectly clean, well lit, with step-in shower stall. â€¢ An important plus: the climate control system worked very well, so I could make the room cold to sleep as I prefer, and warm it up quickly in the morning. â€¢ The lobby + bar turns into a noisy, but well-behaved, club in the evenings. Getting a room Not directly above it was good advice from tripadvisor. My 5th floor room was quiet. â€¢ At a good price, as I got from expedia, Style is good value. * This hotel is good if you are on a brief trip, out all day and only in to change clothes and sleep. A longer visit when you may want to use your hotel room more would become uncomfortable in the cramped room. The staff were pleasant and helpful with my questions about subway directions.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, Great location”
Reviews.Author: moekd
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel through priceline, not knowing what we'll get... When we first entered - it looked very stylish. once we got to our room we were very much disappointed - the room was so small - we can't even open the door without it bumping into the bed. There was no floor space at all. When we got our bags in (we had to go down and take them ourselves - the bellboy forgot...) - there was no more room left. The room did look good, impeccable design, cool L'occitane products waiting in the shower and a big screen TV - but no room to move - it was depressing. Even the view from the window was a brick wall... After 10 minutes we asked to switch rooms, they guy at the reception said they had none available - but we can check the next day. Luckily - the next day they found us a bigger room. They even moved our bags there when we were out. the second room was much better, there was even a floor. But not perfect - we had some problems with pluming there. It took the staff 2 days to tend to it. I went to the reception desk 3 times to remind them... they finally got it fixed the evening before we checked out. As for location - the hotel is right next to Times Sq. which was very convenient. 2 minutes walk from the famous â€˜Lindyâ€™sâ€™ (good cheesecake). One more good thing - free internet access to hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better in a big city”
Reviews.Author: sTeamTraen
Reviews.Content: We got a rate which averaged $180 per night, which with tax came to $1050 for a 5-night stay. The location is unbeatable. Only two drawbacks: the rooms are small (but then this is a huge city, and to get a rate like that you have to make compromises), and the noise from the bar goes on until late on Friday and Saturday nights - I'd suggest asking for a room on a higher floor if this will be an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Pipen2
Reviews.Content: hotel stay was a clean modern and central hotel with all the sights of central square on your doorstep. my husband and I spent four nights here and enjoyed it very much. Rooms were small but very clean and beds were comfortable, staff was helpful and would stay here again if we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Patience is a virtue”
Reviews.Author: kabm41
Reviews.Content: Love the decor location. for NYC, the room size is pretty good. When I'm in NYC I don't need a lot of amenities in my hotel as I'm there to change clothes and sleep, not listen to an ipod. However, the service in the dining area is sort of crazy. Everyone was as nice as they could be, but breakfast was cracking us up. A business traveller or someone on a schedule would lose their mind. We ordered eggs and toast and a couple of sides. Got the eggs.and sides. Waited for toast. Asked again for toast. Ate eggs and sides before they got too cold. Asked again for toast. Waited some more. Had lots of coffee. Table was bussed, still no toast. Finally got toast and a fresh set of table ware. The place wasn't busy and our order wasn't complicated. I did notice that other diners seemed to be having the same problem. I can't say I ever had this kind of problem before. Eggs and toast together....what's hard? Otherwise, Stay is great. It could be noisy for some from the late night activity in Aspen, but we weren't especially bothered. The desk help is very pleasant and efficient. Walter is great! I'd recommend Stay but only to people with a sense of humor and a dose of patience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: molinda42
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in an excellent location just of Times Square. Room was small but had everything that was needed. Maid service every day. Some days chocolate and next day weather forecast left in room. Fridge in bedroom. Our room was at the back and had a view of the wall and rubbish that had been thrown on to roof, but at least in was quiet at night. I think if you were at the front of the hotel it would be quiet noisy. Only used the bar once as it was very expensive $22 for one Gin and Tonic and a bottle of beer. Plenty of pubs nearby if you want a cheaper priced drink. Turn left when you leave hotel and the local cafe the Evergreen does an excellent breakfast. We got a good deal as we booked early but may be quite expensive. Staff all very helpful. You can even borrow umbrellas when it rains, but make sure you return it as it would cost you $25 if you dont. Would definitely stay here again if I was to return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!”
Reviews.Author: Funinthecity08
Reviews.Content: We came in on Friday the 13th and was amazed at how close everything was to the hotel. We could not get into our room until 3 but, the staff recommended a great little resturant around the corner. We stayed in room 201 above the resturant but, I must say that we fell asleep rather fast after a busy day on the town. I don't remember it being "too loud" but, to each there own. I on the other hand expected it to be much louder since it is the city that never sleeps. Thank you are your great service, clean rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very friendly...highly recomended..most comfortable sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: traveljnky
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly from the concierge to the maid staff. The hotel was clean. Bed was comforable. Great location to everything. Other ratings mentioned noise from the club downstairs, i was on the 5th floor i had no problem with noise level and i'm a very light sleeper...They even held my bags after i check out so i could finish enjoying the city without having to lug them around with me...overall very satisfied with my stay

Reviews.Title: “If every hotel had staff like this you would never change where you stay!”
Reviews.Author: GaryGToronto
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend for March 12 to 15th. It was our 14 year old's first time in New York. I bid on Priceline and got a good price. I called the hotel, and found though that this was only for one queen sized bed. The young lady I spoke with said that there was no problem and I could upgrade for $50 per night to get 2 doubles. This was great. On our arrival, I found that Priceline had called the hotel, and told them I only needed one bed. The hotel reasonably enough changed it back to one queen. The unfortunate thing was that they were now sold out of rooms with two beds. This was when I met a manager, I believe his name is Patrick (apologize if I've got it incorrect). I heard him on the telephone with Priceline, and he couldn't get an answer as to how this had happened. Obviously we were concerned. Patrick couldn't seem to get satisfaction from Priceline, but quickly found a way to make it right. This made a tough situation quite good. We were very pleased. Now, about the hotel. The location is about 30 paces to Broadway, Times Square, and all the shows. This is ideal for a tourist. Can't say enough. I hadn't flown into Newark in the past, so the day before we attended, I called, and spoke to Walter, the concierge. Can't say enough good things about him. He advised us to take the Coach USA bus from the airport to the Bus Terminal, which is about a 10 minute walk to the hotel. This was $70 round trip for all three of us. Its a good saving, because a lot of the cars or shutles where tolls and tips are extra. The hotel lobby is beautiful. It seems that several times a day they are cleaning it. The rooms were well kept, and the beds were new I think, and very comfortable. The are small as others have written, but we weren't going to play football there anyway. The washroom was fine, and in the morning there was lots of hot water. The Bose radio, and large screen TV are nice touches. There is a bar in the lobby, and I think my wife and I would have had a night cap there, but we were with the 14 year old on this trip, so that was not happening this time. Seemed nice enough though, and liked the music. There is a restaurant, that seemed a little pricey to me.... $16 for coffee and pastry etc, but there is a deli next store, and a good but cheap restaurant only two doors beyond that. We like to go to different places to eat anyway. Back to Walter, the concierge.... if you are there, take advantage of his knowledge, he'll send you to plays, and to great sights. The whole staff treated us like we were special guests. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: morsid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Stay on Friday, March 13th! It was quite our bad luck. We were so happy when we checked in as the location is great and the lobby was very chic. We got there at 2:30 and were told to come back in 30 minutes for a room (check in was 3, so this didn't surprise me although in most hotels in NYC we've been able to get in earlier). We came back at 4 and got room 205 dropped off our stuff and went to dinner and a concert. When we came back at 12:30am and stared walking up the stairs to our room, I knew we were in trouble. We were right above the hotel club - NO ONE warned us about this. The music was obscenely loud. I went back to the front desk and said that we had to be moved as it was way too loud -- I was told, and I still can't believe this was the response - that they would ask the club manager to turn the music down. I went back upstairs furious and my husband and I laid in bed listening to the pounding music. 45 minutes later, I left a "message" for the hotel manager. Someone promptly called back and said they could move us and "upgrade" us to a king size room. Does anyone care at 1:30am if their room is "king sized". We moved and finally fell asleep. The walls are very thin - the next morning we kept hearing what I assume was housekeeping doing something with plastic bags over an over. As we went to leave I noticed there was a note and breakfast vouchers from the hotel. We threw them out as we just wanted to get home and get some sleep. I would NOT recommend this hotel - there are way too many other ones with better service in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: ozman666
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to so many good things, but you can do better elsewhere. Upon our arrival we were told our online booking had not been processed yet, we were asked to take a seat and wait. 40 mins later the lady who asked us to sit down walked passed in street clothes (on her way out) saying it would not be long. After watching numerous people having problems with check in and check out I wished we hadn't pre paid as it was obviously a big mistake to STAY here. A member of staff finally sensed our frustration as we wondered the lobby for the fifth time. He proceeded to explain that we were waiting because the bookings staff finish early on Saturdays (the day before) and that our online booking would take time to process as nobody had checked the booking yet from the previous day. A joke! I explained that staffing issues are not the customers problem, but the managements. This was met with apologies that seem to be so routine that they mean nothing... A hotel that does not check its online bookings because they have nobody to do it?? Any good hotel could have check us in quicker as a walk in! My advise to anyone looking to stay here- Yes its cheap, but you will be better paying a few extra buck to stay at the W just down the road. Or splurge and go for the Bryant park. Some advise to the Hotel- If you screw up a booking, don't make people wait an hour in your lobby when you could set them up in the bar with free drinks (standard in most good hotels). If you do need to sort stuff out before a room can be given, please please use communication, don't ignore the people who pay your bills. The location of Stay is great, but the service is so so substandard for a NY hotel that you really have little chance of survival in the market place unless you sort it out.

Reviews.Title: “The room was only good enough to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: nkdub
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for great location and just some where to sleep for a quick stay, Stay is fine. If you expect more basics, say a hot shower or toiletries, good luck. I would not recommend Stay for any more than a couple of nights if you had to stay here. We stayed 5 and that was way too many for a place you couldn't be comfortable in. The lobby decor is awesome and the room is finished nicely. So, you really WANT to like this place. Check-in went smoothly and I can't comment on the lobby staff other than that because we did not have any other contact with them. Understanding this is Manhattan and space is limited, the room was TINY. There was probably 8 inches from the end of the bed to the wall so you were better off climbing over the bed to get to the other side. 2 suitcases occupied half of all the available floor space. My husband and I are 5'10" and 5'2" and small framed and it was too tight for us to spend any time relaxing in the room. One person might fight it okay. If everything else is good, you could overlook the tight quarters but that was far from the case. If you are not an early riser or early to bed, be warned you will not have hot, or even warm water available to you. We noticed this the first night and it continued to prove itself true the entire trip. This is a REAL problem when you are traveling during the winter and just want a warm shower at the end of the day to help you thaw. Also, sleeping by the window was very uncomfortable because the window is probably original to the building. The silk curtains do nothing to stop the cold air from creating a freezing draft all night. Cleanliness: old does not turn me off but a few other things made me not want to think about what they did or did not do at the hotel. First of all, everything I picked up from the floor (bags, socks...) had long blonde hair sticking to it. Neither of us have long or blonde hair. The slate tiles in the bathroom had a good deal of white buildup but the while subway tiles and grout looked fine. But the basics of wiping the sink or mirror while you stayed were not attended to. Toiletries: Good thing I pack my own just in case. 1st day: We had shampoo, conditioner and body wash the first night. No bar soap to wash your hands with or lotion; but they did have 2 chocolates on the bed. 2nd day: they did not leave a new shampoo, conditioner or body wash but we did get a bar soap. No chocolates, no lotion. They took our used wash cloths and did not leave any new ones. 3rd day: A lotion finally and chocolates again but nothing else even though the toiletries were all used up. 4th day: New shampoo, conditioner and body wash finally. No lotion, no chocolates. 5th day: A bag of bar soaps left on the bed. Overall, no rhyme or reason. A few other notes: there was no iPod dock. The safe is the small standard kind they have everywhere-big enough for a wallet or two but definitely not your laptop. The internet was supposed to be included in the package I bought online but that was not honored. They wanted an additional $19.95/day. The lighting in the whole place is very dim-it sets a great mood but makes getting ready in the morning (putting on makeup) impossible. It was not a horrible experience. I just wouldn't recommend it unless you got it for cheap- $125ish and only that much because of its location. We paid with taxes and such almost $200/night- Definitely not worth that.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly, a wonderful place to 'STAY'!”
Reviews.Author: mlk14
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest, when I placed my bid for a hotel in NYC on priceline.com, I was a little worried when "Stay" emerged as the hotel that was selected for my weekend of lisure and shopping. I had not heard of this boutique establishment prior to this. Much to my surprise, I was very happy with the accomodations. Service was commendable, location perfect (close proximity to Times Square) and the room spotless. I would highly recommend 'Stay' as a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service, Nice (but) SMALL Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Neuby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The location is great and the service was good. The rooms on the other hand, were tiny. The amenities were nice and the beds were comfortable, but the space was very, very small. The overall value was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh. A Painful Stay at Stay.”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaForTravelers
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Stay for Valentine's Day weekend. We arrived later in the evening (9pm). We checked in and immediately jumped in a cab to make our dinner reservations. The doorman would not hail a cab for us. When we returned at 1:30am, we discovered that our TV didn't work. When we called the front desk, they told us to push the power button on the top of the TV. After a few minutes of searching, we found the power button on the bottom of the TV (it's one of the fancy flatscreens where buttons are hidden). The TV turned on, but the remote was out of batteries. It took three visits from a hotel staffer to get the right batteries. Each time he left, he let the door slam. The hotel is small and the walls are thin. I'm sure our neighbors weren't pleased. I know I was upset the next night when a few drunk girls from the bar downstairs come up to the 7th floor shouting and letting doors slam. The TV had five channels, not the normal standard cable package. The next day, we woke up to take a shower to find that there was no soap, shampoo or other toiletries. We called down to the front desk and they sent up a housekeeper with four bottles of shampoo and nothing else. Despite the Do Not Disturb message, the housekeepers came knocking. We asked them to come back later, which they never did. Our room didn't have the amenities that the hotel advertises: stereo system with ipod cradle (nope), l'occitane toiletries (nope), iron (nope), HBO channel (nope), staff committed to a restful stay (nope). And finally, when we checked out and asked for our car (had been valet parked by the hotel), the charge was $45 per day, rather than the $35 they quoted me on the phone. The beds and pillows were super comfortable, but the rest of the stay was not ideal. The location is great if you're in NYC to go to shows.

Reviews.Title: “Awful 'old' place”
Reviews.Author: sammy856
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an old building that was just renovated in order to make it look pretty but it has none of the basis requirements that a business traveller or for that matter any traveller would be looking for. The rooms are dingy and small with very little lighting. They seemed to have crammed in as many rooms on each floor so as to maximize revenue. The service is not particularly good. The elevators are terrible and old. They just seem to have taken an old building and made cosmetic changes to make it look aesthetically appealing but it does not provide any comfort which is what one expects from a hotel. What do I need to look at a fancy lobby for??? It makes no sense if there is bad service and bad facilities. I'm going back to the Helmsley which although more expensive, provides ammenities and space that you would expect from a hotel. The Stay is just not a real hotel. It was built I think back in the 30's and is just an old building with old facilities but wrapped in glitter. I had recommended the hotel to my other business colleagues and I am embarassed that I made such a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “will 'STAY' again!”
Reviews.Author: spootgrl
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location in the city. Its less than one block away from the famous TKTS booth and almost smack dab in the middle of Times Square. The staff is very friendly and helped out a lot with planning and made great suggestions on food and entertainment options. The hotel itself is beautiful and has a fun little bar/restaurant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Hotel is Pure Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Mistiza3
Reviews.Content: I recently visited New York City for a girlfriend's 30th Birthday and booked a room at Stay Hotel, Manhattan's newest luxury hotel. Having stayed at The Time, NYC in the past, I decided to try out the new sister hotel. The staff is extremely helpful and very accommodating. The hotel's interior design instantly give you the feel of pure relaxation and the comfortable bed and pillows allow you to relax away from the hustle and bustle of the city at the end of the day. It is also very conveniently located in the heart of Time Square. While in town, we attended a showing of Wicked and found it very easy to walk to (even in the bitter cold!). Aspen Social Club, located at the bottom of the hotel, was a great nightlife spot. We enjoyed listening to the sounds of the DJ while sipping on cocktails before and after our Broadway show. The DJ spun top 40 hits and had the entire crowd singing and dancing. I highly recommend visiting Stay Hotel for your next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad...”
Reviews.Author: PaulfromPortugal
Reviews.Content: DATE:28/01/2009 Reviewer:A TripAdvisor Member, PORTUGAL Great location... Elevators? not so slow... Staff? fine with me... very nice space(lobby,aspen club) Rooms?ok...maybe a little bit bigger will do no harm..but i dont go to NY to stay at the hotel.. Next time to NY?probably STAY Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all....”
Reviews.Author: OsloMike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to have a short break in New York. We arrived in Mid Jan for 5 nights. The hotel we selected was a good choice, I feel. On W47th street, in the diamond district, but just off Times Square. From the outside it is not much to look at. The street is pretty shabby, dirty, and of course, noisy. But inside, it is another story. It has a great lobby. Love the fish in the giant tanks! And of course, since it was January, there were few guests, so it was quick and easy to check in and out. Small issues to be mentioned include the very noisy intercom systems that the hotel staff use in the hallways on each floor. The sound of their talking via the system penetrates very easily through the door and can easily wake you. In fact, I would have to say that noise was the biggest issue I have with this hotel. Not that you can really blame them for it, since after all, ambulances make a lot of noise, and if you can hear street noise easily that is just to be expected. Even six floors up. What is NOT expected however, is to be able to hear and even feel the music coming from the hotel bar until the very small hours. Around 4 in the morning, to be precise! But even with these concerns, the staff were friendly, helpful and certainly helped to make our stay pleasant. The room was very nice, and we even got a free upgrade to a bigger room. All in all, I was pleased with the choice of hotel, and if I intended to visit New York again, I would most definately stay with Stay again. It is very centrally located, easy to find, and very good value. At least in January!

Reviews.Title: “Stay within your budget at Stay”
Reviews.Author: orangekoi
Reviews.Content: I do a fair amount of business travel for a company that is exceptionally cost-conscious. It is difficult to find decent lodging in NYC while staying within the travel budget allocated me, but i managed to do it, (and even with a dash of style!) at Stay. Upon entry, I found the lobby decor to be updated and very pleasing -- i like the aquariums in the seating area, which were a calming sight after the ruckus of the NY streets! The staff was limited and overworked when I arrived, but they were still gracious and accomodating, though obviously tired. I was able to get into my room at the unheard of hour of 11am, which was a huge bonus, as any business traveler knows. There are only 2 elevators at Stay, and both are quite small. It didn't prove to be an issue, but you will spend some time waiting for them. I liked the color scheme of the room (orange is a favorite!), and though the quarters were tight even in my "Large" room with a king-size bed (which is typical for NYC), the rate was just $220, which is exceptionally reasonable for the Times Square area of Manhattan. I found the bed to be very comfortable, with nice sheets and a fluffy duvet. It was great that there was an actual closet in the room, a large flat-screen tv on the wall, and the blackout shades on the windows were awesome. The hotel's updated phone system was also really nice because a digital touchscreen allowed you to set your own wakeup calls & such, and the tone of the alarm was actually pleasant to wake to. The bathroom isn't as tiny as in some hotels of this level I've stayed at, but it isn't grand by any stretch. There was only a shower, no tub, but the shower itself was spacious enough & its interior was updated with tiled walls and a slate floor that ran thru the entire bathroom. The hotel features L'Occitane products, which was also a nice little surprise. The issue i had with the bathroom is that there is a pedestal sink with no counter space, only a very tiny glass ledge beneath the mirror for your toiletries & "stuff" -- the sloped forward tank lid on the toilet didn't afford any more surface-area for toiletry items! However, everything was very clean, and there were extra towels in the bathroom, always a plus! Do note that if noise bothers you, you should definitely request a room on a higher floor -- Aspen is the very cool bar on the ground floor of the hotel that was surprisingly busy until at least 4am....and was also surprisingly loud in my 3rd floor room on my first night there! With earplugs in and the room's fan turned on high, i could still clearly hear a very methodical thump of bass and the music from the bar most of the night, which didn't bode well for getting any sleep. I requested a move the next day, which was very politely acommodated (i'm sure they get that a LOT...) and i then had no problems with noise in my new room on the 8th floor. All in all, I'd definitely stay at Stay again...it fit my budget yet didn't feel bare bones, old or dirty like many of the other hotels within this price range that I've stayed at in this area.

Reviews.Title: “NYC...Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Enigmablue
Reviews.Content: We booked this ages ago for NYE in NYC solely based on price and location! Then i read the TA reviews and nearly changed our booking before we left Oz however i'm glad we didn't. We stayed 5 nights (27th Dec to 1st Jan) and after 5 weeks in other 4/5 star hotels elsewhere i thought it held its own. Yes it's all true...the small rooms, the slow lifts, the random housekeeping, the 'porno' hallway lighting but hey it's NYC and you don't come to this amazing city to dwell on the negatives of your hotel. It's a great location right on Times Sq, funky but expensive bar downstairs (every time we ordered 2 drinks it came to $20 no matter what we chose to drink), free net access, cool tv's, comfy but compact beds and some neat decor in the rooms. We stayed in room 915 and our frends in 921. 915 was a corner room with the luxury of a small hanging wardrobe which our mates were envious of!! They also were near the lift and it could be a little noisy. Renos on Floor 10 seem to have stopped for xmas but it looks like their nearly finished. If your extremely fussy, overweight, very tall, claustrophobic or just like to moan then don't stay here. It may not suit families and the oldies either given the pumping bar scene in the Aspen lounge. If you can get a good deal, like a comfy bed and want to be in the heart of NYC and all it has to offer then this is perfect for a short stay! Other NYC highlights....Juniors on 8th for Pancake Breakfast, walking to all the sights, Stay is near the start of the hop on-hop off bus tour and close to the subway. PS I'd also recommend Soho rather than 5th Avenue/Macys for shopping!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is brill, don't know what the rest of you are on about!”
Reviews.Author: Jenna_9
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anybody, from when we arrived to when we left it was fantastic. Yeh our room was small, why would that bother you when your out seeing the city and shopping. You only sleep there. We were in the smallest room and trust me you could move, it was ideal for 2people. The Decor is gourgous, the location is so good, you literally walk out the hotel turn right and your in Times square. Oh and there wass a hair dryer in my room. Alot of people were complaining about the lifts dont let that bother you its just because its always busy, it isn't that bad, oviously alot of people go over the top when explaining things, or should I say moaning about things. If anyone has booked to go, don't worry you will have a ball and will be impressed.

HotelInfo.Name: Stay.
HotelInfo.Address: 157 West 47 Street, (between 6th & 7th Avenues), New York City, NY 10036
